1 /*
  2  * jsPlumb
  3  * 
  4  * Title:jsPlumb 1.3.15
  5  * 
  6  * Provides a way to visually connect elements on an HTML page, using either SVG, Canvas
  7  * elements, or VML.  
  8  * 
  9  * This file contains the util functions
 10  *
 11  * Copyright (c) 2010 - 2012 Simon Porritt (http://jsplumb.org)
 12  * 
 13  * http://jsplumb.org
 14  * http://github.com/sporritt/jsplumb
 15  * http://code.google.com/p/jsplumb
 16  * 
 17  * Dual licensed under the MIT and GPL2 licenses.
 18  */
 19 jsPlumbUtil = {
 20 	isArray : function(a) {
 21 		return Object.prototype.toString.call(a) === "[object Array]";	
 22 	},
 23 	isString : function(s) {
 24 		return typeof s === "string";
 25 	},
 26 	isBoolean: function(s) {
 27 		return typeof s === "boolean";
 28 	},
 29 	isObject : function(o) {
 30 		return Object.prototype.toString.call(o) === "[object Object]";	
 31 	},
 32 	isDate : function(o) {
 33 		return Object.prototype.toString.call(o) === "[object Date]";
 34 	},
 35 	isFunction: function(o) {
 36 		return Object.prototype.toString.call(o) === "[object Function]";
 37 	},
 38 	clone : function(a) {
 39 		if (this.isString(a)) return new String(a);
 40 		else if (this.isBoolean(a)) return new Boolean(a);
 41 		else if (this.isDate(a)) return new Date(a.getTime());
 42 		else if (this.isFunction(a)) return a;
 43 		else if (this.isArray(a)) {
 44 			var b = [];
 45 			for (var i = 0; i < a.length; i++)
 46 				b.push(this.clone(a[i]));
 47 			return b;
 48 		}
 49 		else if (this.isObject(a)) {
 50 			var b = {};
 51 			for (var i in a)
 52 				b[i] = this.clone(a[i]);
 53 			return b;		
 54 		}
 55 		else return a;
 56 	},
 57 	merge : function(a, b) {		
 58 		var c = this.clone(a);		
 59 		for (var i in b) {
 60 			if (c[i] == null || this.isString(b[i]) || this.isBoolean(b[i]))
 61 				c[i] = b[i];
 62 			else {
 63 				if (this.isArray(b[i]) && this.isArray(c[i])) {
 64 					var ar = [];
 65 					ar.push.apply(ar, c[i]);
 66 					ar.push.apply(ar, b[i]);
 67 					c[i] = ar;
 68 				}
 69 				else if(this.isObject(c[i]) && this.isObject(b[i])) {												
 70 					for (var j in b[i])
 71 						c[i][j] = b[i][j];
 72 				}
 73 			}
 74 		}
 75 		return c;
 76 	},
 77 	convertStyle : function(s, ignoreAlpha) {
 78 		// TODO: jsPlumb should support a separate 'opacity' style member.
 79 		if ("transparent" === s) return s;
 80 		var o = s,
 81 		    pad = function(n) { return n.length == 1 ? "0" + n : n; },
 82 		    hex = function(k) { return pad(Number(k).toString(16)); },
 83 		    pattern = /(rgb[a]?\()(.*)(\))/;
 84 		if (s.match(pattern)) {
 85 			var parts = s.match(pattern)[2].split(",");
 86 			o = "#" + hex(parts[0]) + hex(parts[1]) + hex(parts[2]);
 87 			if (!ignoreAlpha && parts.length == 4) 
 88 				o = o + hex(parts[3]);
 89 		}
 90 		return o;
 91 	},
 92 	gradient : function(p1, p2) {
 93 		p1 = jsPlumbUtil.isArray(p1) ? p1 : [p1.x, p1.y];
 94 		p2 = jsPlumbUtil.isArray(p2) ? p2 : [p2.x, p2.y];			
 95 		return (p2[1] - p1[1]) / (p2[0] - p1[0]);		
 96 	},
 97 	normal : function(p1, p2) {
 98 		return -1 / jsPlumbUtil.gradient(p1,p2);
 99 	},
100 	lineLength : function(p1, p2) {
101 		p1 = jsPlumbUtil.isArray(p1) ? p1 : [p1.x, p1.y];
102 		p2 = jsPlumbUtil.isArray(p2) ? p2 : [p2.x, p2.y];			
103 		return Math.sqrt(Math.pow(p2[1] - p1[1], 2) + Math.pow(p2[0] - p1[0], 2));			
104 	},
105     segment : function(p1, p2) {
106         p1 = jsPlumbUtil.isArray(p1) ? p1 : [p1.x, p1.y];
107         p2 = jsPlumbUtil.isArray(p2) ? p2 : [p2.x, p2.y];
108         if (p2[0] > p1[0]) {
109             return (p2[1] > p1[1]) ? 2 : 1;
110         }
111         else {
112             return (p2[1] > p1[1]) ? 3 : 4;
113         }
114     },
115     intersects : function(r1, r2) {
116     	var x1 = r1.x, x2 = r1.x + r1.w, y1 = r1.y, y2 = r1.y + r1.h,
117     		a1 = r2.x, a2 = r2.x + r2.w, b1 = r2.y, b2 = r2.y + r2.h;
118     		
119     	return  ( (x1 <= a1 && a1 <= x2) && (y1 <= b1 && b1 <= y2) ) ||
120     			( (x1 <= a2 && a2 <= x2) && (y1 <= b1 && b1 <= y2) ) ||
121     			( (x1 <= a1 && a1 <= x2) && (y1 <= b2 && b2 <= y2) ) ||
122     			( (x1 <= a2 && a1 <= x2) && (y1 <= b2 && b2 <= y2) ) ||
123     			
124     			( (a1 <= x1 && x1 <= a2) && (b1 <= y1 && y1 <= b2) ) ||
125     			( (a1 <= x2 && x2 <= a2) && (b1 <= y1 && y1 <= b2) ) ||
126     			( (a1 <= x1 && x1 <= a2) && (b1 <= y2 && y2 <= b2) ) ||
127     			( (a1 <= x2 && x1 <= a2) && (b1 <= y2 && y2 <= b2) );
128     },
129     segmentMultipliers : [null, [1, -1], [1, 1], [-1, 1], [-1, -1] ],
130     inverseSegmentMultipliers : [null, [-1, -1], [-1, 1], [1, 1], [1, -1] ],
131 	pointOnLine : function(fromPoint, toPoint, distance) {
132         var m = jsPlumbUtil.gradient(fromPoint, toPoint),
133             s = jsPlumbUtil.segment(fromPoint, toPoint),
134 		    segmentMultiplier = distance > 0 ? jsPlumbUtil.segmentMultipliers[s] : jsPlumbUtil.inverseSegmentMultipliers[s],
135 			theta = Math.atan(m),
136     		y = Math.abs(distance * Math.sin(theta)) * segmentMultiplier[1],
137 			x =  Math.abs(distance * Math.cos(theta)) * segmentMultiplier[0];
138 		return { x:fromPoint.x + x, y:fromPoint.y + y };
139 	},
140     /**
141      * calculates a perpendicular to the line fromPoint->toPoint, that passes through toPoint and is 'length' long.
142      * @param fromPoint
143      * @param toPoint
144      * @param length
145      */
146 	perpendicularLineTo : function(fromPoint, toPoint, length) {
147 		var m = jsPlumbUtil.gradient(fromPoint, toPoint),
148             theta2 = Math.atan(-1 / m),
149     		y =  length / 2 * Math.sin(theta2),
150 			x =  length / 2 * Math.cos(theta2);
151 		return [{x:toPoint.x + x, y:toPoint.y + y}, {x:toPoint.x - x, y:toPoint.y - y}];
152 	},
153 	findWithFunction : function(a, f) {
154     	if (a)
155   			for (var i = 0; i < a.length; i++) if (f(a[i])) return i;
156 		return -1;
157 	},
158 	indexOf : function(l, v) {
159 		return jsPlumbUtil.findWithFunction(l, function(_v) { return _v == v; });	
160 	},
161     removeWithFunction : function(a, f) {
162         var idx = jsPlumbUtil.findWithFunction(a, f);
163         if (idx > -1) a.splice(idx, 1);
164         return idx != -1;
165     },
166     remove : function(l, v) {
167     	var idx = jsPlumbUtil.indexOf(l, v);	
168     	if (idx > -1) l.splice(idx, 1);
169         return idx != -1;
170     },
171     // TODO support insert index
172     addWithFunction : function(list, item, hashFunction) {
173         if (jsPlumbUtil.findWithFunction(list, hashFunction) == -1) list.push(item);
174     },
175 	addToList : function(map, key, value) {
176 		var l = map[key];
177 		if (l == null) {
178 			l = [], map[key] = l;
179 		}
180 		l.push(value);
181 		return l;
182 	},
183 	/**
184 	 * EventGenerator
185 	 * Superclass for objects that generate events - jsPlumb extends this, as does jsPlumbUIComponent, which all the UI elements extend.
186 	 */
187 	EventGenerator : function() {
188 		var _listeners = {}, self = this;
189 		
190 		// this is a list of events that should re-throw any errors that occur during their dispatch. as of 1.3.0 this is private to
191 		// jsPlumb, but it seems feasible that people might want to manipulate this list.  the thinking is that we don't want event
192 		// listeners to bring down jsPlumb - or do we.  i can't make up my mind about this, but i know i want to hear about it if the "ready"
193 		// event fails, because then my page has most likely not initialised.  so i have this halfway-house solution.  it will be interesting
194 		// to hear what other people think.
195 		var eventsToDieOn = [ "ready" ];
196 							    
197 		/*
198 		 * Binds a listener to an event.  
199 		 * 
200 		 * Parameters:
201 		 * 	event		-	name of the event to bind to.
202 		 * 	listener	-	function to execute.
203 		 */
204 		this.bind = function(event, listener) {
205 			jsPlumbUtil.addToList(_listeners, event, listener);		
206 			return self;		
207 		};
208 		/*
209 		 * Fires an update for the given event.
210 		 * 
211 		 * Parameters:
212 		 * 	event				-	event to fire
213 		 * 	value				-	value to pass to the event listener(s).
214 		 *  originalEvent	 	- 	the original event from the browser
215 		 */			
216 		this.fire = function(event, value, originalEvent) {
217 			if (_listeners[event]) {
218 				for ( var i = 0; i < _listeners[event].length; i++) {
219 					// doing it this way rather than catching and then possibly re-throwing means that an error propagated by this
220 					// method will have the whole call stack available in the debugger.
221 					if (jsPlumbUtil.findWithFunction(eventsToDieOn, function(e) { return e === event}) != -1)
222 						_listeners[event][i](value, originalEvent);
223 					else {
224 						// for events we don't want to die on, catch and log.
225 						try {
226 							_listeners[event][i](value, originalEvent);
227 						} catch (e) {
228 							jsPlumbUtil.log("jsPlumb: fire failed for event " + event + " : " + e);
229 						}
230 					}
231 				}
232 			}
233 			return self;
234 		};
235 		/*
236 		 * Clears either all listeners, or listeners for some specific event.
237 		 * 
238 		 * Parameters:
239 		 * 	event	-	optional. constrains the clear to just listeners for this event.
240 		 */
241 		this.unbind = function(event) {
242 			if (event)
243 				delete _listeners[event];
244 			else {
245 				_listeners = {};
246 			}
247 			return self;
248 		};
249 		
250 		this.getListener = function(forEvent) {
251 			return _listeners[forEvent];
252 		};		
253 	},
254 	logEnabled : true,
255 	log : function() {
256 	    if (jsPlumbUtil.logEnabled && typeof console != "undefined") {
257             try {
258                 var msg = arguments[arguments.length - 1];
259 			    console.log(msg);
260             }
261             catch (e) {} 
262         }
263 	},
264 	group : function(g) { if (jsPlumbUtil.logEnabled && typeof console != "undefined") console.group(g); },
265 	groupEnd : function(g) { if (jsPlumbUtil.logEnabled && typeof console != "undefined") console.groupEnd(g); },
266 	time : function(t) { if (jsPlumbUtil.logEnabled && typeof console != "undefined") console.time(t); },
267 	timeEnd : function(t) { if (jsPlumbUtil.logEnabled && typeof console != "undefined") console.timeEnd(t); }
268 };/*
269  * jsPlumb
270  * 
271  * Title:jsPlumb 1.3.15
272  * 
273  * Provides a way to visually connect elements on an HTML page, using either SVG, Canvas
274  * elements, or VML.  
275  * 
276  * This file contains the base functionality for DOM type adapters. 
277  *
278  * Copyright (c) 2010 - 2012 Simon Porritt (http://jsplumb.org)
279  * 
280  * http://jsplumb.org
281  * http://github.com/sporritt/jsplumb
282  * http://code.google.com/p/jsplumb
283  * 
284  * Dual licensed under the MIT and GPL2 licenses.
285  */
286 ;(function() {
287     
288 		var canvasAvailable = !!document.createElement('canvas').getContext,
289 		svgAvailable = !!window.SVGAngle || document.implementation.hasFeature("http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG11/feature#BasicStructure", "1.1"),
290 		// http://stackoverflow.com/questions/654112/how-do-you-detect-support-for-vml-or-svg-in-a-browser
291 		vmlAvailable = function() {		    
292 				if (vmlAvailable.vml == undefined) { 
293 						var a = document.body.appendChild(document.createElement('div'));
294 		        a.innerHTML = '<v:shape id="vml_flag1" adj="1" />';
295 		        var b = a.firstChild;
296 		        b.style.behavior = "url(#default#VML)";
297 		        vmlAvailable.vml = b ? typeof b.adj == "object": true;
298 		        a.parentNode.removeChild(a);
299 				}
300 				return vmlAvailable.vml;
301 		};
302         
303     /**
304 		Manages dragging for some instance of jsPlumb.
305 	*/
306 	var DragManager = function(_currentInstance) {		
307 		var _draggables = {}, _dlist = [], _delements = {}, _elementsWithEndpoints = {};
308 
309         /**
310             register some element as draggable.  right now the drag init stuff is done elsewhere, and it is
311             possible that will continue to be the case.
312         */
313 		this.register = function(el) {
314             var jpcl = jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary;
315             el = jpcl.getElementObject(el);
316             var id = _currentInstance.getId(el),
317                 domEl = jpcl.getDOMElement(el),
318                 parentOffset = jpcl.getOffset(el);
319                     
320             if (!_draggables[id]) {
321                 _draggables[id] = el;
322                 _dlist.push(el);
323                 _delements[id] = {};
324             }
325 				
326 			// look for child elements that have endpoints and register them against this draggable.
327 			var _oneLevel = function(p, startOffset) {
328                 if (p) {											
329                     for (var i = 0; i < p.childNodes.length; i++) {
330                         if (p.childNodes[i].nodeType != 3) {
331                             var cEl = jpcl.getElementObject(p.childNodes[i]),
332                                 cid = _currentInstance.getId(cEl, null, true);
333                             if (cid && _elementsWithEndpoints[cid] && _elementsWithEndpoints[cid] > 0) {
334                                 var cOff = jpcl.getOffset(cEl);
335                                 _delements[id][cid] = {
336                                     id:cid,
337                                     offset:{
338                                         left:cOff.left - parentOffset.left,
339                                         top:cOff.top - parentOffset.top
340                                     }
341                                 };
342                             }
343                             _oneLevel(p.childNodes[i]);
344                         }	
345                     }
346                 }
347 			};
348 
349 			_oneLevel(domEl);
350 		};
351 
352 		/**
353 			notification that an endpoint was added to the given el.  we go up from that el's parent
354 			node, looking for a parent that has been registered as a draggable. if we find one, we add this
355 			el to that parent's list of elements to update on drag (if it is not there already)
356 		*/
357 		this.endpointAdded = function(el) {
358 			var jpcl = jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary, b = document.body, id = _currentInstance.getId(el), c = jpcl.getDOMElement(el), 
359 				p = c.parentNode, done = p == b;
360 
361 			_elementsWithEndpoints[id] = _elementsWithEndpoints[id] ? _elementsWithEndpoints[id] + 1 : 1;
362 
363 			while (p != b) {
364 				var pid = _currentInstance.getId(p, null, true);
365 				if (pid && _draggables[pid]) {
366 					var idx = -1, pEl = jpcl.getElementObject(p), pLoc = jpcl.getOffset(pEl);
367 					
368 					if (_delements[pid][id] == null) {
369 						var cLoc = jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.getOffset(el);
370 						_delements[pid][id] = {
371 							id:id,
372 							offset:{
373 								left:cLoc.left - pLoc.left,
374 								top:cLoc.top - pLoc.top
375 							}
376 						};
377 					}
378 					break;
379 				}
380 				p = p.parentNode;
381 			}	
382 		};
383 
384 		this.endpointDeleted = function(endpoint) {
385 			if (_elementsWithEndpoints[endpoint.elementId]) {
386 				_elementsWithEndpoints[endpoint.elementId]--;
387 				if (_elementsWithEndpoints[endpoint.elementId] <= 0) {
388 					for (var i in _delements) {
389 						delete _delements[i][endpoint.elementId];
390 					}
391 				}
392 			}		
393 		};
394 
395 		this.getElementsForDraggable = function(id) {
396 			return _delements[id];	
397 		};
398 
399 		this.reset = function() {
400 			_draggables = {};
401 			_dlist = [];
402 			_delements = {};
403 			_elementsWithEndpoints = {};
404 		};
405 		
406 	};
407         
408     // for those browsers that dont have it.  they still don't have it! but at least they won't crash.
409 	if (!window.console)
410 		window.console = { time:function(){}, timeEnd:function(){}, group:function(){}, groupEnd:function(){}, log:function(){} };
411             
412     window.jsPlumbAdapter = {
413         
414         headless:false,
415         
416         appendToRoot : function(node) {
417             document.body.appendChild(node);
418         },
419         getRenderModes : function() {
420             return [ "canvas", "svg", "vml" ]
421         },
422         isRenderModeAvailable : function(m) {
423             return {
424                 "canvas":canvasAvailable,
425                 "svg":svgAvailable,
426                 "vml":vmlAvailable()
427             }[m];
428         },
429         getDragManager : function(_jsPlumb) {
430             return new DragManager(_jsPlumb);
431         },
432         setRenderMode : function(mode) {
433             var renderMode;
434             
435             if (mode) {
436 				mode = mode.toLowerCase();            
437 			            
438                 var canvasAvailable = this.isRenderModeAvailable("canvas"),
439                     svgAvailable = this.isRenderModeAvailable("svg"),
440                     vmlAvailable = this.isRenderModeAvailable("vml");
441                 
442                 //if (mode !== jsPlumb.CANVAS && mode !== jsPlumb.SVG && mode !== jsPlumb.VML) throw new Error("render mode must be one of jsPlumb.CANVAS, jsPlumb.SVG or jsPlumb.VML");
443                 // now test we actually have the capability to do this.						
444                 if (mode === "svg") {
445                     if (svgAvailable) renderMode = "svg"
446                     else if (canvasAvailable) renderMode = "canvas"
447                     else if (vmlAvailable) renderMode = "vml"
448                 }
449                 else if (mode === "canvas" && canvasAvailable) renderMode = "canvas";
450                 else if (vmlAvailable) renderMode = "vml";
451             }
452 
453 			return renderMode;
454         }
455     };
456     
457 })();/*
458  * jsPlumb
459  * 
460  * Title:jsPlumb 1.3.15
461  * 
462  * Provides a way to visually connect elements on an HTML page, using either SVG, Canvas
463  * elements, or VML.  
464  * 
465  * This file contains the jsPlumb core code.
466  *
467  * Copyright (c) 2010 - 2012 Simon Porritt (simon.porritt@gmail.com)
468  * 
469  * http://jsplumb.org
470  * http://github.com/sporritt/jsplumb
471  * http://code.google.com/p/jsplumb
472  * 
473  * Dual licensed under the MIT and GPL2 licenses.
474  */
475 
476 ;(function() {
477 	
478 	/**
479 	 * Class:jsPlumb
480 	 * The jsPlumb engine, registered as a static object in the window.  This object contains all of the methods you will use to
481 	 * create and maintain Connections and Endpoints.
482 	 */	
483 	
484     var _findWithFunction = jsPlumbUtil.findWithFunction,
485 	_indexOf = jsPlumbUtil.indexOf,
486     _removeWithFunction = jsPlumbUtil.removeWithFunction,
487     _remove = jsPlumbUtil.remove,
488     // TODO support insert index
489     _addWithFunction = jsPlumbUtil.addWithFunction,
490     _addToList = jsPlumbUtil.addToList,
491 	/**
492 		an isArray function that even works across iframes...see here:
493 		
494 		http://tobyho.com/2011/01/28/checking-types-in-javascript/
495 
496 		i was originally using "a.constructor == Array" as a test.
497 	*/
498 	_isArray = jsPlumbUtil.isArray,
499 	_isString = jsPlumbUtil.isString,
500 	_isObject = jsPlumbUtil.isObject;
501 		
502 	var _connectionBeingDragged = null,
503 		_getAttribute = function(el, attName) { return jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.getAttribute(_getElementObject(el), attName); },
504 		_setAttribute = function(el, attName, attValue) { jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.setAttribute(_getElementObject(el), attName, attValue); },
505 		_addClass = function(el, clazz) { jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.addClass(_getElementObject(el), clazz); },
506 		_hasClass = function(el, clazz) { return jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.hasClass(_getElementObject(el), clazz); },
507 		_removeClass = function(el, clazz) { jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.removeClass(_getElementObject(el), clazz); },
508 		_getElementObject = function(el) { return jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.getElementObject(el); },
509 		_getOffset = function(el, _instance) {
510             var o = jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.getOffset(_getElementObject(el));
511             if (_instance != null) {
512                 var z = _instance.getZoom();
513                 return {left:o.left / z, top:o.top / z };    
514             }
515             else
516                 return o;
517         },		
518 		_getSize = function(el) {
519             return jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.getSize(_getElementObject(el));
520         },
521 		_log = jsPlumbUtil.log,
522 		_group = jsPlumbUtil.group,
523 		_groupEnd = jsPlumbUtil.groupEnd,
524 		_time = jsPlumbUtil.time,
525 		_timeEnd = jsPlumbUtil.timeEnd,
526 		
527 		/**
528 		 * creates a timestamp, using milliseconds since 1970, but as a string.
529 		 */
530 		_timestamp = function() { return "" + (new Date()).getTime(); },
531 		
532 		/*
533 		 * Class:jsPlumbUIComponent
534 		 * Abstract superclass for UI components Endpoint and Connection.  Provides the abstraction of paintStyle/hoverPaintStyle,
535 		 * and also extends jsPlumbUtil.EventGenerator to provide the bind and fire methods.
536 		 */
537 		jsPlumbUIComponent = function(params) {
538 			var self = this, 
539 				a = arguments, 
540 				_hover = false, 
541 				parameters = params.parameters || {}, 
542 				idPrefix = self.idPrefix,
543 				id = idPrefix + (new Date()).getTime(),
544 				paintStyle = null,
545 				hoverPaintStyle = null;
546 
547 			self._jsPlumb = params["_jsPlumb"];			
548 			self.getId = function() { return id; };
549 			self.tooltip = params.tooltip;
550 			self.hoverClass = params.hoverClass || self._jsPlumb.Defaults.HoverClass || jsPlumb.Defaults.HoverClass;				
551 			
552 			// all components can generate events
553 			jsPlumbUtil.EventGenerator.apply(this);
554 			// all components get this clone function.
555 			// TODO issue 116 showed a problem with this - it seems 'a' that is in
556 			// the clone function's scope is shared by all invocations of it, the classic
557 			// JS closure problem.  for now, jsPlumb does a version of this inline where 
558 			// it used to call clone.  but it would be nice to find some time to look
559 			// further at this.
560 			this.clone = function() {
561 				var o = new Object();
562 				self.constructor.apply(o, a);
563 				return o;
564 			};
565 			
566 			this.getParameter = function(name) { return parameters[name]; },
567 			this.getParameters = function() { 
568 				return parameters; 
569 			},
570 			this.setParameter = function(name, value) { parameters[name] = value; },
571 			this.setParameters = function(p) { parameters = p; },			
572 			this.overlayPlacements = [];			
573 			
574 			// user can supply a beforeDetach callback, which will be executed before a detach
575 			// is performed; returning false prevents the detach.
576 			var beforeDetach = params.beforeDetach;
577 			this.isDetachAllowed = function(connection) {
578 				var r = self._jsPlumb.checkCondition("beforeDetach", connection );
579 				if (beforeDetach) {
580 					try { 
581 						r = beforeDetach(connection); 
582 					}
583 					catch (e) { _log("jsPlumb: beforeDetach callback failed", e); }
584 				}
585 				return r;
586 			};
587 			
588 			// user can supply a beforeDrop callback, which will be executed before a dropped
589 			// connection is confirmed. user can return false to reject connection.
590 			var beforeDrop = params.beforeDrop;
591 			this.isDropAllowed = function(sourceId, targetId, scope, connection, dropEndpoint) {
592 				var r = self._jsPlumb.checkCondition("beforeDrop", { 
593 					sourceId:sourceId, 
594 					targetId:targetId, 
595 					scope:scope,
596 					connection:connection,
597 					dropEndpoint:dropEndpoint 
598 				});
599 				if (beforeDrop) {
600 					try { 
601 						r = beforeDrop({ 
602 							sourceId:sourceId, 
603 							targetId:targetId, 
604 							scope:scope, 
605 							connection:connection,
606 							dropEndpoint:dropEndpoint
607 						}); 
608 					}
609 					catch (e) { _log("jsPlumb: beforeDrop callback failed", e); }
610 				}
611 				return r;
612 			};
613 			
614 			// helper method to update the hover style whenever it, or paintStyle, changes.
615 			// we use paintStyle as the foundation and merge hoverPaintStyle over the
616 			// top.
617 			var _updateHoverStyle = function() {
618 				if (paintStyle && hoverPaintStyle) {
619 					var mergedHoverStyle = {};
620 					jsPlumb.extend(mergedHoverStyle, paintStyle);
621 					jsPlumb.extend(mergedHoverStyle, hoverPaintStyle);
622 					delete self["hoverPaintStyle"];
623 					// we want the fillStyle of paintStyle to override a gradient, if possible.
624 					if (mergedHoverStyle.gradient && paintStyle.fillStyle)
625 						delete mergedHoverStyle["gradient"];
626 					hoverPaintStyle = mergedHoverStyle;
627 				}
628 			};
629 			
630 			/*
631 		     * Sets the paint style and then repaints the element.
632 		     * 
633 		     * Parameters:
634 		     * 	style - Style to use.
635 		     */
636 		    this.setPaintStyle = function(style, doNotRepaint) {
637 		    	paintStyle = style;
638 		    	self.paintStyleInUse = paintStyle;
639 		    	_updateHoverStyle();
640 		    	if (!doNotRepaint) self.repaint();
641 		    };
642 
643 		    /**
644 		    * Gets the component's paint style.
645 		    *
646 		    * Returns:
647 		    * the component's paint style. if there is no hoverPaintStyle set then this will be the paint style used all the time, otherwise this is the style used when the mouse is not hovering.
648 		    */
649 		    this.getPaintStyle = function() {
650 		    	return paintStyle;
651 		    };
652 		    
653 		    /*
654 		     * Sets the paint style to use when the mouse is hovering over the element. This is null by default.
655 		     * The hover paint style is applied as extensions to the paintStyle; it does not entirely replace
656 		     * it.  This is because people will most likely want to change just one thing when hovering, say the
657 		     * color for example, but leave the rest of the appearance the same.
658 		     * 
659 		     * Parameters:
660 		     * 	style - Style to use when the mouse is hovering.
661 		     *  doNotRepaint - if true, the component will not be repainted.  useful when setting things up initially.
662 		     */
663 		    this.setHoverPaintStyle = function(style, doNotRepaint) {		    	
664 		    	hoverPaintStyle = style;
665 		    	_updateHoverStyle();
666 		    	if (!doNotRepaint) self.repaint();
667 		    };
668 
669 		    /**
670 		    * Gets the component's hover paint style.
671 		    *
672 		    * Returns:
673 		    * the component's hover paint style. may be null.
674 		    */
675 		    this.getHoverPaintStyle = function() {
676 		    	return hoverPaintStyle;
677 		    };
678 		    
679 		    /*
680 		     * sets/unsets the hover state of this element.
681 		     * 
682 		     * Parameters:
683 		     * 	hover - hover state boolean
684 		     * 	ignoreAttachedElements - if true, does not notify any attached elements of the change in hover state.  used mostly to avoid infinite loops.
685 		     */
686 		    this.setHover = function(hover, ignoreAttachedElements, timestamp) {
687 		    	// while dragging, we ignore these events.  this keeps the UI from flashing and
688 		    	// swishing and whatevering.
689 				if (!self._jsPlumb.currentlyDragging && !self._jsPlumb.isHoverSuspended()) {
690 		    
691 			    	_hover = hover;
692 					if (self.hoverClass != null && self.canvas != null) {
693 						if (hover) 
694 							jpcl.addClass(self.canvas, self.hoverClass);						
695 						else
696 							jpcl.removeClass(self.canvas, self.hoverClass);
697 					}
698 		   		 	if (hoverPaintStyle != null) {
699 						self.paintStyleInUse = hover ? hoverPaintStyle : paintStyle;
700 						timestamp = timestamp || _timestamp();
701 						self.repaint({timestamp:timestamp, recalc:false});
702 					}
703 					// get the list of other affected elements, if supported by this component.
704 					// for a connection, its the endpoints.  for an endpoint, its the connections! surprise.
705 					if (self.getAttachedElements && !ignoreAttachedElements)
706 						_updateAttachedElements(hover, _timestamp(), self);
707 				}
708 		    };
709 		    
710 		    this.isHover = function() { return _hover; };
711 			
712 			var zIndex = null;
713 			this.setZIndex = function(v) { zIndex = v; };
714 			this.getZIndex = function() { return zIndex; };
715 
716 			var jpcl = jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary,
717 				events = [ "click", "dblclick", "mouseenter", "mouseout", "mousemove", "mousedown", "mouseup", "contextmenu" ],
718 				eventFilters = { "mouseout":"mouseexit" },
719 				bindOne = function(o, c, evt) {
720 					var filteredEvent = eventFilters[evt] || evt;
721 					jpcl.bind(o, evt, function(ee) {
722 						c.fire(filteredEvent, c, ee);
723 					});
724 				},
725 				unbindOne = function(o, evt) {
726 					var filteredEvent = eventFilters[evt] || evt;
727 					jpcl.unbind(o, evt);
728 				};
729 		    
730 		    this.attachListeners = function(o, c) {
731 				for (var i = 0; i < events.length; i++) {
732 					bindOne(o, c, events[i]); 			
733 				}
734 			};
735 		    
736 		    var _updateAttachedElements = function(state, timestamp, sourceElement) {
737 		    	var affectedElements = self.getAttachedElements();		// implemented in subclasses
738 		    	if (affectedElements) {
739 		    		for (var i = 0; i < affectedElements.length; i++) {
740 		    			if (!sourceElement || sourceElement != affectedElements[i])
741 		    				affectedElements[i].setHover(state, true, timestamp);			// tell the attached elements not to inform their own attached elements.
742 		    		}
743 		    	}
744 		    };
745 		    
746 		    this.reattachListenersForElement = function(o) {
747 			    if (arguments.length > 1) {
748 		    		for (var i = 0; i < events.length; i++)
749 		    			unbindOne(o, events[i]);
750 			    	for (var i = 1; i < arguments.length; i++)
751 		    			self.attachListeners(o, arguments[i]);
752 		    	}
753 		    };
754 			
755 			/*
756 			 * TYPES
757 			 */
758 			var _types = [],
759 				_splitType = function(t) { return t == null ? null : t.split(" ")},				
760 				_applyTypes = function(doNotRepaint) {
761 					if (self.getDefaultType) {
762 						var td = self.getTypeDescriptor();
763 							
764 						var o = jsPlumbUtil.merge({}, self.getDefaultType());
765 						for (var i = 0; i < _types.length; i++)
766 							o = jsPlumbUtil.merge(o, self._jsPlumb.getType(_types[i], td));						
767 					
768 						self.applyType(o);					
769 						if (!doNotRepaint) self.repaint();
770 					}
771 				};
772 				
773 			self.setType = function(typeId, doNotRepaint) {				
774 				_types = _splitType(typeId) || [];
775 				_applyTypes(doNotRepaint);									
776 			};
777 			
778 			/*
779 			 * Function : getType
780 			 * Gets the 'types' of this component.
781 			 */
782 			self.getType = function() {
783 				return _types;
784 			};
785 			
786 			self.hasType = function(typeId) {
787 				return jsPlumbUtil.indexOf(_types, typeId) != -1;
788 			};
789 			
790 			self.addType = function(typeId, doNotRepaint) {
791 				var t = _splitType(typeId), _cont = false;
792 				if (t != null) {
793 					for (var i = 0; i < t.length; i++) {
794 						if (!self.hasType(t[i])) {
795 							_types.push(t[i]);
796 							_cont = true;						
797 						}
798 					}
799 					if (_cont) _applyTypes(doNotRepaint);
800 				}
801 			};
802 			
803 			self.removeType = function(typeId, doNotRepaint) {
804 				var t = _splitType(typeId), _cont = false, _one = function(tt) {
805 					var idx = jsPlumbUtil.indexOf(_types, tt);
806 					if (idx != -1) {
807 						_types.splice(idx, 1);
808 						return true;
809 					}
810 					return false;
811 				};
812 				
813 				if (t != null) {
814 					for (var i = 0; i < t.length; i++) {
815 						_cont = _one(t[i]) || _cont;
816 					}
817 					if (_cont) _applyTypes(doNotRepaint);
818 				}
819 			};
820 			
821 			self.toggleType = function(typeId, doNotRepaint) {
822 				var t = _splitType(typeId);
823 				if (t != null) {
824 					for (var i = 0; i < t.length; i++) {
825 						var idx = jsPlumbUtil.indexOf(_types, t[i]);
826 						if (idx != -1)
827 							_types.splice(idx, 1);
828 						else
829 							_types.push(t[i]);
830 					}
831 						
832 					_applyTypes(doNotRepaint);
833 				}
834 			};
835 			
836 			this.applyType = function(t) {
837 				self.setPaintStyle(t.paintStyle);				
838 				self.setHoverPaintStyle(t.hoverPaintStyle);
839 				if (t.parameters){
840 					for (var i in t.parameters)
841 						self.setParameter(i, t.parameters[i]);
842 				}
843 			};
844 			
845 		},
846 
847 		overlayCapableJsPlumbUIComponent = function(params) {
848 			jsPlumbUIComponent.apply(this, arguments);
849 			var self = this;			
850 			this.overlays = [];
851 
852 			var processOverlay = function(o) {
853 				var _newOverlay = null;
854 				if (_isArray(o)) {	// this is for the shorthand ["Arrow", { width:50 }] syntax
855 					// there's also a three arg version:
856 					// ["Arrow", { width:50 }, {location:0.7}] 
857 					// which merges the 3rd arg into the 2nd.
858 					var type = o[0],
859 						// make a copy of the object so as not to mess up anyone else's reference...
860 						p = jsPlumb.extend({component:self, _jsPlumb:self._jsPlumb}, o[1]);
861 					if (o.length == 3) jsPlumb.extend(p, o[2]);
862 					_newOverlay = new jsPlumb.Overlays[self._jsPlumb.getRenderMode()][type](p);
863 					if (p.events) {
864 						for (var evt in p.events) {
865 							_newOverlay.bind(evt, p.events[evt]);
866 						}
867 					}
868 				} else if (o.constructor == String) {
869 					_newOverlay = new jsPlumb.Overlays[self._jsPlumb.getRenderMode()][o]({component:self, _jsPlumb:self._jsPlumb});
870 				} else {
871 					_newOverlay = o;
872 				}										
873 					
874 				self.overlays.push(_newOverlay);
875 			},
876 			calculateOverlaysToAdd = function(params) {
877 				var defaultKeys = self.defaultOverlayKeys || [],
878 					o = params.overlays,
879 					checkKey = function(k) {
880 						return self._jsPlumb.Defaults[k] || jsPlumb.Defaults[k] || [];
881 					};
882 				
883 				if (!o) o = [];
884 
885 				for (var i = 0; i < defaultKeys.length; i++)
886 					o.unshift.apply(o, checkKey(defaultKeys[i]));
887 				
888 				return o;
889 			}
890 
891 			var _overlays = calculateOverlaysToAdd(params);//params.overlays || self._jsPlumb.Defaults.Overlays;
892 			if (_overlays) {
893 				for (var i = 0; i < _overlays.length; i++) {
894 					processOverlay(_overlays[i]);
895 				}
896 			}
897 
898 		    // overlay finder helper method
899 			var _getOverlayIndex = function(id) {
900 				var idx = -1;
901 				for (var i = 0; i < self.overlays.length; i++) {
902 					if (id === self.overlays[i].id) {
903 						idx = i;
904 						break;
905 					}
906 				}
907 				return idx;
908 			};
909 						
910 			this.addOverlay = function(overlay, doNotRepaint) { 
911 				processOverlay(overlay); 
912 				if (!doNotRepaint) self.repaint();
913 			};
914 						
915 			this.getOverlay = function(id) {
916 				var idx = _getOverlayIndex(id);
917 				return idx >= 0 ? self.overlays[idx] : null;
918 			};
919 			
920 			this.getOverlays = function() {
921 				return self.overlays;
922 			};			
923 			
924 			this.hideOverlay = function(id) {
925 				var o = self.getOverlay(id);
926 				if (o) o.hide();
927 			};
928 
929 			this.hideOverlays = function() {
930 				for (var i = 0; i < self.overlays.length; i++)
931 					self.overlays[i].hide();
932 			};
933 						
934 			this.showOverlay = function(id) {
935 				var o = self.getOverlay(id);
936 				if (o) o.show();
937 			};
938 
939 			this.showOverlays = function() {
940 				for (var i = 0; i < self.overlays.length; i++)
941 					self.overlays[i].show();
942 			};
943 			
944 			this.removeAllOverlays = function() {
945 				for (var i = 0; i < self.overlays.length; i++) {
946 					if (self.overlays[i].cleanup) self.overlays[i].cleanup();
947 				}
948 
949 				self.overlays.splice(0, self.overlays.length);
950 				self.repaint();
951 			};
952 						
953 			this.removeOverlay = function(overlayId) {
954 				var idx = _getOverlayIndex(overlayId);
955 				if (idx != -1) {
956 					var o = self.overlays[idx];
957 					if (o.cleanup) o.cleanup();
958 					self.overlays.splice(idx, 1);
959 				}
960 			};
961 						
962 			this.removeOverlays = function() {
963 				for (var i = 0; i < arguments.length; i++)
964 					self.removeOverlay(arguments[i]);
965 			};
966 
967 			// this is a shortcut helper method to let people add a label as
968 			// overlay.			
969 			var _internalLabelOverlayId = "__label",
970 			_makeLabelOverlay = function(params) {
971 
972 				var _params = {
973 					cssClass:params.cssClass,
974 					labelStyle : this.labelStyle,					
975 					id:_internalLabelOverlayId,
976 					component:self,
977 					_jsPlumb:self._jsPlumb
978 				},
979 				mergedParams = jsPlumb.extend(_params, params);
980 
981 				return new jsPlumb.Overlays[self._jsPlumb.getRenderMode()].Label( mergedParams );
982 			};
983 			if (params.label) {
984 				var loc = params.labelLocation || self.defaultLabelLocation || 0.5,
985 					labelStyle = params.labelStyle || self._jsPlumb.Defaults.LabelStyle || jsPlumb.Defaults.LabelStyle;			
986 				this.overlays.push(_makeLabelOverlay({
987 					label:params.label,
988 					location:loc,
989 					labelStyle:labelStyle
990 				}));
991 			}
992 
993 			
994 			this.setLabel = function(l) {
995 				var lo = self.getOverlay(_internalLabelOverlayId);
996 				if (!lo) {
997 					var params = l.constructor == String || l.constructor == Function ? { label:l } : l;
998 					lo = _makeLabelOverlay(params);	
999 					this.overlays.push(lo);
1000 				}
1001 				else {
1002 					if (l.constructor == String || l.constructor == Function) lo.setLabel(l);
1003 					else {
1004 						if (l.label) lo.setLabel(l.label);
1005 						if (l.location) lo.setLocation(l.location);
1006 					}
1007 				}
1008 				
1009 				if (!self._jsPlumb.isSuspendDrawing()) 
1010 					self.repaint();
1011 			};
1012 
1013 			
1014 			this.getLabel = function() {
1015 				var lo = self.getOverlay(_internalLabelOverlayId);
1016 				return lo != null ? lo.getLabel() : null;
1017 			};
1018 
1019 			
1020 			this.getLabelOverlay = function() {
1021 				return self.getOverlay(_internalLabelOverlayId);
1022 			};
1023 			
1024 			var superAt = this.applyType;
1025 			this.applyType = function(t) {
1026 				superAt(t);
1027 				self.removeAllOverlays();
1028 				if (t.overlays) {
1029 					for (var i = 0; i < t.overlays.length; i++)
1030 						self.addOverlay(t.overlays[i], true);
1031 				}
1032 			};
1033 		},
1034 		
1035 		_bindListeners = function(obj, _self, _hoverFunction) {
1036         	obj.bind("click", function(ep, e) { _self.fire("click", _self, e); });
1037 			obj.bind("dblclick", function(ep, e) { _self.fire("dblclick", _self, e); });
1038 	        obj.bind("contextmenu", function(ep, e) { _self.fire("contextmenu", _self, e); });
1039 			obj.bind("mouseenter", function(ep, e) {
1040 				if (!_self.isHover()) {
1041 	                _hoverFunction(true);
1042 					_self.fire("mouseenter", _self, e);
1043 				}
1044 			});
1045 			obj.bind("mouseexit", function(ep, e) {
1046 				if (_self.isHover()) {
1047 	                _hoverFunction(false);
1048 					_self.fire("mouseexit", _self, e);
1049 				}
1050 			});	
1051         };	
1052 		
1053 		var _jsPlumbInstanceIndex = 0,
1054 			getInstanceIndex = function() {
1055 				var i = _jsPlumbInstanceIndex + 1;
1056 				_jsPlumbInstanceIndex++;
1057 				return i;
1058 			};
1059 
1060 		var jsPlumbInstance = function(_defaults) {
1061 		
1062 		/*
1063 		 * Property: Defaults 
1064 		 * 
1065 		 * These are the default settings for jsPlumb.  They are what will be used if you do not supply specific pieces of information 
1066 		 * to the various API calls. A convenient way to implement your own look and feel can be to override these defaults 
1067 		 * by including a script somewhere after the jsPlumb include, but before you make any calls to jsPlumb.
1068 		 * 
1069 		 * Properties:
1070 		 * 	-	*Anchor*				    The default anchor to use for all connections (both source and target). Default is "BottomCenter".
1071 		 * 	-	*Anchors*				    The default anchors to use ([source, target]) for all connections. Defaults are ["BottomCenter", "BottomCenter"].
1072 		 *  -   *ConnectionsDetachable*		Whether or not connections are detachable by default (using the mouse). Defaults to true.
1073 		 *  -   *ConnectionOverlays*		The default overlay definitions for Connections. Defaults to an empty list.
1074 		 * 	-	*Connector*				The default connector definition to use for all connections.  Default is "Bezier".
1075 		 * 	-   *ConnectorZIndex*       Optional value for the z-index of Connections that are not in the hover state. If you set this, jsPlumb will set the z-index of all created Connections to be this value, and the z-index of any Connections in the hover state to be this value plus one. This brings hovered connections up on top of others, which is a nice effect in busy UIs.
1076 		 *  -   *Container*				Optional selector or element id that instructs jsPlumb to append elements it creates to a specific element.
1077 		 * 	-	*DragOptions*			The default drag options to pass in to connect, makeTarget and addEndpoint calls. Default is empty.
1078 		 * 	-	*DropOptions*			The default drop options to pass in to connect, makeTarget and addEndpoint calls. Default is empty.
1079 		 * 	-	*Endpoint*				The default endpoint definition to use for all connections (both source and target).  Default is "Dot".
1080 		 *  -   *EndpointOverlays*		The default overlay definitions for Endpoints. Defaults to an empty list.
1081 		 * 	-	*Endpoints*				The default endpoint definitions ([ source, target ]) to use for all connections.  Defaults are ["Dot", "Dot"].
1082 		 * 	-	*EndpointStyle*			The default style definition to use for all endpoints. Default is fillStyle:"#456".
1083 		 * 	-	*EndpointStyles*		The default style definitions ([ source, target ]) to use for all endpoints.  Defaults are empty.
1084 		 * 	-	*EndpointHoverStyle*	The default hover style definition to use for all endpoints. Default is null.
1085 		 * 	-	*EndpointHoverStyles*	The default hover style definitions ([ source, target ]) to use for all endpoints. Defaults are null.
1086 		 * 	-	*HoverPaintStyle*		The default hover style definition to use for all connections. Defaults are null.
1087 		 * 	-	*LabelStyle*			The default style to use for label overlays on connections.
1088 		 * 	-	*LogEnabled*			Whether or not the jsPlumb log is enabled. defaults to false.
1089 		 * 	-	*Overlays*				The default overlay definitions (for both Connections and Endpoint). Defaults to an empty list.
1090 		 * 	-	*MaxConnections*		The default maximum number of connections for an Endpoint.  Defaults to 1.		 
1091 		 * 	-	*PaintStyle*			The default paint style for a connection. Default is line width of 8 pixels, with color "#456".
1092 		 * 	-	*ReattachConnections*	Whether or not to reattach Connections that a user has detached with the mouse and then dropped. Default is false.
1093 		 * 	-	*RenderMode*			What mode to use to paint with.  If you're on IE<9, you don't really get to choose this.  You'll just get VML.  Otherwise, the jsPlumb default is to use SVG.
1094 		 * 	-	*Scope*				The default "scope" to use for connections. Scope lets you assign connections to different categories. 
1095 		 */
1096 		this.Defaults = {
1097 			Anchor : "BottomCenter",
1098 			Anchors : [ null, null ],
1099             ConnectionsDetachable : true,
1100             ConnectionOverlays : [ ],
1101             Connector : "Bezier",
1102 			ConnectorZIndex : null,
1103 			Container : null,
1104 			DragOptions : { },
1105 			DropOptions : { },
1106 			Endpoint : "Dot",
1107 			EndpointOverlays : [ ],
1108 			Endpoints : [ null, null ],
1109 			EndpointStyle : { fillStyle : "#456" },
1110 			EndpointStyles : [ null, null ],
1111 			EndpointHoverStyle : null,
1112 			EndpointHoverStyles : [ null, null ],
1113 			HoverPaintStyle : null,
1114 			LabelStyle : { color : "black" },
1115 			LogEnabled : false,
1116 			Overlays : [ ],
1117 			MaxConnections : 1, 
1118 			PaintStyle : { lineWidth : 8, strokeStyle : "#456" },            
1119 			ReattachConnections:false,
1120 			RenderMode : "svg",
1121 			Scope : "jsPlumb_DefaultScope"
1122 		};
1123 		if (_defaults) jsPlumb.extend(this.Defaults, _defaults);
1124 		
1125 		this.logEnabled = this.Defaults.LogEnabled;
1126 		
1127 		var _connectionTypes = { }, _endpointTypes = {};
1128 		this.registerConnectionType = function(id, type) {
1129 			_connectionTypes[id] = jsPlumb.extend({}, type);
1130 		};
1131 		this.registerConnectionTypes = function(types) {
1132 			for (var i in types)
1133 				_connectionTypes[i] = jsPlumb.extend({}, types[i]);
1134 		};
1135 		this.registerEndpointType = function(id, type) {
1136 			_endpointTypes[id] = jsPlumb.extend({}, type);
1137 		};
1138 		this.registerEndpointTypes = function(types) {
1139 			for (var i in types)
1140 				_endpointTypes[i] = jsPlumb.extend({}, types[i]);
1141 		};
1142 		this.getType = function(id, typeDescriptor) {
1143 			return typeDescriptor ===  "connection" ? _connectionTypes[id] : _endpointTypes[id];
1144 		};
1145 
1146 		jsPlumbUtil.EventGenerator.apply(this);
1147 		var _currentInstance = this,
1148 			_instanceIndex = getInstanceIndex(),
1149 			_bb = _currentInstance.bind,
1150 			_initialDefaults = {},
1151             _zoom = 1;
1152             
1153         this.setZoom = function(z, repaintEverything) {
1154             _zoom = z;
1155             if (repaintEverything) _currentInstance.repaintEverything();
1156         };
1157         this.getZoom = function() { return _zoom; };
1158 
1159 		for (var i in this.Defaults)
1160 			_initialDefaults[i] = this.Defaults[i];
1161 
1162 		this.bind = function(event, fn) {		
1163 			if ("ready" === event && initialized) fn();
1164 			else _bb.apply(_currentInstance,[event, fn]);
1165 		};
1166   
1167 		_currentInstance.importDefaults = function(d) {
1168 			for (var i in d) {
1169 				_currentInstance.Defaults[i] = d[i];
1170 			}	
1171 		};
1172 		
1173 		_currentInstance.restoreDefaults = function() {
1174 			_currentInstance.Defaults = jsPlumb.extend({}, _initialDefaults);
1175 		};
1176 		
1177     var log = null,
1178         resizeTimer = null,
1179         initialized = false,
1180         connectionsByScope = {},
1181         /**
1182          * map of element id -> endpoint lists. an element can have an arbitrary
1183          * number of endpoints on it, and not all of them have to be connected
1184          * to anything.
1185          */
1186         endpointsByElement = {},
1187         endpointsByUUID = {},
1188         offsets = {},
1189         offsetTimestamps = {},
1190         floatingConnections = {},
1191         draggableStates = {},		
1192         canvasList = [],
1193         sizes = [],
1194         //listeners = {}, // a map: keys are event types, values are lists of listeners.
1195         DEFAULT_SCOPE = this.Defaults.Scope,
1196         renderMode = null,  // will be set in init()							
1197 
1198 		/**
1199 		 * helper method to add an item to a list, creating the list if it does
1200 		 * not yet exist.
1201 		 */
1202 		_addToList = function(map, key, value) {
1203 			var l = map[key];
1204 			if (l == null) {
1205 				l = [];
1206 				map[key] = l;
1207 			}
1208 			l.push(value);
1209 			return l;
1210 		},
1211 
1212 		/**
1213 		 * appends an element to some other element, which is calculated as follows:
1214 		 * 
1215 		 * 1. if _currentInstance.Defaults.Container exists, use that element.
1216 		 * 2. if the 'parent' parameter exists, use that.
1217 		 * 3. otherwise just use the root element (for DOM usage, the document body).
1218 		 * 
1219 		 */
1220 		_appendElement = function(el, parent) {
1221 			if (_currentInstance.Defaults.Container)
1222 				jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.appendElement(el, _currentInstance.Defaults.Container);
1223 			else if (!parent)
1224 				//document.body.appendChild(el);
1225 				jsPlumbAdapter.appendToRoot(el);
1226 			else
1227 				jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.appendElement(el, parent);
1228 		},
1229 
1230 		_curIdStamp = 1,
1231 		_idstamp = function() { return "" + _curIdStamp++; },		
1232 		
1233 		/**
1234 		 * YUI, for some reason, put the result of a Y.all call into an object that contains
1235 		 * a '_nodes' array, instead of handing back an array-like object like the other
1236 		 * libraries do.
1237 		 */
1238 		_convertYUICollection = function(c) {
1239 			return c._nodes ? c._nodes : c;
1240 		},                
1241 
1242 		/**
1243 		 * Draws an endpoint and its connections. this is the main entry point into drawing connections as well
1244 		 * as endpoints, since jsPlumb is endpoint-centric under the hood.
1245 		 * 
1246 		 * @param element element to draw (of type library specific element object)
1247 		 * @param ui UI object from current library's event system. optional.
1248 		 * @param timestamp timestamp for this paint cycle. used to speed things up a little by cutting down the amount of offset calculations we do.
1249 		 */
1250 		_draw = function(element, ui, timestamp) {
1251 			
1252 			// TOD is it correct to filter by headless at this top level? how would a headless adapter ever repaint?
1253             if (!jsPlumbAdapter.headless && !_suspendDrawing) {
1254 			    var id = _getAttribute(element, "id"),
1255 			    	repaintEls = _currentInstance.dragManager.getElementsForDraggable(id);			    
1256 
1257 			    if (timestamp == null) timestamp = _timestamp();
1258 
1259 			    _currentInstance.anchorManager.redraw(id, ui, timestamp);
1260 
1261 			    if (repaintEls) {
1262 				    for (var i in repaintEls) {
1263 						_currentInstance.anchorManager.redraw(repaintEls[i].id, ui, timestamp, repaintEls[i].offset);			    	
1264 				    }
1265 				}
1266             }
1267 		},
1268 
1269 		/**
1270 		 * executes the given function against the given element if the first
1271 		 * argument is an object, or the list of elements, if the first argument
1272 		 * is a list. the function passed in takes (element, elementId) as
1273 		 * arguments.
1274 		 */
1275 		_elementProxy = function(element, fn) {
1276 			var retVal = null;
1277 			if (_isArray(element)) {
1278 				retVal = [];
1279 				for ( var i = 0; i < element.length; i++) {
1280 					var el = _getElementObject(element[i]), id = _getAttribute(el, "id");
1281 					retVal.push(fn(el, id)); // append return values to what we will return
1282 				}
1283 			} else {
1284 				var el = _getElementObject(element), id = _getAttribute(el, "id");
1285 				retVal = fn(el, id);
1286 			}
1287 			return retVal;
1288 		},				
1289 
1290 		/**
1291 		 * gets an Endpoint by uuid.
1292 		 */
1293 		_getEndpoint = function(uuid) { return endpointsByUUID[uuid]; },
1294 
1295 		/**
1296 		 * inits a draggable if it's not already initialised.
1297 		 */
1298 		_initDraggableIfNecessary = function(element, isDraggable, dragOptions) {
1299 			// TODO move to DragManager?
1300 			if (!jsPlumbAdapter.headless) {
1301 				var draggable = isDraggable == null ? false : isDraggable,
1302 					jpcl = jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary;
1303 				if (draggable) {
1304 					if (jpcl.isDragSupported(element) && !jpcl.isAlreadyDraggable(element)) {
1305 						var options = dragOptions || _currentInstance.Defaults.DragOptions || jsPlumb.Defaults.DragOptions;
1306 						options = jsPlumb.extend( {}, options); // make a copy.
1307 						var dragEvent = jpcl.dragEvents["drag"],
1308 							stopEvent = jpcl.dragEvents["stop"],
1309 							startEvent = jpcl.dragEvents["start"];
1310 	
1311 						options[startEvent] = _wrap(options[startEvent], function() {
1312 							_currentInstance.setHoverSuspended(true);
1313 						});
1314 	
1315 						options[dragEvent] = _wrap(options[dragEvent], function() {                            
1316 							var ui = jpcl.getUIPosition(arguments, _currentInstance.getZoom());
1317 							_draw(element, ui);
1318 							_addClass(element, "jsPlumb_dragged");
1319 						});
1320 						options[stopEvent] = _wrap(options[stopEvent], function() {
1321 							var ui = jpcl.getUIPosition(arguments, _currentInstance.getZoom());
1322 							_draw(element, ui);
1323 							_removeClass(element, "jsPlumb_dragged");
1324 							_currentInstance.setHoverSuspended(false);
1325 						});
1326 						var elId = _getId(element); // need ID
1327 						draggableStates[elId] = true;  
1328 						var draggable = draggableStates[elId];
1329 						options.disabled = draggable == null ? false : !draggable;
1330 						jpcl.initDraggable(element, options, false);
1331 						_currentInstance.dragManager.register(element);
1332 					}
1333 				}
1334 			}
1335 		},
1336 		
1337 		/*
1338 		* prepares a final params object that can be passed to _newConnection, taking into account defaults, events, etc.
1339 		*/
1340 		_prepareConnectionParams = function(params, referenceParams) {
1341 			var _p = jsPlumb.extend( {
1342 				sourceIsNew:true,
1343 				targetIsNew:true
1344 			}, params);
1345 			if (referenceParams) jsPlumb.extend(_p, referenceParams);
1346 			
1347 			// hotwire endpoints passed as source or target to sourceEndpoint/targetEndpoint, respectively.
1348 			if (_p.source && _p.source.endpoint) _p.sourceEndpoint = _p.source;
1349 			if (_p.source && _p.target.endpoint) _p.targetEndpoint = _p.target;
1350 			
1351 			// test for endpoint uuids to connect
1352 			if (params.uuids) {
1353 				_p.sourceEndpoint = _getEndpoint(params.uuids[0]);
1354 				_p.targetEndpoint = _getEndpoint(params.uuids[1]);
1355 			}						
1356 
1357 			// now ensure that if we do have Endpoints already, they're not full.
1358 			// source:
1359 			if (_p.sourceEndpoint && _p.sourceEndpoint.isFull()) {
1360 				_log(_currentInstance, "could not add connection; source endpoint is full");
1361 				return;
1362 			}
1363 
1364 			// target:
1365 			if (_p.targetEndpoint && _p.targetEndpoint.isFull()) {
1366 				_log(_currentInstance, "could not add connection; target endpoint is full");
1367 				return;
1368 			}
1369 			
1370 			// at this point, if we have source or target Endpoints, they were not new and we should mark the
1371 			// flag to reflect that.  this is for use later with the deleteEndpointsOnDetach flag.
1372 			if (_p.sourceEndpoint) _p.sourceIsNew = false;
1373 			if (_p.targetEndpoint) _p.targetIsNew = false;
1374 			
1375 			// if source endpoint mandates connection type and nothing specified in our params, use it.
1376 			if (!_p.type && _p.sourceEndpoint)
1377 				_p.type = _p.sourceEndpoint.connectionType;
1378 			
1379 			// copy in any connectorOverlays that were specified on the source endpoint.
1380 			// it doesnt copy target endpoint overlays.  i'm not sure if we want it to or not.
1381 			if (_p.sourceEndpoint && _p.sourceEndpoint.connectorOverlays) {
1382 				_p.overlays = _p.overlays || [];
1383 				for (var i = 0; i < _p.sourceEndpoint.connectorOverlays.length; i++) {
1384 					_p.overlays.push(_p.sourceEndpoint.connectorOverlays[i]);
1385 				}
1386 			}			
1387 			
1388 			// tooltip.  params.tooltip takes precedence, then sourceEndpoint.connectorTooltip.
1389 			_p.tooltip = params.tooltip;
1390 			if (!_p.tooltip && _p.sourceEndpoint && _p.sourceEndpoint.connectorTooltip)
1391 				_p.tooltip = _p.sourceEndpoint.connectorTooltip;
1392 			
1393 			// if there's a target specified (which of course there should be), and there is no
1394 			// target endpoint specified, and 'newConnection' was not set to true, then we check to
1395 			// see if a prior call to makeTarget has provided us with the specs for the target endpoint, and
1396 			// we use those if so.  additionally, if the makeTarget call was specified with 'uniqueEndpoint' set
1397 			// to true, then if that target endpoint has already been created, we re-use it.
1398 			if (_p.target && !_p.target.endpoint && !_p.targetEndpoint && !_p.newConnection) {				
1399 				var tid = _getId(_p.target),
1400 					tep =_targetEndpointDefinitions[tid],
1401 					existingUniqueEndpoint = _targetEndpoints[tid];				
1402 
1403 				if (tep) {			
1404 					// if target not enabled, return.
1405 					if (!_targetsEnabled[tid]) return;
1406 
1407 					// check for max connections??						
1408 					var newEndpoint = existingUniqueEndpoint != null ? existingUniqueEndpoint : _currentInstance.addEndpoint(_p.target, tep);
1409 					if (_targetEndpointsUnique[tid]) _targetEndpoints[tid] = newEndpoint;
1410 					 _p.targetEndpoint = newEndpoint;
1411 					 newEndpoint._makeTargetCreator = true;
1412 					 _p.targetIsNew = true;
1413 				}
1414 			}
1415 
1416 			// same thing, but for source.
1417 			if (_p.source && !_p.source.endpoint && !_p.sourceEndpoint && !_p.newConnection) {
1418 				var tid = _getId(_p.source),
1419 					tep = _sourceEndpointDefinitions[tid],
1420 					existingUniqueEndpoint = _sourceEndpoints[tid];				
1421 
1422 				if (tep) {
1423 					// if source not enabled, return.					
1424 					if (!_sourcesEnabled[tid]) return;
1425 				
1426 					var newEndpoint = existingUniqueEndpoint != null ? existingUniqueEndpoint : _currentInstance.addEndpoint(_p.source, tep);
1427 					if (_sourceEndpointsUnique[tid]) _sourceEndpoints[tid] = newEndpoint;
1428 					 _p.sourceEndpoint = newEndpoint;
1429 					 _p.sourceIsNew = true;
1430 				}
1431 			}
1432 			
1433 			return _p;
1434 		},
1435 		
1436 		_newConnection = function(params) {
1437 			var connectionFunc = _currentInstance.Defaults.ConnectionType || _currentInstance.getDefaultConnectionType(),
1438 			    endpointFunc = _currentInstance.Defaults.EndpointType || Endpoint,
1439 			    parent = jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.getParent;
1440 			
1441 			if (params.container)
1442 				params["parent"] = params.container;
1443 			else {
1444 				if (params.sourceEndpoint)
1445 					params["parent"] = params.sourceEndpoint.parent;
1446 				else if (params.source.constructor == endpointFunc)
1447 					params["parent"] = params.source.parent;
1448 				else params["parent"] = parent(params.source);
1449 			}
1450 			
1451 			params["_jsPlumb"] = _currentInstance;
1452 			var con = new connectionFunc(params);
1453 			con.id = "con_" + _idstamp();
1454 			_eventFireProxy("click", "click", con);
1455 			_eventFireProxy("dblclick", "dblclick", con);
1456             _eventFireProxy("contextmenu", "contextmenu", con);
1457 			return con;
1458 		},
1459 		
1460 		/**
1461 		* adds the connection to the backing model, fires an event if necessary and then redraws
1462 		*/
1463 		_finaliseConnection = function(jpc, params, originalEvent) {
1464             params = params || {};
1465 			// add to list of connections (by scope).
1466             if (!jpc.suspendedEndpoint)
1467 			    _addToList(connectionsByScope, jpc.scope, jpc);
1468 			// fire an event
1469 			if (!params.doNotFireConnectionEvent && params.fireEvent !== false) {
1470 			
1471 				var eventArgs = {
1472 					connection:jpc,
1473 					source : jpc.source, target : jpc.target,
1474 					sourceId : jpc.sourceId, targetId : jpc.targetId,
1475 					sourceEndpoint : jpc.endpoints[0], targetEndpoint : jpc.endpoints[1]
1476 				};
1477 			
1478 				_currentInstance.fire("jsPlumbConnection", eventArgs, originalEvent);
1479 				// this is from 1.3.11 onwards. "jsPlumbConnection" always felt so unnecessary, so
1480 				// I've added this alias in 1.3.11, with a view to removing "jsPlumbConnection" completely in a future version. be aware, of course, you should only register listeners for one or the other of these events.
1481 				_currentInstance.fire("connection", eventArgs, originalEvent);
1482 			}		
1483 			
1484             // always inform the anchor manager
1485             // except that if jpc has a suspended endpoint it's not true to say the
1486             // connection is new; it has just (possibly) moved. the question is whether
1487             // to make that call here or in the anchor manager.  i think perhaps here.
1488             _currentInstance.anchorManager.newConnection(jpc);
1489 			// force a paint
1490 			_draw(jpc.source);
1491 		},
1492 		
1493 		_eventFireProxy = function(event, proxyEvent, obj) {
1494 			obj.bind(event, function(originalObject, originalEvent) {
1495 				_currentInstance.fire(proxyEvent, obj, originalEvent);
1496 			});
1497 		},
1498 		
1499 		/**
1500 		 * for the given endpoint params, returns an appropriate parent element for the UI elements that will be added.
1501 		 * this function is used by _newEndpoint (directly below), and also in the makeSource function in jsPlumb.
1502 		 * 
1503 		 *   the logic is to first look for a "container" member of params, and pass that back if found.  otherwise we
1504 		 *   handoff to the 'getParent' function in the current library.
1505 		 */
1506 		_getParentFromParams = function(params) {
1507 			if (params.container)
1508 				return params.container;
1509 			else {
1510                 var tag = jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.getTagName(params.source),
1511                     p = jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.getParent(params.source);
1512                 if (tag && tag.toLowerCase() === "td")
1513                     return jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.getParent(p);
1514                 else return p;
1515             }
1516 		},
1517 		
1518 		/**
1519 			factory method to prepare a new endpoint.  this should always be used instead of creating Endpoints
1520 			manually, since this method attaches event listeners and an id.
1521 		*/
1522 		_newEndpoint = function(params) {
1523 				var endpointFunc = _currentInstance.Defaults.EndpointType || Endpoint;
1524 				params.parent = _getParentFromParams(params);
1525 				params["_jsPlumb"] = _currentInstance;
1526 				var ep = new endpointFunc(params);
1527 				ep.id = "ep_" + _idstamp();
1528 				_eventFireProxy("click", "endpointClick", ep);
1529 				_eventFireProxy("dblclick", "endpointDblClick", ep);
1530 				_eventFireProxy("contextmenu", "contextmenu", ep);
1531 				if (!jsPlumbAdapter.headless)
1532 					_currentInstance.dragManager.endpointAdded(params.source);
1533 			return ep;
1534 		},
1535 		
1536 		/**
1537 		 * performs the given function operation on all the connections found
1538 		 * for the given element id; this means we find all the endpoints for
1539 		 * the given element, and then for each endpoint find the connectors
1540 		 * connected to it. then we pass each connection in to the given
1541 		 * function.
1542 		 */
1543 		_operation = function(elId, func, endpointFunc) {
1544 			var endpoints = endpointsByElement[elId];
1545 			if (endpoints && endpoints.length) {
1546 				for ( var i = 0; i < endpoints.length; i++) {
1547 					for ( var j = 0; j < endpoints[i].connections.length; j++) {
1548 						var retVal = func(endpoints[i].connections[j]);
1549 						// if the function passed in returns true, we exit.
1550 						// most functions return false.
1551 						if (retVal) return;
1552 					}
1553 					if (endpointFunc) endpointFunc(endpoints[i]);
1554 				}
1555 			}
1556 		},
1557 		/**
1558 		 * perform an operation on all elements.
1559 		 */
1560 		_operationOnAll = function(func) {
1561 			for ( var elId in endpointsByElement) {
1562 				_operation(elId, func);
1563 			}
1564 		},		
1565 		
1566 		/**
1567 		 * helper to remove an element from the DOM.
1568 		 */
1569 		_removeElement = function(element, parent) {
1570 			if (element != null && element.parentNode != null) {
1571 				element.parentNode.removeChild(element);
1572 			}
1573 		},
1574 		/**
1575 		 * helper to remove a list of elements from the DOM.
1576 		 */
1577 		_removeElements = function(elements, parent) {
1578 			for ( var i = 0; i < elements.length; i++)
1579 				_removeElement(elements[i], parent);
1580 		},
1581 		/**
1582 		 * Sets whether or not the given element(s) should be draggable,
1583 		 * regardless of what a particular plumb command may request.
1584 		 * 
1585 		 * @param element
1586 		 *            May be a string, a element objects, or a list of
1587 		 *            strings/elements.
1588 		 * @param draggable
1589 		 *            Whether or not the given element(s) should be draggable.
1590 		 */
1591 		_setDraggable = function(element, draggable) {
1592 			return _elementProxy(element, function(el, id) {
1593 				draggableStates[id] = draggable;
1594 				if (jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.isDragSupported(el)) {
1595 					jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.setDraggable(el, draggable);
1596 				}
1597 			});
1598 		},
1599 		/**
1600 		 * private method to do the business of hiding/showing.
1601 		 * 
1602 		 * @param el
1603 		 *            either Id of the element in question or a library specific
1604 		 *            object for the element.
1605 		 * @param state
1606 		 *            String specifying a value for the css 'display' property
1607 		 *            ('block' or 'none').
1608 		 */
1609 		_setVisible = function(el, state, alsoChangeEndpoints) {
1610 			state = state === "block";
1611 			var endpointFunc = null;
1612 			if (alsoChangeEndpoints) {
1613 				if (state) endpointFunc = function(ep) {
1614 					ep.setVisible(true, true, true);
1615 				};
1616 				else endpointFunc = function(ep) {
1617 					ep.setVisible(false, true, true);
1618 				};
1619 			}
1620 			var id = _getAttribute(el, "id");
1621 			_operation(id, function(jpc) {
1622 				if (state && alsoChangeEndpoints) {		
1623 					// this test is necessary because this functionality is new, and i wanted to maintain backwards compatibility.
1624 					// this block will only set a connection to be visible if the other endpoint in the connection is also visible.
1625 					var oidx = jpc.sourceId === id ? 1 : 0;
1626 					if (jpc.endpoints[oidx].isVisible()) jpc.setVisible(true);
1627 				}
1628 				else  // the default behaviour for show, and what always happens for hide, is to just set the visibility without getting clever.
1629 					jpc.setVisible(state);
1630 			}, endpointFunc);
1631 		},
1632 		/**
1633 		 * toggles the draggable state of the given element(s).
1634 		 * 
1635 		 * @param el
1636 		 *            either an id, or an element object, or a list of
1637 		 *            ids/element objects.
1638 		 */
1639 		_toggleDraggable = function(el) {
1640 			return _elementProxy(el, function(el, elId) {
1641 				var state = draggableStates[elId] == null ? false : draggableStates[elId];
1642 				state = !state;
1643 				draggableStates[elId] = state;
1644 				jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.setDraggable(el, state);
1645 				return state;
1646 			});
1647 		},
1648 		/**
1649 		 * private method to do the business of toggling hiding/showing.
1650 		 * 
1651 		 * @param elId
1652 		 *            Id of the element in question
1653 		 */
1654 		_toggleVisible = function(elId, changeEndpoints) {
1655 			var endpointFunc = null;
1656 			if (changeEndpoints) {
1657 				endpointFunc = function(ep) {
1658 					var state = ep.isVisible();
1659 					ep.setVisible(!state);
1660 				};
1661 			}
1662 			_operation(elId, function(jpc) {
1663 				var state = jpc.isVisible();
1664 				jpc.setVisible(!state);				
1665 			}, endpointFunc);
1666 			// todo this should call _elementProxy, and pass in the
1667 			// _operation(elId, f) call as a function. cos _toggleDraggable does
1668 			// that.
1669 		},
1670 		/**
1671 		 * updates the offset and size for a given element, and stores the
1672 		 * values. if 'offset' is not null we use that (it would have been
1673 		 * passed in from a drag call) because it's faster; but if it is null,
1674 		 * or if 'recalc' is true in order to force a recalculation, we get the current values.
1675 		 */
1676 		_updateOffset = function(params) {
1677 			var timestamp = params.timestamp, recalc = params.recalc, offset = params.offset, elId = params.elId;
1678 			if (_suspendDrawing && !timestamp) timestamp = _suspendedAt;
1679 			if (!recalc) {
1680 				if (timestamp && timestamp === offsetTimestamps[elId])
1681 					return offsets[elId];
1682 			}
1683 			if (recalc || !offset) { // if forced repaint or no offset available, we recalculate.
1684 				// get the current size and offset, and store them
1685 				var s = _getElementObject(elId);
1686 				if (s != null) {						
1687 					sizes[elId] = _getSize(s);
1688 					offsets[elId] = _getOffset(s, _currentInstance);
1689 					offsetTimestamps[elId] = timestamp;
1690 				}
1691 			} else {
1692 				offsets[elId] = offset;
1693         if (sizes[elId] == null) {
1694             var s = _getElementObject(elId);
1695 				    if (s != null) sizes[elId] = _getSize(s);
1696         }
1697 		}
1698 			
1699 			if(offsets[elId] && !offsets[elId].right) {
1700 				offsets[elId].right = offsets[elId].left + sizes[elId][0];
1701 				offsets[elId].bottom = offsets[elId].top + sizes[elId][1];	
1702 				offsets[elId].width = sizes[elId][0];
1703 				offsets[elId].height = sizes[elId][1];	
1704 				offsets[elId].centerx = offsets[elId].left + (offsets[elId].width / 2);
1705 				offsets[elId].centery = offsets[elId].top + (offsets[elId].height / 2);				
1706 			}
1707 			return offsets[elId];
1708 		},
1709 
1710 		// TODO comparison performance
1711 		_getCachedData = function(elId) {
1712 			var o = offsets[elId];
1713 			if (!o) o = _updateOffset({elId:elId});
1714 			return {o:o, s:sizes[elId]};
1715 		},
1716 
1717 		/**
1718 		 * gets an id for the given element, creating and setting one if
1719 		 * necessary.  the id is of the form
1720 		 *
1721 		 *	jsPlumb_<instance index>_<index in instance>
1722 		 *
1723 		 * where "index in instance" is a monotonically increasing integer that starts at 0,
1724 		 * for each instance.  this method is used not only to assign ids to elements that do not
1725 		 * have them but also to connections and endpoints.
1726 		 */
1727 		_getId = function(element, uuid, doNotCreateIfNotFound) {
1728 			var ele = _getElementObject(element);
1729 			var id = _getAttribute(ele, "id");
1730 			if (!id || id == "undefined") {
1731 				// check if fixed uuid parameter is given
1732 				if (arguments.length == 2 && arguments[1] != undefined)
1733 					id = uuid;
1734 				else if (arguments.length == 1 || (arguments.length == 3 && !arguments[2]))
1735 					id = "jsPlumb_" + _instanceIndex + "_" + _idstamp();
1736 				
1737                 if (!doNotCreateIfNotFound) _setAttribute(ele, "id", id);
1738 			}
1739 			return id;
1740 		},		
1741 
1742 		/**
1743 		 * wraps one function with another, creating a placeholder for the
1744 		 * wrapped function if it was null. this is used to wrap the various
1745 		 * drag/drop event functions - to allow jsPlumb to be notified of
1746 		 * important lifecycle events without imposing itself on the user's
1747 		 * drag/drop functionality. TODO: determine whether or not we should
1748 		 * support an error handler concept, if one of the functions fails.
1749 		 * 
1750 		 * @param wrappedFunction original function to wrap; may be null.
1751 		 * @param newFunction function to wrap the original with.
1752 		 * @param returnOnThisValue Optional. Indicates that the wrappedFunction should 
1753 		 * not be executed if the newFunction returns a value matching 'returnOnThisValue'.
1754 		 * note that this is a simple comparison and only works for primitives right now.
1755 		 */
1756 		_wrap = function(wrappedFunction, newFunction, returnOnThisValue) {
1757 			wrappedFunction = wrappedFunction || function() { };
1758 			newFunction = newFunction || function() { };
1759 			return function() {
1760 				var r = null;
1761 				try {
1762 					r = newFunction.apply(this, arguments);
1763 				} catch (e) {
1764 					_log(_currentInstance, "jsPlumb function failed : " + e);
1765 				}
1766 				if (returnOnThisValue == null || (r !== returnOnThisValue)) {
1767 					try {
1768 						wrappedFunction.apply(this, arguments);
1769 					} catch (e) {
1770 						_log(_currentInstance, "wrapped function failed : " + e);
1771 					}
1772 				}
1773 				return r;
1774 			};
1775 		};	
1776 
1777 		/*
1778 		 * Property: connectorClass 
1779 		 *   The CSS class to set on Connection elements. This value is a String and can have multiple classes; the entire String is appended as-is.
1780 		 */
1781 		this.connectorClass = "_jsPlumb_connector";
1782 
1783 		/*
1784 		 * Property: endpointClass 
1785 		 *   The CSS class to set on Endpoint elements. This value is a String and can have multiple classes; the entire String is appended as-is.
1786 		 */
1787 		this.endpointClass = "_jsPlumb_endpoint";
1788 
1789 		/*
1790 		 * Property: overlayClass 
1791 		 * The CSS class to set on an Overlay that is an HTML element. This value is a String and can have multiple classes; the entire String is appended as-is.
1792 		 */
1793 		this.overlayClass = "_jsPlumb_overlay";
1794 		
1795 		this.Anchors = {};
1796 		
1797 		this.Connectors = { 
1798 			"canvas":{},
1799 			"svg":{},
1800 			"vml":{}
1801 		};
1802 
1803 		this.Endpoints = {
1804 			"canvas":{},
1805 			"svg":{},
1806 			"vml":{}
1807 		};
1808 
1809 		this.Overlays = {
1810 			"canvas":{},
1811 			"svg":{},
1812 			"vml":{}
1813 		};
1814 		
1815 // ************************ PLACEHOLDER DOC ENTRIES FOR NATURAL DOCS *****************************************
1816 
1817 		/*
1818 		* Function: importDefaults
1819 		* Imports all the given defaults into this instance of jsPlumb.		
1820 		*/
1821 		
1822 		/*
1823 		* Function: restoreDefaults
1824 		* Restores the default settings to "factory" values.
1825 		*/
1826 		
1827 		/*
1828 		 * Function: bind
1829 		 * Bind to an event on jsPlumb.  
1830 		 * 
1831 		 * Parameters:
1832 		 * 	event - the event to bind.  Available events on jsPlumb are:
1833 		 *         - *jsPlumbConnection* 			: 	notification that a new Connection was established.  jsPlumb passes the new Connection to the callback.
1834 		 *         - *jsPlumbConnectionDetached* 	: 	notification that a Connection was detached.  jsPlumb passes the detached Connection to the callback.
1835 		 *         - *click*						:	notification that a Connection was clicked.  jsPlumb passes the Connection that was clicked to the callback.
1836 		 *         - *dblclick*						:	notification that a Connection was double clicked.  jsPlumb passes the Connection that was double clicked to the callback.
1837 		 *         - *endpointClick*				:	notification that an Endpoint was clicked.  jsPlumb passes the Endpoint that was clicked to the callback.
1838 		 *         - *endpointDblClick*				:	notification that an Endpoint was double clicked.  jsPlumb passes the Endpoint that was double clicked to the callback.
1839 		 *         - *beforeDrop*					: 	notification that a Connection is about to be dropped. Returning false from this method cancels the drop. jsPlumb passes { sourceId, targetId, scope, connection, dropEndpoint } to your callback. For more information, refer to the jsPlumb documentation.
1840 		 *         - *beforeDetach*					: 	notification that a Connection is about to be detached. Returning false from this method cancels the detach. jsPlumb passes the Connection to your callback. For more information, refer to the jsPlumb documentation.
1841 		 *		   - *connectionDrag* 				:   notification that an existing Connection is being dragged. jsPlumb passes the Connection to your callback function.
1842 		 *         - *connectionDragEnd*            :   notification that the drag of an existing Connection has ended.  jsPlumb passes the Connection to your callback function.
1843 		 *         
1844 		 *  callback - function to callback. This function will be passed the Connection/Endpoint that caused the event, and also the original event.    
1845 		 */
1846 		
1847 		/*
1848 		 * Function: unbind
1849 		 * Clears either all listeners, or listeners for some specific event.
1850 		 * 
1851 		 * Parameters:
1852 		 * 	event	-	optional. constrains the clear to just listeners for this event.
1853 		 */
1854 		
1855 		/*
1856 		* Function: addClass
1857 		* Add class(es) to some element(s).
1858 		*
1859 		* Parameters:
1860 		* 	el			-	element id, dom element, or selector representing the element(s) to add class(es) to.
1861 		* 	clazz		-	string representing the class(es) to add. may contain multiple classes separated by spaces.
1862 		*/
1863 		
1864 		/*
1865 		* Function: removeClass
1866 		* Remove class from some selement(s).
1867 		*
1868 		* Parameters:
1869 		* 	el			-	element id, dom element, or selector representing the element(s) to remove a class from.
1870 		* 	clazz		-	string representing the class to remove. 
1871 		*/
1872 		
1873 		/*
1874 		* Function: hasClass
1875 		* Checks if an element has some class.
1876 		*
1877 		* Parameters:
1878 		* 	el			-	element id, dom element, or selector representing the element to test. If the selector matches multiple elements, we return the test for the first element in the selector only.
1879 		* 	clazz		-	string representing the class to test for. 
1880 		*/
1881 		
1882 // *************** END OF PLACEHOLDER DOC ENTRIES FOR NATURAL DOCS ***********************************************************		
1883 		
1884 
1885 // --------------------------- jsPLumbInstance public API ---------------------------------------------------------
1886 		
1887 		this.addClass = function(el, clazz) { return jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.addClass(el, clazz); };		
1888 		this.removeClass = function(el, clazz) { return jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.removeClass(el, clazz); };		
1889 		this.hasClass = function(el, clazz) { return jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.hasClass(el, clazz); };
1890 		
1891 		/*
1892 		  Function: addEndpoint 
1893 		  	
1894 		  Adds an <Endpoint> to a given element or elements.
1895 		  			  
1896 		  Parameters:
1897 		   
1898 		  	el - Element to add the endpoint to. Either an element id, a selector representing some element(s), or an array of either of these. 
1899 		  	params - Object containing Endpoint constructor arguments.  For more information, see <Endpoint>.
1900 		  	referenceParams - Object containing more Endpoint constructor arguments; it will be merged with params by jsPlumb.  You would use this if you had some 
1901 		  					  shared parameters that you wanted to reuse when you added Endpoints to a number of elements. The allowed values in
1902 		  					  this object are anything that 'params' can contain.  See <Endpoint>.
1903 		  	 
1904 		  Returns: 
1905 		  	The newly created <Endpoint>, if el referred to a single element.  Otherwise, an array of newly created <Endpoint>s. 
1906 		  	
1907 		  See Also: 
1908 		  	<addEndpoints>
1909 		 */
1910 		this.addEndpoint = function(el, params, referenceParams) {
1911 			referenceParams = referenceParams || {};
1912 			var p = jsPlumb.extend({}, referenceParams);
1913 			jsPlumb.extend(p, params);
1914 			p.endpoint = p.endpoint || _currentInstance.Defaults.Endpoint || jsPlumb.Defaults.Endpoint;
1915 			p.paintStyle = p.paintStyle || _currentInstance.Defaults.EndpointStyle || jsPlumb.Defaults.EndpointStyle;
1916             // YUI wrapper
1917 			el = _convertYUICollection(el);			
1918 			
1919 			var results = [], inputs = el.length && el.constructor != String ? el : [ el ];
1920 						
1921 			for (var i = 0; i < inputs.length; i++) {
1922 				var _el = _getElementObject(inputs[i]), id = _getId(_el);
1923 				p.source = _el;
1924                 _updateOffset({ elId : id, timestamp:_suspendedAt });
1925 				var e = _newEndpoint(p);
1926 				if (p.parentAnchor) e.parentAnchor = p.parentAnchor;
1927 				_addToList(endpointsByElement, id, e);
1928 				var myOffset = offsets[id], myWH = sizes[id];
1929 				var anchorLoc = e.anchor.compute( { xy : [ myOffset.left, myOffset.top ], wh : myWH, element : e, timestamp:_suspendedAt });
