1930 				var endpointPaintParams = { anchorLoc : anchorLoc, timestamp:_suspendedAt };
1931 				if (_suspendDrawing) endpointPaintParams.recalc = false;
1932 				e.paint(endpointPaintParams);
1933 				results.push(e);
1934 				//if (!jsPlumbAdapter.headless)
1935 					//_currentInstance.dragManager.endpointAdded(_el);
1936 			}
1937 			
1938 			return results.length == 1 ? results[0] : results;
1939 		};
1940 		
1941 		/*
1942 		  Function: addEndpoints 
1943 		  Adds a list of <Endpoint>s to a given element or elements.
1944 		  
1945 		  Parameters: 
1946 		  	target - element to add the Endpoint to. Either an element id, a selector representing some element(s), or an array of either of these. 
1947 		  	endpoints - List of objects containing Endpoint constructor arguments. one Endpoint is created for each entry in this list.  See <Endpoint>'s constructor documentation. 
1948 			referenceParams - Object containing more Endpoint constructor arguments; it will be merged with params by jsPlumb.  You would use this if you had some shared parameters that you wanted to reuse when you added Endpoints to a number of elements.		  	 
1949 
1950 		  Returns: 
1951 		  	List of newly created <Endpoint>s, one for each entry in the 'endpoints' argument. 
1952 		  	
1953 		  See Also:
1954 		  	<addEndpoint>
1955 		 */
1956 		this.addEndpoints = function(el, endpoints, referenceParams) {
1957 			var results = [];
1958 			for ( var i = 0; i < endpoints.length; i++) {
1959 				var e = _currentInstance.addEndpoint(el, endpoints[i], referenceParams);
1960 				if (_isArray(e))
1961 					Array.prototype.push.apply(results, e);
1962 				else results.push(e);
1963 			}
1964 			return results;
1965 		};
1966 
1967 		/*
1968 		  Function: animate 
1969 		  This is a wrapper around the supporting library's animate function; it injects a call to jsPlumb in the 'step' function (creating
1970 		  the 'step' function if necessary). This only supports the two-arg version of the animate call in jQuery, the one that takes an 'options' object as
1971 		  the second arg. MooTools has only one method, a two arg one. Which is handy.  YUI has a one-arg method, so jsPlumb merges 'properties' and 'options' together for YUI.
1972 		   
1973 		  Parameters: 
1974 		  	el - Element to animate. Either an id, or a selector representing the element. 
1975 		  	properties - The 'properties' argument you want passed to the library's animate call. 
1976 		   	options - The 'options' argument you want passed to the library's animate call.
1977 		    
1978 		  Returns: 
1979 		  	void
1980 		 */
1981 		this.animate = function(el, properties, options) {
1982 			var ele = _getElementObject(el), id = _getAttribute(el, "id");
1983 			options = options || {};
1984 			var stepFunction = jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.dragEvents['step'];
1985 			var completeFunction = jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.dragEvents['complete'];
1986 			options[stepFunction] = _wrap(options[stepFunction], function() {
1987 				_currentInstance.repaint(id);
1988 			});
1989 
1990 			// onComplete repaints, just to make sure everything looks good at the end of the animation.
1991 			options[completeFunction] = _wrap(options[completeFunction],
1992 					function() {
1993 						_currentInstance.repaint(id);
1994 					});
1995 
1996 			jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.animate(ele, properties, options);
1997 		};		
1998 		
1999 		/**
2000 		* checks for a listener for the given condition, executing it if found, passing in the given value.
2001 		* condition listeners would have been attached using "bind" (which is, you could argue, now overloaded, since
2002 		* firing click events etc is a bit different to what this does).  i thought about adding a "bindCondition"
2003 		* or something, but decided against it, for the sake of simplicity. jsPlumb will never fire one of these
2004 		* condition events anyway.
2005 		*/
2006 		this.checkCondition = function(conditionName, value) {
2007 			var l = _currentInstance.getListener(conditionName);
2008 			var r = true;
2009 			if (l && l.length > 0) {
2010 				try {
2011 					for (var i = 0 ; i < l.length; i++) {
2012 						r = r && l[i](value); 
2013 					}
2014 				}
2015 				catch (e) { 
2016 					_log(_currentInstance, "cannot check condition [" + conditionName + "]" + e); 
2017 				}
2018 			}
2019 			return r;
2020 		};
2021 
2022 		/*
2023 		  Function: connect 
2024 		  Establishes a <Connection> between two elements (or <Endpoint>s, which are themselves registered to elements).
2025 		  
2026 		  Parameters: 
2027 		    params - Object containing constructor arguments for the Connection. See <Connection>'s constructor documentation.
2028 		    referenceParams - Optional object containing more constructor arguments for the Connection. Typically you would pass in data that a lot of 
2029 		    Connections are sharing here, such as connector style etc, and then use the main params for data specific to this Connection.
2030 		     
2031 		  Returns: 
2032 		  	The newly created <Connection>.
2033 		 */
2034 		this.connect = function(params, referenceParams) {
2035 			// prepare a final set of parameters to create connection with
2036 			var _p = _prepareConnectionParams(params, referenceParams), jpc;
2037 			// TODO probably a nicer return value if the connection was not made.  _prepareConnectionParams
2038 			// will return null (and log something) if either endpoint was full.  what would be nicer is to 
2039 			// create a dedicated 'error' object.
2040 			if (_p) {
2041 				// a connect call will delete its created endpoints on detach, unless otherwise specified.
2042 				// this is because the endpoints belong to this connection only, and are no use to
2043 				// anyone else, so they hang around like a bad smell.
2044 				if (_p.deleteEndpointsOnDetach == null)
2045 					_p.deleteEndpointsOnDetach = true;
2046 
2047 				// create the connection.  it is not yet registered 
2048 				jpc = _newConnection(_p);
2049 				// now add it the model, fire an event, and redraw
2050 				_finaliseConnection(jpc, _p);										
2051 			}
2052 			return jpc;
2053 		};
2054 		
2055 		/*
2056 		 Function: deleteEndpoint		 
2057 		 Deletes an Endpoint and removes all Connections it has (which removes the Connections from the other Endpoints involved too)
2058 		 
2059 		 Parameters:
2060 		 	object - either an <Endpoint> object (such as from an addEndpoint call), or a String UUID.
2061 		 	
2062 		 Returns:
2063 		 	void		  
2064 		 */
2065 		this.deleteEndpoint = function(object) {
2066 			var endpoint = (typeof object == "string") ? endpointsByUUID[object] : object;			
2067 			if (endpoint) {					
2068 				var uuid = endpoint.getUuid();
2069 				if (uuid) endpointsByUUID[uuid] = null;				
2070 				endpoint.detachAll();
2071 				if (endpoint.endpoint.cleanup) endpoint.endpoint.cleanup();
2072 				_removeElements(endpoint.endpoint.getDisplayElements());
2073 				_currentInstance.anchorManager.deleteEndpoint(endpoint);
2074 				for (var e in endpointsByElement) {
2075 					var endpoints = endpointsByElement[e];
2076 					if (endpoints) {
2077 						var newEndpoints = [];
2078 						for (var i = 0; i < endpoints.length; i++)
2079 							if (endpoints[i] != endpoint) newEndpoints.push(endpoints[i]);
2080 						
2081 						endpointsByElement[e] = newEndpoints;
2082 					}
2083 				}
2084 				if (!jsPlumbAdapter.headless)
2085 					_currentInstance.dragManager.endpointDeleted(endpoint);								
2086 			}									
2087 		};
2088 		
2089 		/*
2090 		 Function: deleteEveryEndpoint
2091 		  Deletes every <Endpoint>, and their associated <Connection>s, in this instance of jsPlumb. Does not unregister any event listeners (this is the only difference
2092 between this method and jsPlumb.reset).  
2093 		  
2094 		 Returns: 
2095 		 	void 
2096 		 */
2097 		this.deleteEveryEndpoint = function() {
2098 			_currentInstance.setSuspendDrawing(true);
2099 			for ( var id in endpointsByElement) {
2100 				var endpoints = endpointsByElement[id];
2101 				if (endpoints && endpoints.length) {
2102 					for ( var i = 0; i < endpoints.length; i++) {
2103 						_currentInstance.deleteEndpoint(endpoints[i]);
2104 					}
2105 				}
2106 			}			
2107 			endpointsByElement = {};			
2108 			endpointsByUUID = {};
2109 			
2110 			_currentInstance.setSuspendDrawing(false, true);
2111 		};
2112 
2113 		var fireDetachEvent = function(jpc, doFireEvent, originalEvent) {
2114             // may have been given a connection, or in special cases, an object
2115             var connType =  _currentInstance.Defaults.ConnectionType || _currentInstance.getDefaultConnectionType(),
2116                 argIsConnection = jpc.constructor == connType,
2117                 params = argIsConnection ? {
2118                     connection:jpc,
2119 				    source : jpc.source, target : jpc.target,
2120 				    sourceId : jpc.sourceId, targetId : jpc.targetId,
2121 				    sourceEndpoint : jpc.endpoints[0], targetEndpoint : jpc.endpoints[1]
2122                 } : jpc;
2123 
2124 			if (doFireEvent) {
2125 				_currentInstance.fire("jsPlumbConnectionDetached", params, originalEvent);
2126 				// introduced in 1.3.11..an alias because the original event name is unwieldy.  in future versions this will be the only event and the other will no longer be fired.
2127 				_currentInstance.fire("connectionDetached", params, originalEvent);
2128 			}
2129             _currentInstance.anchorManager.connectionDetached(params);
2130 		},
2131 		/**
2132 			fires an event to indicate an existing connection is being dragged.
2133 		*/
2134 		fireConnectionDraggingEvent = function(jpc) {
2135 			_currentInstance.fire("connectionDrag", jpc);	
2136 		},
2137 		fireConnectionDragStopEvent = function(jpc) {
2138 			_currentInstance.fire("connectionDragStop", jpc);
2139 		};
2140 
2141 		/*
2142 		  Function: detach 
2143 		  Detaches and then removes a <Connection>.  
2144 		  		   
2145 		  Parameters: 
2146 		    connection  -   the <Connection> to detach
2147 		    params      -   optional parameters to the detach call.  valid values here are
2148 		                    fireEvent   :   defaults to false; indicates you want jsPlumb to fire a connection
2149 		                                    detached event. The thinking behind this is that if you made a programmatic
2150 		                                    call to detach an event, you probably don't need the callback.
2151 		                    forceDetach :   defaults to false. allows you to override any beforeDetach listeners that may be registered.
2152 
2153 		    Returns: 
2154 		    	true if successful, false if not.
2155 		 */
2156 		this.detach = function() {
2157 
2158             if (arguments.length == 0) return;
2159             var connType =  _currentInstance.Defaults.ConnectionType || _currentInstance.getDefaultConnectionType(),
2160                 firstArgIsConnection = arguments[0].constructor == connType,
2161                 params = arguments.length == 2 ? firstArgIsConnection ? (arguments[1] || {}) : arguments[0] : arguments[0],
2162                 fireEvent = (params.fireEvent !== false),
2163                 forceDetach = params.forceDetach,
2164                 connection = firstArgIsConnection ? arguments[0] : params.connection;
2165 
2166 				if (connection) {
2167                     if (forceDetach || (connection.isDetachAllowed(connection)
2168                                         && connection.endpoints[0].isDetachAllowed(connection)
2169                                         && connection.endpoints[1].isDetachAllowed(connection))) {
2170                         if (forceDetach || _currentInstance.checkCondition("beforeDetach", connection))
2171 						    connection.endpoints[0].detach(connection, false, true, fireEvent); // TODO check this param iscorrect for endpoint's detach method
2172                     }
2173                 }
2174                 else {
2175 					var _p = jsPlumb.extend( {}, params); // a backwards compatibility hack: source should be thought of as 'params' in this case.
2176 					// test for endpoint uuids to detach
2177 					if (_p.uuids) {
2178 						_getEndpoint(_p.uuids[0]).detachFrom(_getEndpoint(_p.uuids[1]), fireEvent);
2179 					} else if (_p.sourceEndpoint && _p.targetEndpoint) {
2180 						_p.sourceEndpoint.detachFrom(_p.targetEndpoint);
2181 					} else {
2182 						var sourceId = _getId(_p.source),
2183 						    targetId = _getId(_p.target);
2184 						_operation(sourceId, function(jpc) {
2185 						    if ((jpc.sourceId == sourceId && jpc.targetId == targetId) || (jpc.targetId == sourceId && jpc.sourceId == targetId)) {
2186 							    if (_currentInstance.checkCondition("beforeDetach", jpc)) {
2187                                     jpc.endpoints[0].detach(jpc, false, true, fireEvent);
2188 								}
2189 							}
2190 						});
2191 					}
2192 				}
2193 		};
2194 
2195 		/*
2196 		  Function: detachAllConnections
2197 		  Removes all an element's Connections.
2198 		   
2199 		  Parameters:
2200 		  	el - either the id of the element, or a selector for the element.
2201 		  	params - optional parameters.  alowed values:
2202 		  	        fireEvent : defaults to true, whether or not to fire the detach event.
2203 		  	
2204 		  Returns: 
2205 		  	void
2206 		 */
2207 		this.detachAllConnections = function(el, params) {
2208             params = params || {};
2209             el = _getElementObject(el);
2210 			var id = _getAttribute(el, "id"),
2211                 endpoints = endpointsByElement[id];
2212 			if (endpoints && endpoints.length) {
2213 				for ( var i = 0; i < endpoints.length; i++) {
2214 					endpoints[i].detachAll(params.fireEvent);
2215 				}
2216 			}
2217 		};
2218 
2219 		/*
2220 		  Function: detachEveryConnection 
2221 		  Remove all Connections from all elements, but leaves Endpoints in place.
2222 
2223 		  Parameters:
2224 		    params  - optional params object containing:
2225 		            fireEvent : whether or not to fire detach events. defaults to true.
2226 
2227 		   
2228 		  Returns: 
2229 		  	void
2230 		  	 
2231 		  See Also:
2232 		  	<removeEveryEndpoint>
2233 		 */
2234 		this.detachEveryConnection = function(params) {
2235             params = params || {};
2236 			for ( var id in endpointsByElement) {
2237 				var endpoints = endpointsByElement[id];
2238 				if (endpoints && endpoints.length) {
2239 					for ( var i = 0; i < endpoints.length; i++) {
2240 						endpoints[i].detachAll(params.fireEvent);
2241 					}
2242 				}
2243 			}
2244 			connectionsByScope = {};
2245 		};
2246 
2247 
2248 		/*
2249 		  Function: draggable 
2250 		  Initialises the draggability of some element or elements.  You should use this instead of your 
2251 		  library's draggable method so that jsPlumb can setup the appropriate callbacks.  Your 
2252 		  underlying library's drag method is always called from this method.
2253 		  
2254 		  Parameters: 
2255 		  	el - either an element id, a list of element ids, or a selector. 
2256 		  	options - options to pass through to the underlying library
2257 		  	 
2258 		  Returns: 
2259 		  	void
2260 		 */		 
2261 		this.draggable = function(el, options) {
2262 			if (typeof el == 'object' && el.length) {
2263 				for ( var i = 0; i < el.length; i++) {
2264 					var ele = _getElementObject(el[i]);
2265 					if (ele) _initDraggableIfNecessary(ele, true, options);
2266 				}
2267 			} 
2268 			else if (el._nodes) { 	// TODO this is YUI specific; really the logic should be forced
2269 				// into the library adapters (for jquery and mootools aswell)
2270 				for ( var i = 0; i < el._nodes.length; i++) {
2271 					var ele = _getElementObject(el._nodes[i]);
2272 					if (ele) _initDraggableIfNecessary(ele, true, options);
2273 				}
2274 			}
2275 			else {
2276 				var ele = _getElementObject(el);
2277 				if (ele) _initDraggableIfNecessary(ele, true, options);
2278 			}
2279 		};
2280 
2281 		/*
2282 		  Function: extend 
2283 		  Wraps the underlying library's extend functionality.
2284 		  
2285 		  Parameters: 
2286 		  	o1 - object to extend 
2287 		  	o2 - object to extend o1 with
2288 		  	
2289 		  Returns: 
2290 		  	o1, extended with all properties from o2.
2291 		 */
2292 		this.extend = function(o1, o2) {
2293 			return jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.extend(o1, o2);
2294 		};
2295 		
2296 		/*
2297 		 * Function: getDefaultEndpointType
2298 		 * 	Returns the default Endpoint type. Used when someone wants to subclass Endpoint and have jsPlumb return instances of their subclass.
2299 		 *  you would make a call like this in your class's constructor:
2300 		 *  
2301 		 *  : jsPlumb.getDefaultEndpointType().apply(this, arguments);
2302 		 *  
2303 		 * 
2304 		 * Returns:
2305 		 * 	the default Endpoint function used by jsPlumb.
2306 		 */
2307 		this.getDefaultEndpointType = function() {
2308 			return Endpoint;
2309 		};
2310 		
2311 		/*
2312 		 * Function: getDefaultConnectionType
2313 		 * 	Returns the default Connection type. Used when someone wants to subclass Connection and have jsPlumb return instances of their subclass.
2314 		 *  you would make a call like this in your class's constructor:
2315 		 *  
2316 		 *  : jsPlumb.getDefaultConnectionType().apply(this, arguments);
2317 		 * 
2318 		 * Returns:
2319 		 * 	the default Connection function used by jsPlumb.
2320 		 */
2321 		this.getDefaultConnectionType = function() {
2322 			return Connection;
2323 		};
2324 
2325 		// helpers for select/selectEndpoints
2326 		var _setOperation = function(list, func, args, selector) {
2327 				for (var i = 0; i < list.length; i++) {
2328 					list[i][func].apply(list[i], args);
2329 				}	
2330 				return selector(list);
2331 			},
2332 			_getOperation = function(list, func, args) {
2333 				var out = [];
2334 				for (var i = 0; i < list.length; i++) {					
2335 					out.push([ list[i][func].apply(list[i], args), list[i] ]);
2336 				}	
2337 				return out;
2338 			},
2339 			setter = function(list, func, selector) {
2340 				return function() {
2341 					return _setOperation(list, func, arguments, selector);
2342 				};
2343 			},
2344 			getter = function(list, func) {
2345 				return function() {
2346 					return _getOperation(list, func, arguments);
2347 				};	
2348 			},
2349 			prepareList = function(input, doNotGetIds) {
2350 				var r = [];
2351 				if (input) {
2352 					if (typeof input == 'string') {
2353 						if (input === "*") return input;
2354 						r.push(input);
2355 					}
2356 					else {
2357 						if (doNotGetIds) r = input;
2358 						else { 
2359 							for (var i = 0; i < input.length; i++) 
2360 								r.push(_getId(_getElementObject(input[i])));
2361 						}	
2362 					}
2363 				}
2364 				return r;
2365 			},
2366 			filterList = function(list, value, missingIsFalse) {
2367 				if (list === "*") return true;
2368 				return list.length > 0 ? _indexOf(list, value) != -1 : !missingIsFalse;
2369 			};
2370 
2371 		/*
2372 		 * Function: getConnections 
2373 		 * Gets all or a subset of connections currently managed by this jsPlumb instance.  If only one scope is passed in to this method,
2374 		 * the result will be a list of connections having that scope (passing in no scope at all will result in jsPlumb assuming you want the
2375 		 * default scope).
2376 		 *
2377 		 * If multiple scopes are passed in, the return value will be a map of
2378 		 *
2379 		 * : { scope -> [ connection... ] }
2380 		 * 
2381 		 *  Parameters:
2382 		 *  	scope	-	if the only argument to getConnections is a string, jsPlumb will treat that string as a scope filter, and return a list
2383 		 *                  of connections that are in the given scope. use '*' for all scopes.
2384 		 *      options	-	if the argument is a JS object, you can specify a finer-grained filter:
2385 		 *      
2386 		 *      		-	*scope* may be a string specifying a single scope, or an array of strings, specifying multiple scopes. Also may have the value '*', indicating any scope.
2387 		 *      		-	*source* either a string representing an element id, a selector, or an array of ids. Also may have the value '*', indicating any source.  Constrains the result to connections having this/these element(s) as source.
2388 		 *      		-	*target* either a string representing an element id, a selector, or an array of ids. Also may have the value '*', indicating any target.  Constrains the result to connections having this/these element(s) as target.		 
2389 		 *		flat    -	return results in a flat array (don't return an object whose keys are scopes and whose values are lists per scope).
2390 		 * 
2391 		 */
2392 		this.getConnections = function(options, flat) {
2393 			if (!options) {
2394 				options = {};
2395 			} else if (options.constructor == String) {
2396 				options = { "scope": options };
2397 			}
2398 			var
2399 			scope = options.scope || _currentInstance.getDefaultScope(),
2400 			scopes = prepareList(scope, true),
2401 			sources = prepareList(options.source),
2402 			targets = prepareList(options.target),			
2403 			results = (!flat && scopes.length > 1) ? {} : [],
2404 			_addOne = function(scope, obj) {
2405 				if (!flat && scopes.length > 1) {
2406 					var ss = results[scope];
2407 					if (ss == null) {
2408 						ss = []; results[scope] = ss;
2409 					}
2410 					ss.push(obj);
2411 				} else results.push(obj);
2412 			};
2413 			for ( var i in connectionsByScope) {
2414 				if (filterList(scopes, i)) {
2415 					for ( var j = 0; j < connectionsByScope[i].length; j++) {
2416 						var c = connectionsByScope[i][j];
2417 						if (filterList(sources, c.sourceId) && filterList(targets, c.targetId))
2418 							_addOne(i, c);
2419 					}
2420 				}
2421 			}
2422 			return results;
2423 		};
2424 		
2425 		var _curryEach = function(list, executor) {
2426 				return function(f) {
2427 					for (var i = 0; i < list.length; i++) {
2428 						f(list[i]);
2429 					}
2430 					return executor(list);
2431 				};		
2432 			},
2433 			_curryGet = function(list) {
2434 				return function(idx) {
2435 					return list[idx];
2436 				};
2437 			};
2438 			
2439 		var _makeCommonSelectHandler = function(list, executor) {
2440 			return {
2441 				// setters
2442 				setHover:setter(list, "setHover", executor),								
2443 				removeAllOverlays:setter(list, "removeAllOverlays", executor),
2444 				setLabel:setter(list, "setLabel", executor),
2445 				addOverlay:setter(list, "addOverlay", executor),
2446 				removeOverlay:setter(list, "removeOverlay", executor),
2447 				removeOverlays:setter(list, "removeOverlays", executor),
2448 				showOverlay:setter(list, "showOverlay", executor),
2449 				hideOverlay:setter(list, "hideOverlay", executor),
2450 				showOverlays:setter(list, "showOverlays", executor),
2451 				hideOverlays:setter(list, "hideOverlays", executor),
2452 				setPaintStyle:setter(list, "setPaintStyle", executor),
2453 				setHoverPaintStyle:setter(list, "setHoverPaintStyle", executor),									
2454 				setParameter:setter(list, "setParameter", executor),		
2455 				setParameters:setter(list, "setParameters", executor),
2456 				setVisible:setter(list, "setVisible", executor),
2457 				setZIndex:setter(list, "setZIndex", executor),
2458 				repaint:setter(list, "repaint", executor),
2459 				addType:setter(list, "addType", executor),
2460 				toggleType:setter(list, "toggleType", executor),
2461 				removeType:setter(list, "removeType", executor),
2462 
2463 				// getters
2464 				getLabel:getter(list, "getLabel"),
2465 				getOverlay:getter(list, "getOverlay"),
2466 				isHover:getter(list, "isHover"),
2467 				getParameter:getter(list, "getParameter"),		
2468 				getParameters:getter(list, "getParameters"),
2469 				getPaintStyle:getter(list, "getPaintStyle"),		
2470 				getHoverPaintStyle:getter(list, "getHoverPaintStyle"),
2471 				isVisible:getter(list, "isVisible"),
2472 				getZIndex:getter(list, "getZIndex"),
2473 				hasType:getter(list, "hasType"),
2474 				getType:getter(list, "getType"),
2475 
2476 				// util
2477 				length:list.length,
2478 				each:_curryEach(list, executor),
2479 				get:_curryGet(list)
2480 			};
2481 		
2482 		};
2483 		
2484 		var	_makeConnectionSelectHandler = function(list) {
2485 			var common = _makeCommonSelectHandler(list, _makeConnectionSelectHandler);
2486 			return jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.extend(common, {
2487 				// setters									
2488 				setDetachable:setter(list, "setDetachable", _makeConnectionSelectHandler),
2489 				setReattach:setter(list, "setReattach", _makeConnectionSelectHandler),
2490 				setConnector:setter(list, "setConnector", _makeConnectionSelectHandler),			
2491 				detach:function() {
2492 					for (var i = 0; i < list.length; i++)
2493 						_currentInstance.detach(list[i]);
2494 				},				
2495 				// getters
2496 				isDetachable:getter(list, "isDetachable"),
2497 				isReattach:getter(list, "isReattach")
2498 			});
2499 		};
2500 		
2501 		var	_makeEndpointSelectHandler = function(list) {
2502 			var common = _makeCommonSelectHandler(list, _makeEndpointSelectHandler);
2503 			return jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.extend(common, {
2504 				setEnabled:setter(list, "setEnabled", _makeEndpointSelectHandler),
2505 				isEnabled:getter(list, "isEnabled"),
2506 				detachAll:function() {
2507 					for (var i = 0; i < list.length; i++)
2508 						list[i].detachAll();
2509 				},
2510 				"delete":function() {
2511 					for (var i = 0; i < list.length; i++)
2512 						_currentInstance.deleteEndpoint(list[i]);
2513 				}
2514 			});
2515 		};
2516 			
2517 		/*
2518 		* Function: select
2519 		* Selects a set of Connections, using the filter options from the getConnections method, and returns an object
2520 		* that allows you to perform an operation on all of the Connections at once.
2521 		*
2522 		* The return value from any of these operations is the original list of Connections, allowing operations to be
2523 		* chained (for 'setter' type operations). 'getter' type operations return an array of values, where each entry is
2524 		* of the form:
2525 		*
2526 		* : [ Connection, return value ]
2527 		* 
2528 		* Parameters:
2529 		*	scope - see getConnections
2530 		* 	source - see getConnections
2531 		*	target - see getConnections
2532 		*
2533 		* Returns:
2534 		* A list of Connections on which operations may be executed. 'Setter' type operations can be chained; 'getter' type operations
2535 		* return an array of [Connection, value] pairs, one entry for each Connection in the list returned. The full list of operations 
2536 		* is as follows (where not specified, the operation's effect or return value is the same as the corresponding method on Connection) :
2537 		* 
2538 		*	-	setHover								
2539 		*	-	removeAllOverlays
2540 		*	-	setLabel
2541 		*	-	addOverlay
2542 		*	-	removeOverlay
2543 		*	-	removeOverlays
2544 		*	-	showOverlay
2545 		*	-	hideOverlay
2546 		*	-	showOverlays
2547 		*	-	hideOverlays
2548 		*	-	setPaintStyle
2549 		*	-	setHoverPaintStyle
2550 		*	-	setDetachable
2551 		*	- 	setReattach
2552 		*	-	setConnector
2553 		*	-	setParameter
2554 		*	-	setParameters
2555 		*   - 	getLabel
2556 		*	-	getOverlay
2557 		*	-	isHover
2558 		*	-	isDetachable
2559 		*	-	isReattach
2560 		*	-	getParameter
2561 		*	-	getParameters
2562 		*	-	getPaintStyle
2563 		*	-	getHoverPaintStyle
2564 		*	-	detach : detaches all the connections in the list. not chainable and does not return anything.
2565 		*	-	length : returns the length of the list.
2566 		*	-	get(index) : returns the Connection at 'index' in the list.
2567 		*	-	each(function(connection)...) : allows you to specify your own function to execute; this function is chainable.
2568 		*/
2569 		this.select = function(params) {
2570 			params = params || {};
2571 			params.scope = params.scope || "*";
2572 			var c = _currentInstance.getConnections(params, true);
2573 			return _makeConnectionSelectHandler(c);							
2574 		};
2575 		
2576 		/*
2577 		* Function: selectEndpoints
2578 		* Selects a set of Endpoints and returns an object that allows you to execute various different methods on them at once. The return 
2579 		* value from any of these operations is the original list of Endpoints, allowing operations to be chained (for 'setter' type 
2580 		* operations). 'getter' type operations return an array of values, where each entry is of the form:
2581 		*
2582 		* : [ Endpoint, return value ]
2583 		* 
2584 		* Parameters:
2585 		*	scope - either a string or an array of strings.
2586 		* 	source - either a string, a dom element, or a selector, or an array of any mix of these. limits returned endpoints to those that are declared as a source endpoint on any elements identified.
2587 		*	target - either a string, a dom element, or a selector, or an array of any mix of these. limits returned endpoints to those that are declared as a target endpoint on any elements identified.
2588 		*	element - either a string, a dom element, or a selector, or an array of any mix of these. limits returned endpoints to those that are declared as either a source OR a target endpoint on any elements identified.		
2589 		*
2590 		* Returns:
2591 		* A list of Endpoints on which operations may be executed. 'Setter' type operations can be chained; 'getter' type operations
2592 		* return an array of [Endpoint, value] pairs, one entry for each Endpoint in the list returned. 
2593 		*
2594 		* The full list of operations is as follows (where not specified, the operation's effect or return value is the
2595 		* same as the corresponding method on Endpoint) :
2596 		* 
2597 		*	-	setHover								
2598 		*	-	removeAllOverlays
2599 		*	-	setLabel
2600 		*	-	addOverlay
2601 		*	-	removeOverlay
2602 		*	-	removeOverlays
2603 		*	-	showOverlay
2604 		*	-	hideOverlay
2605 		*	-	showOverlays
2606 		*	-	hideOverlays
2607 		*	-	setPaintStyle
2608 		*	-	setHoverPaintStyle
2609 		*	-	setParameter
2610 		*	-	setParameters
2611 		*   - 	getLabel
2612 		*	-	getOverlay
2613 		*	-	isHover
2614 		*	-	isDetachable
2615 		*	-	getParameter
2616 		*	-	getParameters
2617 		*	-	getPaintStyle
2618 		*	-	getHoverPaintStyle
2619 		*	-	detachAll : Detaches all the Connections from every Endpoint in the list. not chainable and does not return anything.
2620 		*	-	delete : Deletes every Endpoint in the list. not chainable and does not return anything.		
2621 		*	-	length : returns the length of the list.
2622 		*	-	get(index) : returns the Endpoint at 'index' in the list.
2623 		*	-	each(function(endpoint)...) : allows you to specify your own function to execute; this function is chainable.
2624 		*/
2625 		this.selectEndpoints = function(params) {
2626 			params = params || {};
2627 			params.scope = params.scope || "*";
2628 			var noElementFilters = !params.element && !params.source && !params.target,			
2629 				elements = noElementFilters ? "*" : prepareList(params.element),
2630 				sources = noElementFilters ? "*" : prepareList(params.source),
2631 				targets = noElementFilters ? "*" : prepareList(params.target),
2632 				scopes = prepareList(params.scope, true);
2633 			
2634 			var ep = [];
2635 			
2636 			for (var el in endpointsByElement) {
2637 				var either = filterList(elements, el, true),
2638 					source = filterList(sources, el, true),
2639 					sourceMatchExact = sources != "*",
2640 					target = filterList(targets, el, true),
2641 					targetMatchExact = targets != "*"; 
2642 					
2643 				// if they requested 'either' then just match scope. otherwise if they requested 'source' (not as a wildcard) then we have to match only endpoints that have isSource set to to true, and the same thing with isTarget.  
2644 				if ( either || source  || target ) {
2645 					inner:
2646 					for (var i = 0; i < endpointsByElement[el].length; i++) {
2647 						var _ep = endpointsByElement[el][i];
2648 						if (filterList(scopes, _ep.scope, true)) {
2649 						
2650 							var noMatchSource = (sourceMatchExact && sources.length > 0 && !_ep.isSource),
2651 								noMatchTarget = (targetMatchExact && targets.length > 0 && !_ep.isTarget);
2652 						
2653 							if (noMatchSource || noMatchTarget)								  
2654 								  continue inner; 
2655 							 							
2656 							ep.push(_ep);		
2657 						}
2658 					}
2659 				}					
2660 			}
2661 			
2662 			return _makeEndpointSelectHandler(ep);
2663 		};
2664 
2665 		/*
2666 		 * Function: getAllConnections
2667 		 * Gets all connections, as a map of the form:
2668 		 *
2669 		 * : { scope -> [ connection... ] } 
2670 		 */
2671 		this.getAllConnections = function() {
2672 			return connectionsByScope;
2673 		};
2674 
2675 		/*
2676 		 * Function: getDefaultScope 
2677 		 * Gets the default scope for connections and  endpoints.
2678 		 *
2679 		 * A scope defines a type of endpoint/connection; supplying a
2680 		 * scope to an Endpoint or Connection allows you to support different
2681 		 * types of connections in the same UI. but if you're only interested in
2682 		 * one type of connection, you don't need to supply a scope. this method
2683 		 * will probably be used by very few people; it's good for testing
2684 		 * though.
2685 		 */
2686 		this.getDefaultScope = function() {
2687 			return DEFAULT_SCOPE;
2688 		};
2689 
2690 		/*
2691 		  Function: getEndpoint 
2692 		  Gets an Endpoint by UUID
2693 		   
2694 		  Parameters: 
2695 		  	uuid - the UUID for the Endpoint
2696 		  	 
2697 		  Returns: 
2698 		  	Endpoint with the given UUID, null if nothing found.
2699 		 */
2700 		this.getEndpoint = _getEndpoint;
2701 				
2702 		/**
2703 		 * Function: getEndpoints
2704 		 * Gets the list of Endpoints for a given element.
2705 		 *
2706 		 * Parameters:
2707 		 * 	el - element id, dom element, or selector.
2708 		 *
2709 		 * Returns:
2710 		 * 	An array of Endpoints for the specified element.
2711 		 */
2712 		this.getEndpoints = function(el) {
2713 			return endpointsByElement[_getId(el)];
2714 		};		
2715 
2716 		/*
2717 		 * Gets an element's id, creating one if necessary. really only exposed
2718 		 * for the lib-specific functionality to access; would be better to pass
2719 		 * the current instance into the lib-specific code (even though this is
2720 		 * a static call. i just don't want to expose it to the public API).
2721 		 */
2722 		this.getId = _getId;
2723 		this.getOffset = function(id) { 
2724 			var o = offsets[id]; 
2725 			return _updateOffset({elId:id});
2726 		};
2727 		
2728 		/*
2729 		 * Function: getSelector
2730 		 * This method takes the given selector spec and, using the current underlying library, turns it into
2731 		 * a selector from that library.  This method exists really as a helper function for those applications
2732 		 * where you're writing jsPlumb code that will target more than one library (such as in the case of the
2733 		 * jsPlumb demo pages).
2734 		 *
2735 		 * Parameters:
2736 		 * 	spec 	-	a valid selector string.
2737 		 */ 	
2738 		this.getSelector = function(spec) {
2739 			return jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.getSelector(spec);
2740 		};
2741 		
2742 		// get the size of the element with the given id, perhaps from cache.
2743 		this.getSize = function(id) { 
2744 			var s = sizes[id]; 
2745 			if (!s) _updateOffset({elId:id});
2746 			return sizes[id];
2747 		};		
2748 		
2749 		this.appendElement = _appendElement;
2750 		
2751 		var _hoverSuspended = false;
2752 		this.isHoverSuspended = function() { return _hoverSuspended; };
2753 		this.setHoverSuspended = function(s) { _hoverSuspended = s; };
2754 
2755 		var _isAvailable = function(m) {
2756 			return function() {
2757 				return jsPlumbAdapter.isRenderModeAvailable(m);
2758 			};
2759 		}
2760 		this.isCanvasAvailable = _isAvailable("canvas");
2761 		this.isSVGAvailable = _isAvailable("svg");
2762 		this.isVMLAvailable = _isAvailable("vml");
2763 
2764 		/*
2765 		  Function: hide 
2766 		  Sets an element's connections to be hidden.
2767 		  
2768 		  Parameters: 
2769 		  	el - either the id of the element, or a selector for the element.
2770 		  	changeEndpoints - whether not to also hide endpoints on the element. by default this is false.  
2771 		  	 
2772 		  Returns: 
2773 		  	void
2774 		 */
2775 		this.hide = function(el, changeEndpoints) {
2776 			_setVisible(el, "none", changeEndpoints);
2777 		};
2778 		
2779 		// exposed for other objects to use to get a unique id.
2780 		this.idstamp = _idstamp;
2781 		
2782 		/**
2783 		 * callback from the current library to tell us to prepare ourselves (attach
2784 		 * mouse listeners etc; can't do that until the library has provided a bind method)		 
2785 		 */
2786 		this.init = function() {
2787 			if (!initialized) {
2788 				_currentInstance.setRenderMode(_currentInstance.Defaults.RenderMode);  // calling the method forces the capability logic to be run.
2789 				
2790 				var bindOne = function(event) {
2791 						jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.bind(document, event, function(e) {
2792 							if (!_currentInstance.currentlyDragging && renderMode == jsPlumb.CANVAS) {
2793 								// try connections first
2794 								for (var scope in connectionsByScope) {
2795 					    			var c = connectionsByScope[scope];
2796 					    			for (var i = 0; i < c.length; i++) {
2797 					    				var t = c[i].connector[event](e);
2798 					    				if (t) return;	
2799 					    			}
2800 					    		}
2801 								for (var el in endpointsByElement) {
2802 									var ee = endpointsByElement[el];
2803 									for (var i = 0; i < ee.length; i++) {
2804 										if (ee[i].endpoint[event](e)) return;
2805 									}
2806 								}
2807 							}
2808 						});					
2809 				};
2810 				bindOne("click");bindOne("dblclick");bindOne("mousemove");bindOne("mousedown");bindOne("mouseup");bindOne("contextmenu");
2811 			
2812 				initialized = true;
2813 				_currentInstance.fire("ready");
2814 			}
2815 		};
2816 		
2817 		this.log = log;
2818 		this.jsPlumbUIComponent = jsPlumbUIComponent;		
2819 
2820 		/*
2821 		 * Creates an anchor with the given params.
2822 		 * 
2823 		 * 
2824 		 * Returns: The newly created Anchor.
2825 		 */
2826 		this.makeAnchor = function() {
2827 			if (arguments.length == 0) return null;
2828 			var specimen = arguments[0], elementId = arguments[1], jsPlumbInstance = arguments[2], newAnchor = null;			
2829 			// if it appears to be an anchor already...
2830 			if (specimen.compute && specimen.getOrientation) return specimen;  //TODO hazy here about whether it should be added or is already added somehow.
2831 			// is it the name of an anchor type?
2832 			else if (typeof specimen == "string") {
2833 				newAnchor = jsPlumb.Anchors[arguments[0]]({elementId:elementId, jsPlumbInstance:_currentInstance});
2834 			}
2835 			// is it an array? it will be one of:
2836 			// 		an array of [name, params] - this defines a single anchor
2837 			//		an array of arrays - this defines some dynamic anchors
2838 			//		an array of numbers - this defines a single anchor.				
2839 			else if (_isArray(specimen)) {
2840 				if (_isArray(specimen[0]) || _isString(specimen[0])) {
2841 					if (specimen.length == 2 && _isString(specimen[0]) && _isObject(specimen[1])) {
2842 						var pp = jsPlumb.extend({elementId:elementId, jsPlumbInstance:_currentInstance}, specimen[1]);
2843 						newAnchor = jsPlumb.Anchors[specimen[0]](pp);
2844 					}
2845 					else
2846 						newAnchor = new DynamicAnchor(specimen, null, elementId);
2847 				}
2848 				else {
2849 					var anchorParams = {
2850 						x:specimen[0], y:specimen[1],
2851 						orientation : (specimen.length >= 4) ? [ specimen[2], specimen[3] ] : [0,0],
2852 						offsets : (specimen.length == 6) ? [ specimen[4], specimen[5] ] : [ 0, 0 ],
2853 						elementId:elementId
2854 					};						
2855 					newAnchor = new Anchor(anchorParams);
2856 					newAnchor.clone = function() { return new Anchor(anchorParams); };						 					
2857 				}
2858 			}
2859 			
2860 			if (!newAnchor.id) newAnchor.id = "anchor_" + _idstamp();
2861 			return newAnchor;
2862 		};
2863 
2864 		/**
2865 		 * makes a list of anchors from the given list of types or coords, eg
2866 		 * ["TopCenter", "RightMiddle", "BottomCenter", [0, 1, -1, -1] ]
2867 		 */
2868 		this.makeAnchors = function(types, elementId, jsPlumbInstance) {
2869 			var r = [];
2870 			for ( var i = 0; i < types.length; i++) {
2871 				if (typeof types[i] == "string")
2872 					r.push(jsPlumb.Anchors[types[i]]({elementId:elementId, jsPlumbInstance:jsPlumbInstance}));
2873 				else if (_isArray(types[i]))
2874 					r.push(_currentInstance.makeAnchor(types[i], elementId, jsPlumbInstance));
2875 			}
2876 			return r;
2877 		};
2878 
2879 		/**
2880 		 * Makes a dynamic anchor from the given list of anchors (which may be in shorthand notation as strings or dimension arrays, or Anchor
2881 		 * objects themselves) and the given, optional, anchorSelector function (jsPlumb uses a default if this is not provided; most people will
2882 		 * not need to provide this - i think). 
2883 		 */
2884 		this.makeDynamicAnchor = function(anchors, anchorSelector) {
2885 			return new DynamicAnchor(anchors, anchorSelector);
2886 		};
2887 		
2888 		/**
2889 		 * Function: makeTarget
2890 		 * Makes some DOM element a Connection target, allowing you to drag connections to it
2891 		 * without having to register any Endpoints on it first.  When a Connection is established,
2892 		 * the endpoint spec that was passed in to this method is used to create a suitable 
2893 		 * Endpoint (the default will be used if you do not provide one).
2894 		 * 
2895 		 * Parameters:
2896 		 *  el		-	string id or element selector for the element to make a target.
2897 		 * 	params	-	JS object containing parameters:
2898 		 * 	  - *endpoint*	optional.	specification of an Endpoint to create when a Connection is established.
2899 		 * 	  - *scope*		optional.   scope for the drop zone.
2900 		 * 	  - *dropOptions* optional. same stuff as you would pass to dropOptions of an Endpoint definition.
2901 		 * 	  - *deleteEndpointsOnDetach*  optional, defaults to true. whether or not to delete
2902 		 *                             any Endpoints created by a connection to this target if
2903 		 *                             the connection is subsequently detached. this will not 
2904 		 *                             remove Endpoints that have had more Connections attached
2905 		 *                             to them after they were created.
2906 		 *   - *maxConnections*  optional. Specifies the maximum number of Connections that can be made to this element as a target. Default is no limit.
2907 		 *   - *onMaxConnections* optional. Function to call when user attempts to drop a connection but the limit has been reached.
2908 		 *   		The callback is passed two arguments: a JS object with:
2909 		 *   		: { element, connection, maxConnection }
2910 		 *   		...and the original event.		 
2911 		 */
2912 		var _targetEndpointDefinitions = {},
2913 			_targetEndpoints = {},
2914 			_targetEndpointsUnique = {},
2915 			_targetMaxConnections = {},
2916 			_setEndpointPaintStylesAndAnchor = function(ep, epIndex) {
2917 				ep.paintStyle = ep.paintStyle ||
2918 				 				_currentInstance.Defaults.EndpointStyles[epIndex] ||
2919 	                            _currentInstance.Defaults.EndpointStyle ||
2920 	                            jsPlumb.Defaults.EndpointStyles[epIndex] ||
2921 	                            jsPlumb.Defaults.EndpointStyle;
2922 				ep.hoverPaintStyle = ep.hoverPaintStyle ||
2923 	                           _currentInstance.Defaults.EndpointHoverStyles[epIndex] ||
2924 	                           _currentInstance.Defaults.EndpointHoverStyle ||
2925 	                           jsPlumb.Defaults.EndpointHoverStyles[epIndex] ||
2926 	                           jsPlumb.Defaults.EndpointHoverStyle;                            
2927 
2928 				ep.anchor = ep.anchor ||
2929 	                      	_currentInstance.Defaults.Anchors[epIndex] ||
2930 	                      	_currentInstance.Defaults.Anchor ||
2931 	                      	jsPlumb.Defaults.Anchors[epIndex] ||
2932 	                      	jsPlumb.Defaults.Anchor;                           
2933 					
2934 				ep.endpoint = ep.endpoint ||
2935 							  _currentInstance.Defaults.Endpoints[epIndex] ||
2936 							  _currentInstance.Defaults.Endpoint ||
2937 							  jsPlumb.Defaults.Endpoints[epIndex] ||
2938 							  jsPlumb.Defaults.Endpoint;
2939 			};
2940 
2941 		this.makeTarget = function(el, params, referenceParams) {						
2942 			
2943 			var p = jsPlumb.extend({_jsPlumb:_currentInstance}, referenceParams);
2944 			jsPlumb.extend(p, params);
2945 			_setEndpointPaintStylesAndAnchor(p, 1);                                                    
2946 			var jpcl = jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary,
2947 			    targetScope = p.scope || _currentInstance.Defaults.Scope,
2948 			    deleteEndpointsOnDetach = !(p.deleteEndpointsOnDetach === false),
2949 			    maxConnections = p.maxConnections || -1,
2950 				onMaxConnections = p.onMaxConnections;
2951 			_doOne = function(_el) {
2952 				
2953 				// get the element's id and store the endpoint definition for it.  jsPlumb.connect calls will look for one of these,
2954 				// and use the endpoint definition if found.
2955 				var elid = _getId(_el);
2956 				_targetEndpointDefinitions[elid] = p;
2957 				_targetEndpointsUnique[elid] = p.uniqueEndpoint,
2958 				_targetMaxConnections[elid] = maxConnections,
2959 				_targetsEnabled[elid] = true,
2960 				proxyComponent = new jsPlumbUIComponent(p);								
2961 				
2962 				var dropOptions = jsPlumb.extend({}, p.dropOptions || {}),
2963 				_drop = function() {
2964 
2965 					var originalEvent = jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.getDropEvent(arguments),
2966 						targetCount = _currentInstance.select({target:elid}).length;																							
2967 
2968 					_currentInstance.currentlyDragging = false;
2969 					var draggable = _getElementObject(jpcl.getDragObject(arguments)),
2970 						id = _getAttribute(draggable, "dragId"),				
2971 						// restore the original scope if necessary (issue 57)
2972 						scope = _getAttribute(draggable, "originalScope"),
2973 						jpc = floatingConnections[id],
2974 						source = jpc.endpoints[0],
2975 						_endpoint = p.endpoint ? jsPlumb.extend({}, p.endpoint) : {};
2976 						
2977 					if (!_targetsEnabled[elid] || _targetMaxConnections[elid] > 0 && targetCount >= _targetMaxConnections[elid]){
2978 						if (onMaxConnections) {
2979 							onMaxConnections({
2980 								element:_el,
2981 								connection:jpc
2982 							}, originalEvent);
2983 						}
2984 						return false;
2985 					}
2986 
2987 					// unlock the source anchor to allow it to refresh its position if necessary
2988 					source.anchor.locked = false;					
2989 										
2990 					if (scope) jpcl.setDragScope(draggable, scope);				
2991 					
2992 					// check if drop is allowed here.					
2993 					//var _continue = jpc.isDropAllowed(jpc.sourceId, _getId(_el), jpc.scope);		
2994 					var _continue = proxyComponent.isDropAllowed(jpc.sourceId, _getId(_el), jpc.scope, jpc, null);		
2995 					
2996 					// regardless of whether the connection is ok, reconfigure the existing connection to 
2997 					// point at the current info. we need this to be correct for the detach event that will follow.
2998 					// clear the source endpoint from the list to detach. we will detach this connection at this
2999 					// point, but we want to keep the source endpoint.  the target is a floating endpoint and should
3000 					// be removed.  TODO need to figure out whether this code can result in endpoints kicking around
3001 					// when they shouldnt be.  like is this a full detach of a connection?  can it be?
3002 					if (jpc.endpointsToDeleteOnDetach) {
3003 						if (source === jpc.endpointsToDeleteOnDetach[0])
3004 							jpc.endpointsToDeleteOnDetach[0] = null;
3005 						else if (source === jpc.endpointsToDeleteOnDetach[1])
3006 							jpc.endpointsToDeleteOnDetach[1] = null;
3007 					}
3008 					// reinstate any suspended endpoint; this just puts the connection back into
3009 					// a state in which it will report sensible values if someone asks it about
3010 					// its target.  we're going to throw this connection away shortly so it doesnt matter
3011 					// if we manipulate it a bit.
3012 					if (jpc.suspendedEndpoint) {
3013 						jpc.targetId = jpc.suspendedEndpoint.elementId;
3014 						jpc.target = jpcl.getElementObject(jpc.suspendedEndpoint.elementId);
3015 						jpc.endpoints[1] = jpc.suspendedEndpoint;
3016 					}																										
3017 					
3018 					if (_continue) {
3019 					
3020 						// detach this connection from the source.						
3021 						source.detach(jpc, false, true, false);
3022 					
3023 						// make a new Endpoint for the target												
3024 						var newEndpoint = _targetEndpoints[elid] || _currentInstance.addEndpoint(_el, p);
3025 						if (p.uniqueEndpoint) _targetEndpoints[elid] = newEndpoint;  // may of course just store what it just pulled out. that's ok.
3026 						newEndpoint._makeTargetCreator = true;
3027 																
3028 						// if the anchor has a 'positionFinder' set, then delegate to that function to find
3029 						// out where to locate the anchor.
3030 						if (newEndpoint.anchor.positionFinder != null) {
3031 							var dropPosition = jpcl.getUIPosition(arguments, _currentInstance.getZoom()),
3032 							elPosition = _getOffset(_el, _currentInstance),
3033 							elSize = _getSize(_el),
3034 							ap = newEndpoint.anchor.positionFinder(dropPosition, elPosition, elSize, newEndpoint.anchor.constructorParams);
3035 							newEndpoint.anchor.x = ap[0];
3036 							newEndpoint.anchor.y = ap[1];
3037 							// now figure an orientation for it..kind of hard to know what to do actually. probably the best thing i can do is to
3038 							// support specifying an orientation in the anchor's spec. if one is not supplied then i will make the orientation 
3039 							// be what will cause the most natural link to the source: it will be pointing at the source, but it needs to be
3040 							// specified in one axis only, and so how to make that choice? i think i will use whichever axis is the one in which
3041 							// the target is furthest away from the source.
3042 						}
3043 						var c = _currentInstance.connect({
3044 							source:source,
3045 							target:newEndpoint,
3046 							scope:scope,
3047 							previousConnection:jpc,
3048 							container:jpc.parent,
3049 							deleteEndpointsOnDetach:deleteEndpointsOnDetach,
3050 							// 'endpointWillMoveAfterConnection' is set by the makeSource function, and it indicates that the
3051 							// given endpoint will actually transfer from the element it is currently attached to to some other
3052 							// element after a connection has been established.  in that case, we do not want to fire the
3053 							// connection event, since it will have the wrong data in it; makeSource will do it for us.
3054 							// this is controlled by the 'parent' parameter on a makeSource call.
3055 							doNotFireConnectionEvent:source.endpointWillMoveAfterConnection
3056 						});
3057 
3058 						// delete the original target endpoint.  but only want to do this if the endpoint was created
3059 						// automatically and has no other connections.
3060 						if (jpc.endpoints[1]._makeTargetCreator && jpc.endpoints[1].connections.length < 2)
3061 							_currentInstance.deleteEndpoint(jpc.endpoints[1]);
3062 
3063 						if (deleteEndpointsOnDetach) 
3064 							c.endpointsToDeleteOnDetach = [ source, newEndpoint ];
3065 
3066 						c.repaint();
3067 					}				
3068 					// if not allowed to drop...
3069 					else {
3070 						// TODO this code is identical (pretty much) to what happens when a connection
3071 						// dragged from a normal endpoint is in this situation. refactor.
3072 						// is this an existing connection, and will we reattach?
3073 						if (jpc.suspendedEndpoint) {
3074 							//if (source.isReattach) {
3075 							if (jpc.isReattach()) {
3076 								jpc.setHover(false);
3077 								jpc.floatingAnchorIndex = null;
3078 								jpc.suspendedEndpoint.addConnection(jpc);
3079 								_currentInstance.repaint(source.elementId);
3080 							}
3081 							else
3082 								source.detach(jpc, false, true, true, originalEvent);  // otherwise, detach the connection and tell everyone about it.
3083 						}
3084 						
3085 					}														
3086 				};
3087 				
3088 				var dropEvent = jpcl.dragEvents['drop'];
3089 				dropOptions["scope"] = dropOptions["scope"] || targetScope;
3090 				dropOptions[dropEvent] = _wrap(dropOptions[dropEvent], _drop);
3091 				
3092 				jpcl.initDroppable(_el, dropOptions, true);
3093 			};
3094 			
3095 			el = _convertYUICollection(el);			
3096 			
3097 			var inputs = el.length && el.constructor != String ? el : [ el ];
3098 						
3099 			for (var i = 0; i < inputs.length; i++) {			
3100 				_doOne(_getElementObject(inputs[i]));
3101 			}
3102 
3103 			return _currentInstance;
3104 		};
3105 
3106 		/*
3107 		*	Function: unmakeTarget
3108 		*	Sets the given element to no longer be a connection target.
3109 		*	
3110 		*	Parameters:
3111 		*		el - a string id, a dom element, or a selector representing the element.
3112 		*		
3113 		*	Returns:
3114 		*	The current jsPlumb instance.
3115 		*/
3116 		this.unmakeTarget = function(el, doNotClearArrays) {
3117 			el = jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.getElementObject(el);
3118 			var elid = _getId(el);			
3119 
3120 			// TODO this is not an exhaustive unmake of a target, since it does not remove the droppable stuff from
3121 			// the element.  the effect will be to prevent it form behaving as a target, but it's not completely purged.
3122 			if (!doNotClearArrays) {
3123 				delete _targetEndpointDefinitions[elid];
3124 				delete _targetEndpointsUnique[elid];
3125 				delete _targetMaxConnections[elid];
3126 				delete _targetsEnabled[elid];
3127 			}
3128 
3129 			return _currentInstance;
3130 		};
3131 		
3132 		/*
3133 		 * Function: makeTargets
3134 		 * Makes all elements in some array or a selector connection targets.
3135 		 * 
3136 		 * Parameters:
3137 		 * 	els 	- 	either an array of ids or a selector
3138 		 *  params  -   parameters to configure each element as a target with
3139 		 *  referenceParams - extra parameters to configure each element as a taretsource with.
3140 		 *
3141 		 * Returns:
3142 		 * The current jsPlumb instance.
3143 		 */
3144 		this.makeTargets = function(els, params, referenceParams) {
3145 			for ( var i = 0; i < els.length; i++) {
3146 				_currentInstance.makeTarget(els[i], params, referenceParams);				
3147 			}
3148 		};
3149 		
3150 		/**
3151 		 * Function: makeSource
3152 		 * Makes some DOM element a Connection source, allowing you to drag connections from it
3153 		 * without having to register any Endpoints on it first.  When a Connection is established,
3154 		 * the endpoint spec that was passed in to this method is used to create a suitable 
3155 		 * Endpoint (the default will be used if you do not provide one).
3156 		 * 
3157 		 * Parameters:
3158 		 *  el		-	string id or element selector for the element to make a source.
3159 		 * 	params	-	JS object containing parameters:
3160 		 * 	  - *endpoint*	optional.	specification of an endpoint to create when a connection is created.
3161 		 * 	  - *parent*	optional.   the element to add Endpoints to when a Connection is established.  if you omit this, 
3162 		 *                          Endpoints will be added to 'el'.
3163 		 * 	  - *scope*		optional.   scope for the connections dragged from this element.
3164 		 * 	  - *dragOptions* optional. same stuff as you would pass to dragOptions of an Endpoint definition.
3165 		 * 	  - *deleteEndpointsOnDetach*  optional, defaults to false. whether or not to delete
3166 		 *                             any Endpoints created by a connection from this source if
3167 		 *                             the connection is subsequently detached. this will not 
3168 		 *                             remove Endpoints that have had more Connections attached
3169 		 *                             to them after they were created.
3170 		 * 	  - *filter* - optional function to call when the user presses the mouse button to start a drag. This function is passed the original 
3171 		 * event and the element on which the associated makeSource call was made.  If it returns anything other than false,
3172 		 * the drag begins as usual. But if it returns false (the boolean false, not just something falsey), the drag is aborted.
3173 		 *                   	
3174 		 * 
3175 		 */
3176 		var _sourceEndpointDefinitions = {},
3177 			_sourceEndpoints = {},
3178 			_sourceEndpointsUnique = {},
3179 			_sourcesEnabled = {},
3180 			_sourceTriggers = {},
3181 			_sourceMaxConnections = {},
3182 			_targetsEnabled = {};
3183 
3184 		this.makeSource = function(el, params, referenceParams) {
3185 			var p = jsPlumb.extend({}, referenceParams);
3186 			jsPlumb.extend(p, params);
3187 			_setEndpointPaintStylesAndAnchor(p, 0);   
3188 			var jpcl = jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary,
3189 				maxConnections = p.maxConnections || -1,
3190 				onMaxConnections = p.onMaxConnections,
3191 			_doOne = function(_el) {
3192 				// get the element's id and store the endpoint definition for it.  jsPlumb.connect calls will look for one of these,
3193 				// and use the endpoint definition if found.
3194 				var elid = _getId(_el),
3195 					parent = p.parent,
3196 					idToRegisterAgainst = parent != null ? _currentInstance.getId(jpcl.getElementObject(parent)) : elid;
3197 				
3198 				_sourceEndpointDefinitions[idToRegisterAgainst] = p;
3199 				_sourceEndpointsUnique[idToRegisterAgainst] = p.uniqueEndpoint;
3200 				_sourcesEnabled[idToRegisterAgainst] = true;
3201 
3202 				var stopEvent = jpcl.dragEvents["stop"],
3203 					dragEvent = jpcl.dragEvents["drag"],
3204 					dragOptions = jsPlumb.extend({ }, p.dragOptions || {}),
3205 					existingDrag = dragOptions.drag,
3206 					existingStop = dragOptions.stop,
3207 					ep = null,
3208 					endpointAddedButNoDragYet = false;
3209 				
3210 				_sourceMaxConnections[idToRegisterAgainst] = maxConnections;	
3211 
3212 				// set scope if its not set in dragOptions but was passed in in params
3213 				dragOptions["scope"] = dragOptions["scope"] || p.scope;
3214 
3215 				dragOptions[dragEvent] = _wrap(dragOptions[dragEvent], function() {
3216 					if (existingDrag) existingDrag.apply(this, arguments);
3217 					endpointAddedButNoDragYet = false;
3218 				});
3219 					
3220 				dragOptions[stopEvent] = _wrap(dragOptions[stopEvent], function() { 							
3221 					if (existingStop) existingStop.apply(this, arguments);								
3222 
3223                     //_currentlyDown = false;
3224 					_currentInstance.currentlyDragging = false;
3225 					
3226 					if (ep.connections.length == 0)
3227 						_currentInstance.deleteEndpoint(ep);
3228 					else {
3229 						
3230 						jpcl.unbind(ep.canvas, "mousedown"); 
3231 								
3232 						// reset the anchor to the anchor that was initially provided. the one we were using to drag
3233 						// the connection was just a placeholder that was located at the place the user pressed the
3234 						// mouse button to initiate the drag.
3235 						var anchorDef = p.anchor || _currentInstance.Defaults.Anchor,
3236 							oldAnchor = ep.anchor,
3237 							oldConnection = ep.connections[0];
3238 
3239 						ep.anchor = _currentInstance.makeAnchor(anchorDef, elid, _currentInstance);																							
3240 						
3241 						if (p.parent) {						
3242 							var parent = jpcl.getElementObject(p.parent);
3243 							if (parent) {	
3244 								var currentId = ep.elementId;
3245 											
3246 								var potentialParent = p.container || _currentInstance.Defaults.Container || jsPlumb.Defaults.Container;			
3247 																
3248 								ep.setElement(parent, potentialParent);
3249 								ep.endpointWillMoveAfterConnection = false;														
3250 								_currentInstance.anchorManager.rehomeEndpoint(currentId, parent);													
3251 								oldConnection.previousConnection = null;
3252 								// remove from connectionsByScope
3253 								_removeWithFunction(connectionsByScope[oldConnection.scope], function(c) {
3254 									return c.id === oldConnection.id;
3255 								});										
3256 								_currentInstance.anchorManager.connectionDetached({
3257 									sourceId:oldConnection.sourceId,
3258 									targetId:oldConnection.targetId,
3259 									connection:oldConnection
3260 								});											
3261 								_finaliseConnection(oldConnection);					
3262 							}
3263 						}						
3264 						
3265 						ep.repaint();			
3266 						_currentInstance.repaint(ep.elementId);																		
3267 						_currentInstance.repaint(oldConnection.targetId);
3268 
3269 					}				
3270 				});
3271 				// when the user presses the mouse, add an Endpoint, if we are enabled.
3272 				var mouseDownListener = function(e) {
3273 
3274 					// if disabled, return.
3275 					if (!_sourcesEnabled[idToRegisterAgainst]) return;
3276 					
3277 					// if maxConnections reached
3278 					var sourceCount = _currentInstance.select({source:idToRegisterAgainst}).length
3279 					if (_sourceMaxConnections[idToRegisterAgainst] >= 0 && sourceCount >= _sourceMaxConnections[idToRegisterAgainst]) {
3280 						if (onMaxConnections) {
3281 							onMaxConnections({
3282 								element:_el,
3283 								maxConnections:maxConnections
3284 							}, e);
3285 						}
3286 						return false;
3287 					}
3288 
3289 					// if a filter was given, run it, and return if it says no.
3290 					if (params.filter) {
3291 						// pass the original event to the user: 
3292 						var r = params.filter(jpcl.getOriginalEvent(e), _el);
3293 						if (r === false) return;
3294 					}
3295 
3296 					// make sure we have the latest offset for this div 
3297 					var myOffsetInfo = _updateOffset({elId:elid});		
3298 
3299 					var x = ((e.pageX || e.page.x) - myOffsetInfo.left) / myOffsetInfo.width, 
3300 					    y = ((e.pageY || e.page.y) - myOffsetInfo.top) / myOffsetInfo.height,
3301 					    parentX = x, 
3302 					    parentY = y;					
3303 							
3304 					// if there is a parent, the endpoint will actually be added to it now, rather than the div
3305 					// that was the source.  in that case, we have to adjust the anchor position so it refers to
3306 					// the parent.
3307 					if (p.parent) {
3308 						var pEl = jpcl.getElementObject(p.parent),
3309 							pId = _getId(pEl);
3310 						myOffsetInfo = _updateOffset({elId:pId});
3311 						parentX = ((e.pageX || e.page.x) - myOffsetInfo.left) / myOffsetInfo.width, 
3312 					    parentY = ((e.pageY || e.page.y) - myOffsetInfo.top) / myOffsetInfo.height;
3313 					}											
3314 					
3315 					// we need to override the anchor in here, and force 'isSource', but we don't want to mess with
3316 					// the params passed in, because after a connection is established we're going to reset the endpoint
3317 					// to have the anchor we were given.
3318 					var tempEndpointParams = {};
3319 					jsPlumb.extend(tempEndpointParams, p);
3320 					tempEndpointParams.isSource = true;
3321 					tempEndpointParams.anchor = [x,y,0,0];
3322 					tempEndpointParams.parentAnchor = [ parentX, parentY, 0, 0 ];
3323 					tempEndpointParams.dragOptions = dragOptions;
3324 					// if a parent was given we need to turn that into a "container" argument.  this is, by default,
3325 					// the parent of the element we will move to, so parent of p.parent in this case.  however, if
3326 					// the user has specified a 'container' on the endpoint definition or on 
3327 					// the defaults, we should use that.
3328 					if (p.parent) {
3329 						var potentialParent = tempEndpointParams.container || _currentInstance.Defaults.Container || jsPlumb.Defaults.Container;
3330 						if (potentialParent)
3331 							tempEndpointParams.container = potentialParent;
3332 						else
3333 							tempEndpointParams.container = jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.getParent(p.parent);
3334 					}
3335 					
3336 					ep = _currentInstance.addEndpoint(elid, tempEndpointParams);
3337 
3338 					endpointAddedButNoDragYet = true;
3339 					// we set this to prevent connections from firing attach events before this function has had a chance
3340 					// to move the endpoint.
3341 					ep.endpointWillMoveAfterConnection = p.parent != null;
3342 					ep.endpointWillMoveTo = p.parent ? jpcl.getElementObject(p.parent) : null;
3343 
3344                     var _delTempEndpoint = function() {
3345 						// this mouseup event is fired only if no dragging occurred, by jquery and yui, but for mootools
3346 						// it is fired even if dragging has occurred, in which case we would blow away a perfectly
3347 						// legitimate endpoint, were it not for this check.  the flag is set after adding an
3348 						// endpoint and cleared in a drag listener we set in the dragOptions above.
3349 						if(endpointAddedButNoDragYet) {
3350 							_currentInstance.deleteEndpoint(ep);
3351                         }
3352 					};
3353 
3354 					_currentInstance.registerListener(ep.canvas, "mouseup", _delTempEndpoint);
3355                     _currentInstance.registerListener(_el, "mouseup", _delTempEndpoint);
3356 					
3357 					// and then trigger its mousedown event, which will kick off a drag, which will start dragging
3358 					// a new connection from this endpoint.
3359 					jpcl.trigger(ep.canvas, "mousedown", e);
3360 				};
3361                
3362                 // register this on jsPlumb so that it can be cleared by a reset.
3363                 _currentInstance.registerListener(_el, "mousedown", mouseDownListener);
3364                 _sourceTriggers[elid] = mouseDownListener;
3365 			};
3366 			
3367 			el = _convertYUICollection(el);			
3368 			
3369 			var inputs = el.length && el.constructor != String ? el : [ el ];
3370 						
3371 			for (var i = 0; i < inputs.length; i++) {			
3372 				_doOne(_getElementObject(inputs[i]));
3373 			}
3374 
3375 			return _currentInstance;
3376 		};
3377 
3378 		/**
3379 		*	Function: unmakeSource
3380 		*	Sets the given element to no longer be a connection source.
3381 		*	
3382 		*	Parameters:
3383 		*		el - a string id, a dom element, or a selector representing the element.
3384 		*		
3385 		*	Returns:
3386 		*	The current jsPlumb instance.
3387 		*/
3388 		this.unmakeSource = function(el, doNotClearArrays) {
3389 			el = jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.getElementObject(el);
3390 			var id = _getId(el),
3391 				mouseDownListener = _sourceTriggers[id];
3392 			
3393 			if (mouseDownListener) 
3394 				_currentInstance.unregisterListener(_el, "mousedown", mouseDownListener);
3395 
3396 			if (!doNotClearArrays) {
3397 				delete _sourceEndpointDefinitions[id];
3398 				delete _sourceEndpointsUnique[id];
3399 				delete _sourcesEnabled[id];
3400 				delete _sourceTriggers[id];
3401 				delete _sourceMaxConnections[id];
3402 			}
3403 
3404 			return _currentInstance;
3405 		};
3406 
3407 		/*
3408 		*	Function: unmakeEverySource
3409 		*	Resets all elements in this instance of jsPlumb so that none of them are connection sources.
3410 		*	
3411 		*	Returns:
3412 		*	The current jsPlumb instance.
3413 		*/
3414 		this.unmakeEverySource = function() {
3415 			for (var i in _sourcesEnabled)
3416 				_currentInstance.unmakeSource(i, true);
3417 
3418 			_sourceEndpointDefinitions = {};
3419 			_sourceEndpointsUnique = {};
3420 			_sourcesEnabled = {};
3421 			_sourceTriggers = {};
3422 		};
3423 
3424 		/*
3425 		*	Function: unmakeEveryTarget
3426 		*	Resets all elements in this instance of jsPlumb so that none of them are connection targets.
3427 		*	
3428 		*	Returns:
3429 		*	The current jsPlumb instance.
3430 		*/
3431 		this.unmakeEveryTarget = function() {
3432 			for (var i in _targetsEnabled)
3433 				_currentInstance.unmakeTarget(i, true);
3434 			
3435 			_targetEndpointDefinitions = {};
3436 			_targetEndpointsUnique = {};
3437 			_targetMaxConnections = {};
3438 			_targetsEnabled = {};
3439 
3440 			return _currentInstance;
3441 		};
3442 		
3443 		/*
3444 		 * Function: makeSources
3445 		 * Makes all elements in some array or a selector connection sources.
3446 		 * 
3447 		 * Parameters:
3448 		 * 	els 	- 	either an array of ids or a selector
3449 		 *  params  -   parameters to configure each element as a source with
3450 		 *  referenceParams - extra parameters to configure each element as a source with.
3451 		 *
3452 		 * Returns:
3453 		 * The current jsPlumb instance.
3454 		 */
3455 		this.makeSources = function(els, params, referenceParams) {
3456 			for ( var i = 0; i < els.length; i++) {
3457 				_currentInstance.makeSource(els[i], params, referenceParams);				
3458 			}
3459 
3460 			return _currentInstance;
3461 		};
3462 
3463 		// does the work of setting a source enabled or disabled.
3464 		var _setEnabled = function(type, el, state, toggle) {
3465 			var a = type == "source" ? _sourcesEnabled : _targetsEnabled;									
3466 
3467 			if (_isString(el)) a[el] = toggle ? !a[el] : state;
3468 			else if (el.length) {
3469 				el = _convertYUICollection(el);
3470 				for (var i = 0; i < el.length; i++) {
3471 					var id = _el = jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.getElementObject(el[i]), id = _getId(_el);
3472 					a[id] = toggle ? !a[id] : state;
3473 				}
3474 			}	
3475 			return _currentInstance;
3476 		};
3477 
3478 		/*
3479 		* Function: setSourceEnabled
3480 		* Sets the enabled state of one or more elements that were previously made a connection source with the makeSource
3481 		* method.
3482 		*
3483 		* Parameters:
3484 		*	el 	- 	either a string representing some element's id, or an array of ids, or a selector.
3485 		*	state - true to enable the element(s), false to disable it.
3486 		*
3487 		* Returns:
3488 		*	The current jsPlumb instance.
3489 		*/
3490 		this.setSourceEnabled = function(el, state) {
3491 			return _setEnabled("source", el, state);
3492 		};
3493 
3494 		/*
3495 		*	Function: toggleSourceEnabled
3496 		*	Toggles the source enabled state of the given element or elements.
3497 		*
3498 		* 	Parameters:
3499 		*		el 	- 	either a string representing some element's id, or an array of ids, or a selector.
3500 		*		state - true to enable the element(s), false to disable it.
3501 		*
3502 		*	Returns:
3503 		*	The current enabled state of the source.
3504 		*/	
3505 		this.toggleSourceEnabled = function(el) {
3506 			_setEnabled("source", el, null, true);	
3507 			return _currentInstance.isSourceEnabled(el);
3508 		};
3509 
3510 		/*
3511 		*	Function: isSource
3512 		*	Returns whether or not the given element is registered as a connection source.
3513 		*
3514 		*	Parameters:
3515 		*		el 	- 	a string id, a dom element, or a selector representing a single element.
3516 		*
3517 		*	Returns:
3518 		*	True if source, false if not.
3519 		*/
3520 		this.isSource = function(el) {
3521 			el = jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.getElementObject(el);
3522 			return _sourcesEnabled[_getId(el)] != null;
3523 		};
3524 
3525 		/*
3526 		*	Function: isSourceEnabled
3527 		*	Returns whether or not the given connection source is enabled.
3528 		*
3529 		*	Parameters:
3530 		*	el 	- 	a string id, a dom element, or a selector representing a single element.
3531 		*
3532 		*	Returns:
3533 		*	True if enabled, false if not.
3534 		*/
3535 		this.isSourceEnabled = function(el) {
3536 			el = jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.getElementObject(el);
3537 			return _sourcesEnabled[_getId(el)] === true;
3538 		};
3539 
3540 		/*
3541 		*	Function: setTargetEnabled
3542 		*	Sets the enabled state of one or more elements that were previously made a connection target with the makeTarget method.
3543 		*	method.
3544 		*
3545 		*	Parameters:
3546 		*		el 	- 	either a string representing some element's id, or an array of ids, or a selector.
3547 		*		state - true to enable the element(s), false to disable it.
3548 		*
3549 		*	Returns:
3550 		*	The current jsPlumb instance.
3551 		*/
3552 		this.setTargetEnabled = function(el, state) {
3553 			return _setEnabled("target", el, state);
3554 		};
3555 
3556 		/*
3557 		*	Function: toggleTargetEnabled
3558 		*	Toggles the target enabled state of the given element or elements.
3559 		*
3560 		*	Parameters:
3561 		*		el 	- 	either a string representing some element's id, or an array of ids, or a selector.
3562 		*		state - true to enable the element(s), false to disable it.
3563 		*
3564 		*	Returns:
3565 		*	The current enabled state of the target.
3566 		*/	
3567 		this.toggleTargetEnabled = function(el) {
3568 			return _setEnabled("target", el, null, true);	
3569 			return _currentInstance.isTargetEnabled(el);
3570 		};
3571 
3572 		/*
3573 			Function: isTarget
3574 			Returns whether or not the given element is registered as a connection target.
3575 
3576 			Parameters:
3577 				el 	- 	a string id, a dom element, or a selector representing a single element.
3578 
3579 			Returns:
3580 			True if source, false if not.
3581 		*/
3582 		this.isTarget = function(el) {
3583 			el = jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.getElementObject(el);
3584 			return _targetsEnabled[_getId(el)] != null;
3585 		};
3586 
3587 		/*
3588 			Function: isTargetEnabled
3589 			Returns whether or not the given connection target is enabled.
3590 
3591 			Parameters:
3592 				el 	- 	a string id, a dom element, or a selector representing a single element.
3593 
3594 			Returns:
3595 			True if enabled, false if not.
3596 		*/
3597 		this.isTargetEnabled = function(el) {
3598 			el = jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.getElementObject(el);
3599 			return _targetsEnabled[_getId(el)] === true;
3600 		};
3601 		
3602 		/*
3603 		* Function: ready
3604 		* Helper method to bind a function to jsPlumb's ready event. You should use this method instead of your
3605 		* library's equivalent, to ensure that jsPlumb has loaded properly before you start to use it. This is
3606 		* particularly true in the case of YUI, because of the asynchronous nature of the module loading process.
3607 		 */
3608 		this.ready = function(fn) {
3609 			_currentInstance.bind("ready", fn);
3610 		};
3611 
3612 		/*
3613 		* Function: repaint 
3614 		* Repaints an element and its connections. This method gets new sizes for the elements before painting anything.
3615 		*  
3616 		* Parameters: 
3617 		*	el - id of the element, a dom element, or a selector representing the element.
3618 		*  	 
3619 		* Returns: 
3620 		*	The current jsPlumb instance.
3621 		*  	 
3622 		* See Also: 
3623 		*	<repaintEverything>
3624 		*/
3625 		this.repaint = function(el, ui, timestamp) {
3626 			// support both lists...
3627 			if (typeof el == 'object')
3628 				for ( var i = 0; i < el.length; i++) {			
3629 					_draw(_getElementObject(el[i]), ui, timestamp);
3630 				}
3631 			else // ...and single strings.				
3632 				_draw(_getElementObject(el), ui, timestamp);
3633 				
3634 			return _currentInstance;
3635 		};
3636 
3637 		/*
3638 		* Function: repaintEverything 
3639 		* Repaints all connections.
3640 		*  
3641 		* Returns: 
3642 		*	The current jsPlumb instance.
3643 		* 	
3644 		* See Also: 
3645 		*	<repaint>
3646 		*/
3647 		this.repaintEverything = function() {				
3648 			for ( var elId in endpointsByElement) {
3649 				_draw(_getElementObject(elId));
3650 			}
3651 			return _currentInstance;
3652 		};
3653 
3654 		/*
3655 		* Function: removeAllEndpoints 
3656 		* Removes all Endpoints associated with a given element. Also removes all Connections associated with each Endpoint it removes.
3657 		* 
3658 		* Parameters: 
3659 		*	el - either an element id, or a selector for an element.
3660 		*  	 
3661 		* Returns: 
3662 		* The current jsPlumb instance.
3663 		*  	 
3664 		* See Also: 
3665 		* <removeEndpoint>
3666 		*/
3667 		this.removeAllEndpoints = function(el) {
3668 			var elId = _getAttribute(el, "id"),
3669 			    ebe = endpointsByElement[elId];
3670 			if (ebe) {
3671 				for ( var i = 0; i < ebe.length; i++) 
3672 					_currentInstance.deleteEndpoint(ebe[i]);
3673 			}
3674 			endpointsByElement[elId] = [];
3675 			return _currentInstance;
3676 		};
3677 		
3678 
3679 		var _registeredListeners = {},
3680 			_unbindRegisteredListeners = function() {
3681 				for (var i in _registeredListeners) {
3682 					for (var j = 0; j < _registeredListeners[i].length; j++) {
3683 						var info = _registeredListeners[i][j];
3684 						jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.unbind(info.el, info.event, info.listener);
3685 					}
3686 				}
3687 				_registeredListeners = {};
3688 			};
3689 
3690         // internal register listener method.  gives us a hook to clean things up
3691         // with if the user calls jsPlumb.reset.
3692         this.registerListener = function(el, type, listener) {
3693             jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.bind(el, type, listener);
3694             _addToList(_registeredListeners, type, {el:el, event:type, listener:listener});
3695         };
3696 
3697         this.unregisterListener = function(el, type, listener) {
3698         	jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.unbind(el, type, listener);
3699         	_removeWithFunction(_registeredListeners, function(rl) {
3700         		return rl.type == type && rl.listener == listener;
3701         	});
3702         };
3703 
3704 		/*
3705 		* Function:reset 
3706 		* Removes all endpoints and connections and clears the listener list. To keep listeners call
3707 		* : jsPlumb.deleteEveryEndpoint()
3708 		* instead of this.
3709 		*/
3710 		this.reset = function() {			
3711 			_currentInstance.deleteEveryEndpoint();
3712 			_currentInstance.unbind();
3713 			_targetEndpointDefinitions = {};
3714 			_targetEndpoints = {};
3715 			_targetEndpointsUnique = {};
3716 			_targetMaxConnections = {};
3717 			_sourceEndpointDefinitions = {};
3718 			_sourceEndpoints = {};
3719 			_sourceEndpointsUnique = {};
3720 			_sourceMaxConnections = {};
3721 			_unbindRegisteredListeners();
3722 			_currentInstance.anchorManager.reset();
3723 			if (!jsPlumbAdapter.headless)
3724 				_currentInstance.dragManager.reset();
3725 		};
3726 		
3727 		/*
3728 		 * Function: setDefaultScope 
3729 		 * Sets the default scope for Connections and Endpoints. A scope defines a type of Endpoint/Connection; supplying a
3730 		 * scope to an Endpoint or Connection allows you to support different
3731 		 * types of Connections in the same UI.  If you're only interested in
3732 		 * one type of Connection, you don't need to supply a scope. This method
3733 		 * will probably be used by very few people; it just instructs jsPlumb
3734 		 * to use a different key for the default scope.
3735 		 * 
3736 		 * Parameters:
3737 		 * 	scope - scope to set as default.
3738 		 *
3739 		 * Returns:
3740 		 * The current jsPlumb instance.
3741 		 */
3742 		this.setDefaultScope = function(scope) {
3743 			DEFAULT_SCOPE = scope;
3744 			return _currentInstance;
3745 		};
3746 
3747 		/*
3748 		 * Function: setDraggable 
3749 		 * Sets whether or not a given element is
3750 		 * draggable, regardless of what any jsPlumb command may request.
3751 		 * 
3752 		 * Parameters: 
3753 		 * 	el - either the id for the element, or a selector representing the element.
3754 		 * 	draggable - whether or not the element should be draggable.
3755 		 *  
3756 		 * Returns: 
3757 		 * 	void
3758 		 */
3759 		this.setDraggable = _setDraggable;
3760 
3761 		/*
3762 		* Function: setId
3763 		* Changes the id of some element, adjusting all connections and endpoints
3764 		*
3765 		* Parameters:
3766 		* 	el - a selector, a DOM element, or a string. 
3767 		* 	newId - string.
3768 		*/
3769 		this.setId = function(el, newId, doNotSetAttribute) {
3770 		
3771 			var id = el.constructor == String ? el : _currentInstance.getId(el),
3772 				sConns = _currentInstance.getConnections({source:id, scope:'*'}, true),
