3773 				tConns = _currentInstance.getConnections({target:id, scope:'*'}, true);
3774 
3775 			newId = "" + newId;
3776 							
3777 			if (!doNotSetAttribute) {
3778 				el = jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.getElementObject(id);
3779 				jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.setAttribute(el, "id", newId);
3780 			}
3781 			
3782 			el = jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.getElementObject(newId);
3783 			
3784 
3785 			endpointsByElement[newId] = endpointsByElement[id] || [];
3786 			for (var i = 0; i < endpointsByElement[newId].length; i++) {
3787 				endpointsByElement[newId][i].elementId = newId;
3788 				endpointsByElement[newId][i].element = el;
3789 				endpointsByElement[newId][i].anchor.elementId = newId;
3790 			}
3791 			delete endpointsByElement[id];
3792 
3793 			_currentInstance.anchorManager.changeId(id, newId);
3794 
3795 			var _conns = function(list, epIdx, type) {
3796 				for (var i = 0; i < list.length; i++) {
3797 					list[i].endpoints[epIdx].elementId = newId;
3798 					list[i].endpoints[epIdx].element = el;
3799 					list[i][type + "Id"] = newId;
3800 					list[i][type] = el;
3801 				}
3802 			};
3803 			_conns(sConns, 0, "source");
3804 			_conns(tConns, 1, "target");
3805 		};
3806 
3807 		/*
3808 		* Function: setIdChanged
3809 		* Notify jsPlumb that the element with oldId has had its id changed to newId.
3810 		*
3811 		* This method is equivalent to what jsPlumb does itself in the second step of the setId method above.
3812 		*
3813 		* Parameters:
3814 		* 	oldId	- 	previous element id
3815 		* 	newId	-	element's new id
3816 		*
3817 		* See Also:
3818 		* 	<setId>
3819 		*/
3820 		this.setIdChanged = function(oldId, newId) {
3821 			_currentInstance.setId(oldId, newId, true);
3822 		};
3823 
3824 		this.setDebugLog = function(debugLog) {
3825 			log = debugLog;
3826 		};
3827 
3828 		
3829 		var _suspendDrawing = false,
3830 				_suspendedAt = null;
3831 		/*
3832 		 * Function: setSuspendDrawing
3833 		 * Suspends drawing operations.  This can (and should!) be used when you have a lot of connections to make or endpoints to register;
3834 		 * it will save you a lot of time.
3835 		 *
3836 		 * Parameters:
3837 		 * 	val	-	boolean indicating whether to suspend or not
3838 		 * 	repaintAfterwards	-	optional boolean instructing jsPlumb to do a full repaint after changing the suspension
3839 		 * 	state. defaults to false.
3840 		 */
3841 		this.setSuspendDrawing = function(val, repaintAfterwards) {
3842 		    _suspendDrawing = val;
3843 				if (val) _suspendedAt = new Date().getTime(); else _suspendedAt = null;
3844 		    if (repaintAfterwards) _currentInstance.repaintEverything();
3845 		};
3846         
3847 		/*
3848 		* Function: isSuspendDrawing
3849 		* Returns whether or not drawing is currently suspended.
3850 		*/
3851 		this.isSuspendDrawing = function() {
3852 			return _suspendDrawing;
3853 		};
3854 		
3855 		/*
3856 		 * Property: CANVAS
3857 		 * Constant for use with the setRenderMode method
3858 		 */
3859 		this.CANVAS = "canvas";
3860 		
3861 		/*
3862 		 * Property: SVG
3863 		 * Constant for use with the setRenderMode method
3864 		 */
3865 		this.SVG = "svg";
3866 		
3867 		/*
3868 		 * Property: VML
3869 		 * Constant for use with the setRenderMode method
3870 		 */
3871 		this.VML = "vml";
3872 		
3873 		/*
3874 		 * Function: setRenderMode
3875 		 * Sets render mode: jsPlumb.CANVAS, jsPlumb.SVG or jsPlumb.VML.  jsPlumb will fall back to VML if it determines that
3876 		 * what you asked for is not supported (and that VML is).  If you asked for VML but the browser does
3877 		 * not support it, jsPlumb uses SVG.
3878 		 *
3879 		 * Parameters:
3880 		 * mode	-	a string representing the mode. Use one of the jsPlumb render mode constants as discussed above.
3881 		 * 
3882 		 * Returns:
3883 		 * The render mode that jsPlumb set, which of course may be different from that requested.
3884 		 */
3885 		this.setRenderMode = function(mode) {			
3886 			renderMode = jsPlumbAdapter.setRenderMode(mode);
3887 			return renderMode;
3888 		};
3889 		
3890 		/*
3891 		 * Function: getRenderMode
3892 		 *
3893 		 * Returns:
3894 		 * The current render mode.
3895 		 */
3896 		this.getRenderMode = function() { return renderMode; };
3897 
3898 		/*
3899 		 * Function: show 
3900 		 * Sets an element's connections to be visible.
3901 		 * 
3902 		 * Parameters: 
3903 		 * 	el - either the id of the element, or a selector for the element.
3904 		 *  changeEndpoints - whether or not to also change the visible state of the endpoints on the element.  this also has a bearing on
3905 		 *  other connections on those endpoints: if their other endpoint is also visible, the connections are made visible.  
3906 		 *  
3907 		 * Returns: 
3908 		 * 	The current jsPlumb instance.
3909 		 */
3910 		this.show = function(el, changeEndpoints) {
3911 			_setVisible(el, "block", changeEndpoints);
3912 			return _currentInstance;
3913 		};
3914 
3915 		/*
3916 		 * Function: sizeCanvas 
3917 		 * Helper to size a canvas. You would typically use
3918 		 * this when writing your own Connector or Endpoint implementation.
3919 		 * 
3920 		 * Parameters: 
3921 		 * 	x - [int] x position for the Canvas origin 
3922 		 * 	y - [int] y position for the Canvas origin 
3923 		 * 	w - [int] width of the canvas 
3924 		 * 	h - [int] height of the canvas
3925 		 *  
3926 		 * Returns: 
3927 		 * 	The current jsPlumb instance
3928 		 */
3929 		this.sizeCanvas = function(canvas, x, y, w, h) {
3930 			if (canvas) {
3931 				canvas.style.height = h + "px";
3932 				canvas.height = h;
3933 				canvas.style.width = w + "px";
3934 				canvas.width = w;
3935 				canvas.style.left = x + "px";
3936 				canvas.style.top = y + "px";
3937 			}
3938 			return _currentInstance;
3939 		};
3940 
3941 		/**
3942 		 * gets some test hooks. nothing writable.
3943 		 */
3944 		this.getTestHarness = function() {
3945 			return {
3946 				endpointsByElement : endpointsByElement,  
3947 				endpointCount : function(elId) {
3948 					var e = endpointsByElement[elId];
3949 					return e ? e.length : 0;
3950 				},
3951 				connectionCount : function(scope) {
3952 					scope = scope || DEFAULT_SCOPE;
3953 					var c = connectionsByScope[scope];
3954 					return c ? c.length : 0;
3955 				},
3956 				//findIndex : _findIndex,
3957 				getId : _getId,
3958 				makeAnchor:self.makeAnchor,
3959 				makeDynamicAnchor:self.makeDynamicAnchor
3960 			};
3961 		};
3962 
3963 		/**
3964 		 * Toggles visibility of an element's connections. kept for backwards
3965 		 * compatibility
3966 		 */
3967 		this.toggle = _toggleVisible;
3968 
3969 		/*
3970 		 * Function: toggleVisible 
3971 		 * Toggles visibility of an element's Connections.
3972 		 *  
3973 		 * Parameters: 
3974 		 * 	el - either the element's id, or a selector representing the element.
3975 		 *  changeEndpoints - whether or not to also toggle the endpoints on the element.
3976 		 *  
3977 		 * Returns: 
3978 		 * 	void, but should be updated to return the current state
3979 		 */
3980 		// TODO: update this method to return the current state.
3981 		this.toggleVisible = _toggleVisible;
3982 
3983 		/*
3984 		 * Function: toggleDraggable 
3985 		 * Toggles draggability (sic?) of an element's Connections.
3986 		 *  
3987 		 * Parameters: 
3988 		 * 	el - either the element's id, or a selector representing the element.
3989 		 *  
3990 		 * Returns: 
3991 		 * 	The current draggable state.
3992 		 */
3993 		this.toggleDraggable = _toggleDraggable;		
3994 
3995 		/*
3996 		 * Helper method to wrap an existing function with one of
3997 		 * your own. This is used by the various implementations to wrap event
3998 		 * callbacks for drag/drop etc; it allows jsPlumb to be transparent in
3999 		 * its handling of these things. If a user supplies their own event
4000 		 * callback, for anything, it will always be called. 
4001 		 */
4002 		this.wrap = _wrap;			
4003 		this.addListener = this.bind;
4004 		
4005 		var adjustForParentOffsetAndScroll = function(xy, el) {
4006 
4007 			var offsetParent = null, result = xy;
4008 			if (el.tagName.toLowerCase() === "svg" && el.parentNode) {
4009 				offsetParent = el.parentNode;
4010 			}
4011 			else if (el.offsetParent) {
4012 				offsetParent = el.offsetParent;					
4013 			}
4014 			if (offsetParent != null) {
4015 				var po = offsetParent.tagName.toLowerCase() === "body" ? {left:0,top:0} : _getOffset(offsetParent, _currentInstance),
4016 					so = offsetParent.tagName.toLowerCase() === "body" ? {left:0,top:0} : {left:offsetParent.scrollLeft, top:offsetParent.scrollTop};					
4017 
4018 
4019 				// i thought it might be cool to do this:
4020 				//	lastReturnValue[0] = lastReturnValue[0] - offsetParent.offsetLeft + offsetParent.scrollLeft;
4021 				//	lastReturnValue[1] = lastReturnValue[1] - offsetParent.offsetTop + offsetParent.scrollTop;					
4022 				// but i think it ignores margins.  my reasoning was that it's quicker to not hand off to some underlying					
4023 				// library.
4024 				
4025 				result[0] = xy[0] - po.left + so.left;
4026 				result[1] = xy[1] - po.top + so.top;
4027 			}
4028 		
4029 			return result;
4030 			
4031 		};
4032 
4033 		/**
4034 		 * Anchors model a position on some element at which an Endpoint may be located.  They began as a first class citizen of jsPlumb, ie. a user
4035 		 * was required to create these themselves, but over time this has been replaced by the concept of referring to them either by name (eg. "TopMiddle"),
4036 		 * or by an array describing their coordinates (eg. [ 0, 0.5, 0, -1 ], which is the same as "TopMiddle").  jsPlumb now handles all of the
4037 		 * creation of Anchors without user intervention.
4038 		 */
4039 		var Anchor = function(params) {
4040 			var self = this;
4041 			this.x = params.x || 0;
4042 			this.y = params.y || 0;
4043 			this.elementId = params.elementId;
4044 			var orientation = params.orientation || [ 0, 0 ];
4045 			var lastTimestamp = null, lastReturnValue = null;
4046 			this.offsets = params.offsets || [ 0, 0 ];
4047 			self.timestamp = null;
4048 			this.compute = function(params) {
4049 				var xy = params.xy, wh = params.wh, element = params.element, timestamp = params.timestamp;
4050 				
4051 				if (timestamp && timestamp === self.timestamp)
4052 					return lastReturnValue;
4053 	
4054 				lastReturnValue = [ xy[0] + (self.x * wh[0]) + self.offsets[0], xy[1] + (self.y * wh[1]) + self.offsets[1] ];
4055 				
4056 				// adjust loc if there is an offsetParent
4057 				lastReturnValue = adjustForParentOffsetAndScroll(lastReturnValue, element.canvas);
4058 				
4059 				self.timestamp = timestamp;
4060 				return lastReturnValue;
4061 			};
4062 
4063 			this.getOrientation = function(_endpoint) { return orientation; };
4064 
4065 			this.equals = function(anchor) {
4066 				if (!anchor) return false;
4067 				var ao = anchor.getOrientation();
4068 				var o = this.getOrientation();
4069 				return this.x == anchor.x && this.y == anchor.y
4070 						&& this.offsets[0] == anchor.offsets[0]
4071 						&& this.offsets[1] == anchor.offsets[1]
4072 						&& o[0] == ao[0] && o[1] == ao[1];
4073 			};
4074 
4075 			this.getCurrentLocation = function() { return lastReturnValue; };
4076 		};
4077 
4078 		/**
4079 		 * An Anchor that floats. its orientation is computed dynamically from
4080 		 * its position relative to the anchor it is floating relative to.  It is used when creating 
4081 		 * a connection through drag and drop.
4082 		 * 
4083 		 * TODO FloatingAnchor could totally be refactored to extend Anchor just slightly.
4084 		 */
4085 		var FloatingAnchor = function(params) {
4086 
4087 			// this is the anchor that this floating anchor is referenced to for
4088 			// purposes of calculating the orientation.
4089 			var ref = params.reference,
4090 			// the canvas this refers to.
4091 			refCanvas = params.referenceCanvas,
4092 			size = _getSize(_getElementObject(refCanvas)),
4093 
4094 			// these are used to store the current relative position of our
4095 			// anchor wrt the reference anchor. they only indicate
4096 			// direction, so have a value of 1 or -1 (or, very rarely, 0). these
4097 			// values are written by the compute method, and read
4098 			// by the getOrientation method.
4099 			xDir = 0, yDir = 0,
4100 			// temporary member used to store an orientation when the floating
4101 			// anchor is hovering over another anchor.
4102 			orientation = null,
4103 			_lastResult = null;
4104 
4105 			// set these to 0 each; they are used by certain types of connectors in the loopback case,
4106 			// when the connector is trying to clear the element it is on. but for floating anchor it's not
4107 			// very important.
4108 			this.x = 0; this.y = 0;
4109 
4110 			this.isFloating = true;
4111 
4112 			this.compute = function(params) {
4113 				var xy = params.xy, element = params.element,
4114 				result = [ xy[0] + (size[0] / 2), xy[1] + (size[1] / 2) ]; // return origin of the element. we may wish to improve this so that any object can be the drag proxy.
4115 							
4116 				// adjust loc if there is an offsetParent
4117 				result = adjustForParentOffsetAndScroll(result, element.canvas);
4118 				
4119 				_lastResult = result;
4120 				return result;
4121 			};
4122 
4123 			this.getOrientation = function(_endpoint) {
4124 				if (orientation) return orientation;
4125 				else {
4126 					var o = ref.getOrientation(_endpoint);
4127 					// here we take into account the orientation of the other
4128 					// anchor: if it declares zero for some direction, we declare zero too. this might not be the most awesome. perhaps we can come
4129 					// up with a better way. it's just so that the line we draw looks like it makes sense. maybe this wont make sense.
4130 					return [ Math.abs(o[0]) * xDir * -1,
4131 							Math.abs(o[1]) * yDir * -1 ];
4132 				}
4133 			};
4134 
4135 			/**
4136 			 * notification the endpoint associated with this anchor is hovering
4137 			 * over another anchor; we want to assume that anchor's orientation
4138 			 * for the duration of the hover.
4139 			 */
4140 			this.over = function(anchor) { 
4141 				orientation = anchor.getOrientation(); 
4142 			};
4143 
4144 			/**
4145 			 * notification the endpoint associated with this anchor is no
4146 			 * longer hovering over another anchor; we should resume calculating
4147 			 * orientation as we normally do.
4148 			 */
4149 			this.out = function() { orientation = null; };
4150 
4151 			this.getCurrentLocation = function() { return _lastResult; };
4152 		};
4153 
4154 		/* 
4155 		 * A DynamicAnchor is an Anchor that contains a list of other Anchors, which it cycles
4156 		 * through at compute time to find the one that is located closest to
4157 		 * the center of the target element, and returns that Anchor's compute
4158 		 * method result. this causes endpoints to follow each other with
4159 		 * respect to the orientation of their target elements, which is a useful
4160 		 * feature for some applications.
4161 		 * 
4162 		 */
4163 		var DynamicAnchor = function(anchors, anchorSelector, elementId) {
4164 			this.isSelective = true;
4165 			this.isDynamic = true;			
4166 			var _anchors = [], self = this,
4167 			_convert = function(anchor) { 
4168 				return anchor.constructor == Anchor ? anchor: _currentInstance.makeAnchor(anchor, elementId, _currentInstance); 
4169 			};
4170 			for (var i = 0; i < anchors.length; i++) 
4171 				_anchors[i] = _convert(anchors[i]);			
4172 			this.addAnchor = function(anchor) { _anchors.push(_convert(anchor)); };
4173 			this.getAnchors = function() { return _anchors; };
4174 			this.locked = false;
4175 			var _curAnchor = _anchors.length > 0 ? _anchors[0] : null,
4176 				_curIndex = _anchors.length > 0 ? 0 : -1,
4177 				self = this,
4178 			
4179 				// helper method to calculate the distance between the centers of the two elements.
4180 				_distance = function(anchor, cx, cy, xy, wh) {
4181 					var ax = xy[0] + (anchor.x * wh[0]), ay = xy[1] + (anchor.y * wh[1]);
4182 					return Math.sqrt(Math.pow(cx - ax, 2) + Math.pow(cy - ay, 2));
4183 				},
4184 			
4185 			// default method uses distance between element centers.  you can provide your own method in the dynamic anchor
4186 			// constructor (and also to jsPlumb.makeDynamicAnchor). the arguments to it are four arrays: 
4187 			// xy - xy loc of the anchor's element
4188 			// wh - anchor's element's dimensions
4189 			// txy - xy loc of the element of the other anchor in the connection
4190 			// twh - dimensions of the element of the other anchor in the connection.
4191 			// anchors - the list of selectable anchors
4192 			_anchorSelector = anchorSelector || function(xy, wh, txy, twh, anchors) {
4193 				var cx = txy[0] + (twh[0] / 2), cy = txy[1] + (twh[1] / 2);
4194 				var minIdx = -1, minDist = Infinity;
4195 				for ( var i = 0; i < anchors.length; i++) {
4196 					var d = _distance(anchors[i], cx, cy, xy, wh);
4197 					if (d < minDist) {
4198 						minIdx = i + 0;
4199 						minDist = d;
4200 					}
4201 				}
4202 				return anchors[minIdx];
4203 			};
4204 			
4205 			this.compute = function(params) {				
4206 				var xy = params.xy, wh = params.wh, timestamp = params.timestamp, txy = params.txy, twh = params.twh;				
4207 				// if anchor is locked or an opposite element was not given, we
4208 				// maintain our state. anchor will be locked
4209 				// if it is the source of a drag and drop.
4210 				if (self.locked || txy == null || twh == null)
4211 					return _curAnchor.compute(params);				
4212 				else
4213 					params.timestamp = null; // otherwise clear this, i think. we want the anchor to compute.
4214 				
4215 				_curAnchor = _anchorSelector(xy, wh, txy, twh, _anchors);
4216 				self.x = _curAnchor.x;
4217 				self.y = _curAnchor.y;
4218 				
4219 				return _curAnchor.compute(params);
4220 			};
4221 
4222 			this.getCurrentLocation = function() {
4223 				return _curAnchor != null ? _curAnchor.getCurrentLocation() : null;
4224 			};
4225 
4226 			this.getOrientation = function(_endpoint) { return _curAnchor != null ? _curAnchor.getOrientation(_endpoint) : [ 0, 0 ]; };
4227 			this.over = function(anchor) { if (_curAnchor != null) _curAnchor.over(anchor); };
4228 			this.out = function() { if (_curAnchor != null) _curAnchor.out(); };
4229 		};
4230 		
4231 	/*
4232 	manages anchors for all elements.
4233 	*/
4234 	// "continuous" anchors: anchors that pick their location based on how many connections the given element has.
4235 	// this requires looking at a lot more elements than normal - anything that has had a Continuous anchor applied has
4236 	// to be recalculated.  so this manager is used as a reference point.  the first time, with a new timestamp, that
4237 	// a continuous anchor is asked to compute, it calls this guy.  or maybe, even, this guy gets called somewhere else
4238 	// and compute only ever returns pre-computed values.  either way, this is the central point, and we want it to
4239 	// be called as few times as possible.
4240 	var continuousAnchors = {},
4241         continuousAnchorLocations = {},
4242 	    continuousAnchorOrientations = {},
4243 	    Orientation = { HORIZONTAL : "horizontal", VERTICAL : "vertical", DIAGONAL : "diagonal", IDENTITY:"identity" },
4244     
4245 	// TODO this functions uses a crude method of determining orientation between two elements.
4246 	// 'diagonal' should be chosen when the angle of the line between the two centers is around
4247 	// one of 45, 135, 225 and 315 degrees. maybe +- 15 degrees.
4248 	calculateOrientation = function(sourceId, targetId, sd, td) {
4249 
4250 		if (sourceId === targetId) return {
4251 			orientation:Orientation.IDENTITY,
4252 			a:["top", "top"]
4253 		};
4254 
4255 		var theta = Math.atan2((td.centery - sd.centery) , (td.centerx - sd.centerx)),
4256 		    theta2 = Math.atan2((sd.centery - td.centery) , (sd.centerx - td.centerx)),
4257 		    h = ((sd.left <= td.left && sd.right >= td.left) || (sd.left <= td.right && sd.right >= td.right) ||
4258 			    (sd.left <= td.left && sd.right >= td.right) || (td.left <= sd.left && td.right >= sd.right)),
4259 		    v = ((sd.top <= td.top && sd.bottom >= td.top) || (sd.top <= td.bottom && sd.bottom >= td.bottom) ||
4260 			    (sd.top <= td.top && sd.bottom >= td.bottom) || (td.top <= sd.top && td.bottom >= sd.bottom));
4261 
4262 		if (! (h || v)) {
4263 			var a = null, rls = false, rrs = false, sortValue = null;
4264 			if (td.left > sd.left && td.top > sd.top)
4265 				a = ["right", "top"];
4266 			else if (td.left > sd.left && sd.top > td.top)
4267 				a = [ "top", "left"];
4268 			else if (td.left < sd.left && td.top < sd.top)
4269 				a = [ "top", "right"];
4270 			else if (td.left < sd.left && td.top > sd.top)
4271 				a = ["left", "top" ];
4272 
4273 			return { orientation:Orientation.DIAGONAL, a:a, theta:theta, theta2:theta2 };
4274 		}
4275 		else if (h) return {
4276 			orientation:Orientation.HORIZONTAL,
4277 			a:sd.top < td.top ? ["bottom", "top"] : ["top", "bottom"],
4278 			theta:theta, theta2:theta2
4279 		}
4280 		else return {
4281 			orientation:Orientation.VERTICAL,
4282 			a:sd.left < td.left ? ["right", "left"] : ["left", "right"],
4283 			theta:theta, theta2:theta2
4284 		}
4285 	},
4286 	placeAnchorsOnLine = function(desc, elementDimensions, elementPosition,
4287 					connections, horizontal, otherMultiplier, reverse) {
4288 		var a = [], step = elementDimensions[horizontal ? 0 : 1] / (connections.length + 1);
4289 
4290 		for (var i = 0; i < connections.length; i++) {
4291 			var val = (i + 1) * step, other = otherMultiplier * elementDimensions[horizontal ? 1 : 0];
4292 			if (reverse)
4293 			  val = elementDimensions[horizontal ? 0 : 1] - val;
4294 
4295 			var dx = (horizontal ? val : other), x = elementPosition[0] + dx,  xp = dx / elementDimensions[0],
4296 			 	dy = (horizontal ? other : val), y = elementPosition[1] + dy, yp = dy / elementDimensions[1];
4297 
4298 			a.push([ x, y, xp, yp, connections[i][1], connections[i][2] ]);
4299 		}
4300 
4301 		return a;
4302 	},
4303 	standardEdgeSort = function(a, b) { return a[0] > b[0] ? 1 : -1 },
4304 	currySort = function(reverseAngles) {
4305 		return function(a,b) {
4306             var r = true;
4307 			if (reverseAngles) {
4308 				if (a[0][0] < b[0][0])
4309 					r = true;
4310 				else
4311 					r = a[0][1] > b[0][1];
4312 			}
4313 			else {
4314 				if (a[0][0] > b[0][0])
4315 					r= true;
4316 				else
4317 					r =a[0][1] > b[0][1];
4318 			}
4319             return r === false ? -1 : 1;
4320 		};
4321 	},
4322 	leftSort = function(a,b) {
4323 		// first get adjusted values
4324 		var p1 = a[0][0] < 0 ? -Math.PI - a[0][0] : Math.PI - a[0][0],
4325 		p2 = b[0][0] < 0 ? -Math.PI - b[0][0] : Math.PI - b[0][0];
4326 		if (p1 > p2) return 1;
4327 		else return a[0][1] > b[0][1] ? 1 : -1;
4328 	},
4329 	edgeSortFunctions = {
4330 		"top":standardEdgeSort,
4331 		"right":currySort(true),
4332 		"bottom":currySort(true),
4333 		"left":leftSort
4334 	},
4335     _sortHelper = function(_array, _fn) {
4336       return _array.sort(_fn);
4337     },
4338 	placeAnchors = function(elementId, _anchorLists) {		
4339 		var sS = sizes[elementId], sO = offsets[elementId],
4340 		placeSomeAnchors = function(desc, elementDimensions, elementPosition, unsortedConnections, isHorizontal, otherMultiplier, orientation) {
4341             if (unsortedConnections.length > 0) {
4342 			    var sc = _sortHelper(unsortedConnections, edgeSortFunctions[desc]), // puts them in order based on the target element's pos on screen			    
4343 				    reverse = desc === "right" || desc === "top",
4344 				    anchors = placeAnchorsOnLine(desc, elementDimensions,
4345 											 elementPosition, sc,
4346 											 isHorizontal, otherMultiplier, reverse );
4347 
4348 			    // takes a computed anchor position and adjusts it for parent offset and scroll, then stores it.
4349 			    var _setAnchorLocation = function(endpoint, anchorPos) {
4350 				    var a = adjustForParentOffsetAndScroll([anchorPos[0], anchorPos[1]], endpoint.canvas);
4351 				    continuousAnchorLocations[endpoint.id] = [ a[0], a[1], anchorPos[2], anchorPos[3] ];
4352 				    continuousAnchorOrientations[endpoint.id] = orientation;
4353 			    };
4354 
4355 			    for (var i = 0; i < anchors.length; i++) {
4356 				    var c = anchors[i][4], weAreSource = c.endpoints[0].elementId === elementId, weAreTarget = c.endpoints[1].elementId === elementId;
4357 				    if (weAreSource)
4358 					    _setAnchorLocation(c.endpoints[0], anchors[i]);
4359 				    else if (weAreTarget)
4360 					    _setAnchorLocation(c.endpoints[1], anchors[i]);
4361 			    }
4362             }
4363 		};
4364 
4365 		placeSomeAnchors("bottom", sS, [sO.left,sO.top], _anchorLists.bottom, true, 1, [0,1]);
4366 		placeSomeAnchors("top", sS, [sO.left,sO.top], _anchorLists.top, true, 0, [0,-1]);
4367 		placeSomeAnchors("left", sS, [sO.left,sO.top], _anchorLists.left, false, 0, [-1,0]);
4368 		placeSomeAnchors("right", sS, [sO.left,sO.top], _anchorLists.right, false, 1, [1,0]);
4369 	},
4370     AnchorManager = function() {
4371 		var _amEndpoints = {},
4372 			connectionsByElementId = {},
4373 			self = this,
4374             anchorLists = {};
4375 
4376         this.reset = function() {
4377         	_amEndpoints = {};
4378         	connectionsByElementId = {};
4379             anchorLists = {};
4380         };			
4381  		this.newConnection = function(conn) {
4382 			var sourceId = conn.sourceId, targetId = conn.targetId,
4383 				ep = conn.endpoints,
4384                 doRegisterTarget = true,
4385 			    registerConnection = function(otherIndex, otherEndpoint, otherAnchor, elId, c) {
4386 
4387 					if ((sourceId == targetId) && otherAnchor.isContinuous){
4388                        // remove the target endpoint's canvas.  we dont need it.
4389                         jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.removeElement(ep[1].canvas);
4390                         doRegisterTarget = false;
4391                     }
4392 					_addToList(connectionsByElementId, elId, [c, otherEndpoint, otherAnchor.constructor == DynamicAnchor]);
4393 			    };
4394 
4395 			registerConnection(0, ep[0], ep[0].anchor, targetId, conn);
4396             if (doRegisterTarget)
4397             	registerConnection(1, ep[1], ep[1].anchor, sourceId, conn);
4398 		};
4399 		this.connectionDetached = function(connInfo) {
4400 			var connection = connInfo.connection || connInfo;
4401 			var sourceId = connection.sourceId,
4402                 targetId = connection.targetId,
4403 				ep = connection.endpoints,
4404 				removeConnection = function(otherIndex, otherEndpoint, otherAnchor, elId, c) {
4405 					if (otherAnchor.constructor == FloatingAnchor) {
4406 						// no-op
4407 					}
4408 					else {
4409 						_removeWithFunction(connectionsByElementId[elId], function(_c) {
4410 							return _c[0].id == c.id;
4411 						});
4412 					}
4413 				};
4414 				
4415 			removeConnection(1, ep[1], ep[1].anchor, sourceId, connection);
4416 			removeConnection(0, ep[0], ep[0].anchor, targetId, connection);
4417 
4418             // remove from anchorLists
4419             var sEl = connection.sourceId,
4420                 tEl = connection.targetId,
4421                 sE =  connection.endpoints[0].id,
4422                 tE = connection.endpoints[1].id,
4423                 _remove = function(list, eId) {
4424                     if (list) {  // transient anchors dont get entries in this list.
4425                         var f = function(e) { return e[4] == eId; };
4426                         _removeWithFunction(list["top"], f);
4427                         _removeWithFunction(list["left"], f);
4428                         _removeWithFunction(list["bottom"], f);
4429                         _removeWithFunction(list["right"], f);
4430                     }
4431                 };
4432             
4433             _remove(anchorLists[sEl], sE);
4434             _remove(anchorLists[tEl], tE);
4435             self.redraw(sEl);
4436             self.redraw(tEl);
4437 		};
4438 		this.add = function(endpoint, elementId) {
4439 			_addToList(_amEndpoints, elementId, endpoint);
4440 		};
4441 		this.changeId = function(oldId, newId) {
4442 			connectionsByElementId[newId] = connectionsByElementId[oldId];
4443 			_amEndpoints[newId] = _amEndpoints[oldId];
4444 			delete connectionsByElementId[oldId];
4445 			delete _amEndpoints[oldId];	
4446 		};
4447 		this.getConnectionsFor = function(elementId) {
4448 			return connectionsByElementId[elementId] || [];
4449 		};
4450 		this.getEndpointsFor = function(elementId) {
4451 			return _amEndpoints[elementId] || [];
4452 		};
4453 		this.deleteEndpoint = function(endpoint) {
4454 			_removeWithFunction(_amEndpoints[endpoint.elementId], function(e) {
4455 				return e.id == endpoint.id;
4456 			});
4457 		};
4458 		this.clearFor = function(elementId) {
4459 			delete _amEndpoints[elementId];
4460 			_amEndpoints[elementId] = [];
4461 		};
4462         // updates the given anchor list by either updating an existing anchor's info, or adding it. this function
4463         // also removes the anchor from its previous list, if the edge it is on has changed.
4464         // all connections found along the way (those that are connected to one of the faces this function
4465         // operates on) are added to the connsToPaint list, as are their endpoints. in this way we know to repaint
4466         // them wthout having to calculate anything else about them.
4467         var _updateAnchorList = function(lists, theta, order, conn, aBoolean, otherElId, idx, reverse, edgeId, elId, connsToPaint, endpointsToPaint) {
4468             // first try to find the exact match, but keep track of the first index of a matching element id along the way.s
4469             var exactIdx = -1,
4470                 firstMatchingElIdx = -1,
4471                 endpoint = conn.endpoints[idx],
4472                 endpointId = endpoint.id,
4473                 oIdx = [1,0][idx],
4474                 values = [ [ theta, order ], conn, aBoolean, otherElId, endpointId ],
4475                 listToAddTo = lists[edgeId],
4476                 listToRemoveFrom = endpoint._continuousAnchorEdge ? lists[endpoint._continuousAnchorEdge] : null;
4477 
4478             if (listToRemoveFrom) {
4479                 var rIdx = _findWithFunction(listToRemoveFrom, function(e) { return e[4] == endpointId });
4480                 if (rIdx != -1) {
4481                     listToRemoveFrom.splice(rIdx, 1);
4482                     // get all connections from this list
4483                     for (var i = 0; i < listToRemoveFrom.length; i++) {
4484                         _addWithFunction(connsToPaint, listToRemoveFrom[i][1], function(c) { return c.id == listToRemoveFrom[i][1].id });
4485                         _addWithFunction(endpointsToPaint, listToRemoveFrom[i][1].endpoints[idx], function(e) { return e.id == listToRemoveFrom[i][1].endpoints[idx].id });
4486                     }
4487                 }
4488             }
4489 
4490             for (var i = 0; i < listToAddTo.length; i++) {
4491                 if (idx == 1 && listToAddTo[i][3] === otherElId && firstMatchingElIdx == -1)
4492                     firstMatchingElIdx = i;
4493                 _addWithFunction(connsToPaint, listToAddTo[i][1], function(c) { return c.id == listToAddTo[i][1].id });                
4494                 _addWithFunction(endpointsToPaint, listToAddTo[i][1].endpoints[idx], function(e) { return e.id == listToAddTo[i][1].endpoints[idx].id });
4495             }
4496             if (exactIdx != -1) {
4497                 listToAddTo[exactIdx] = values;
4498             }
4499             else {
4500                 var insertIdx = reverse ? firstMatchingElIdx != -1 ? firstMatchingElIdx : 0 : listToAddTo.length; // of course we will get this from having looked through the array shortly.
4501                 listToAddTo.splice(insertIdx, 0, values);
4502             }
4503 
4504             // store this for next time.
4505             endpoint._continuousAnchorEdge = edgeId;
4506         };
4507 		this.redraw = function(elementId, ui, timestamp, offsetToUI) {
4508 		
4509 			if (!_suspendDrawing) {
4510 				// get all the endpoints for this element
4511 				var ep = _amEndpoints[elementId] || [],
4512 					endpointConnections = connectionsByElementId[elementId] || [],
4513 					connectionsToPaint = [],
4514 					endpointsToPaint = [],
4515 	                anchorsToUpdate = [];
4516 	            
4517 				timestamp = timestamp || _timestamp();
4518 				// offsetToUI are values that would have been calculated in the dragManager when registering
4519 				// an endpoint for an element that had a parent (somewhere in the hierarchy) that had been
4520 				// registered as draggable.
4521 				offsetToUI = offsetToUI || {left:0, top:0};
4522 				if (ui) {
4523 					ui = {
4524 						left:ui.left + offsetToUI.left,
4525 						top:ui.top + offsetToUI.top
4526 					}
4527 				}
4528 					
4529 				_updateOffset( { elId : elementId, offset : ui, recalc : false, timestamp : timestamp }); 
4530 				// valid for one paint cycle.
4531 				var myOffset = offsets[elementId],
4532 	                myWH = sizes[elementId],
4533 	                orientationCache = {};
4534 				
4535 				// actually, first we should compute the orientation of this element to all other elements to which
4536 				// this element is connected with a continuous anchor (whether both ends of the connection have
4537 				// a continuous anchor or just one)
4538 	            //for (var i = 0; i < continuousAnchorConnections.length; i++) {
4539 	            for (var i = 0; i < endpointConnections.length; i++) {
4540 	                var conn = endpointConnections[i][0],
4541 						sourceId = conn.sourceId,
4542 	                    targetId = conn.targetId,
4543 	                    sourceContinuous = conn.endpoints[0].anchor.isContinuous,
4544 	                    targetContinuous = conn.endpoints[1].anchor.isContinuous;
4545 	
4546 	                if (sourceContinuous || targetContinuous) {
4547 		                var oKey = sourceId + "_" + targetId,
4548 		                    oKey2 = targetId + "_" + sourceId,
4549 		                    o = orientationCache[oKey],
4550 		                    oIdx = conn.sourceId == elementId ? 1 : 0;
4551 	
4552 		                if (sourceContinuous && !anchorLists[sourceId]) anchorLists[sourceId] = { top:[], right:[], bottom:[], left:[] };
4553 		                if (targetContinuous && !anchorLists[targetId]) anchorLists[targetId] = { top:[], right:[], bottom:[], left:[] };
4554 	
4555 		                if (elementId != targetId) _updateOffset( { elId : targetId, timestamp : timestamp }); 
4556 		                if (elementId != sourceId) _updateOffset( { elId : sourceId, timestamp : timestamp }); 
4557 	
4558 		                var td = _getCachedData(targetId),
4559 							sd = _getCachedData(sourceId);
4560 	
4561 		                if (targetId == sourceId && (sourceContinuous || targetContinuous)) {
4562 		                    // here we may want to improve this by somehow determining the face we'd like
4563 						    // to put the connector on.  ideally, when drawing, the face should be calculated
4564 						    // by determining which face is closest to the point at which the mouse button
4565 							// was released.  for now, we're putting it on the top face.
4566 		                    _updateAnchorList(anchorLists[sourceId], -Math.PI / 2, 0, conn, false, targetId, 0, false, "top", sourceId, connectionsToPaint, endpointsToPaint)
4567 						}
4568 		                else {
4569 		                    if (!o) {
4570 		                        o = calculateOrientation(sourceId, targetId, sd.o, td.o);
4571 		                        orientationCache[oKey] = o;
4572 		                        // this would be a performance enhancement, but the computed angles need to be clamped to
4573 		                        //the (-PI/2 -> PI/2) range in order for the sorting to work properly.
4574 		                    /*  orientationCache[oKey2] = {
4575 		                            orientation:o.orientation,
4576 		                            a:[o.a[1], o.a[0]],
4577 		                            theta:o.theta + Math.PI,
4578 		                            theta2:o.theta2 + Math.PI
4579 		                        };*/
4580 		                    }
4581 		                    if (sourceContinuous) _updateAnchorList(anchorLists[sourceId], o.theta, 0, conn, false, targetId, 0, false, o.a[0], sourceId, connectionsToPaint, endpointsToPaint);
4582 		                    if (targetContinuous) _updateAnchorList(anchorLists[targetId], o.theta2, -1, conn, true, sourceId, 1, true, o.a[1], targetId, connectionsToPaint, endpointsToPaint);
4583 		                }
4584 	
4585 		                if (sourceContinuous) _addWithFunction(anchorsToUpdate, sourceId, function(a) { return a === sourceId; });
4586 		                if (targetContinuous) _addWithFunction(anchorsToUpdate, targetId, function(a) { return a === targetId; });
4587 		                _addWithFunction(connectionsToPaint, conn, function(c) { return c.id == conn.id; });
4588 		                if ((sourceContinuous && oIdx == 0) || (targetContinuous && oIdx == 1))
4589 		                	_addWithFunction(endpointsToPaint, conn.endpoints[oIdx], function(e) { return e.id == conn.endpoints[oIdx].id; });
4590 		            }
4591 	            }
4592 				
4593 				// place Endpoints whose anchors are continuous but have no Connections
4594 				for (var i = 0; i < ep.length; i++) {
4595 					if (ep[i].connections.length == 0 && ep[i].anchor.isContinuous) {
4596 						if (!anchorLists[elementId]) anchorLists[elementId] = { top:[], right:[], bottom:[], left:[] };
4597 						_updateAnchorList(anchorLists[elementId], -Math.PI / 2, 0, {endpoints:[ep[i], ep[i]], paint:function(){}}, false, elementId, 0, false, "top", elementId, connectionsToPaint, endpointsToPaint)
4598 						_addWithFunction(anchorsToUpdate, elementId, function(a) { return a === elementId; })
4599 					}
4600 				}
4601 	
4602 	            // now place all the continuous anchors we need to;
4603 	            for (var i = 0; i < anchorsToUpdate.length; i++) {
4604 					placeAnchors(anchorsToUpdate[i], anchorLists[anchorsToUpdate[i]]);
4605 				}
4606 				
4607 				// now that continuous anchors have been placed, paint all the endpoints for this element
4608 	            // TODO performance: add the endpoint ids to a temp array, and then when iterating in the next
4609 	            // loop, check that we didn't just paint that endpoint. we can probably shave off a few more milliseconds this way.
4610 				for (var i = 0; i < ep.length; i++) {				
4611 					ep[i].paint( { timestamp : timestamp, offset : myOffset, dimensions : myWH });
4612 				}
4613 	            // ... and any other endpoints we came across as a result of the continuous anchors.
4614 	            for (var i = 0; i < endpointsToPaint.length; i++) {
4615 					endpointsToPaint[i].paint( { timestamp : timestamp, offset : myOffset, dimensions : myWH });
4616 				}
4617 	
4618 				// paint all the standard and "dynamic connections", which are connections whose other anchor is
4619 				// static and therefore does need to be recomputed; we make sure that happens only one time.
4620 	
4621 				// TODO we could have compiled a list of these in the first pass through connections; might save some time.
4622 				for (var i = 0; i < endpointConnections.length; i++) {
4623 					var otherEndpoint = endpointConnections[i][1];
4624 					if (otherEndpoint.anchor.constructor == DynamicAnchor) {			 							
4625 						otherEndpoint.paint({ elementWithPrecedence:elementId });								
4626 	                    _addWithFunction(connectionsToPaint, endpointConnections[i][0], function(c) { return c.id == endpointConnections[i][0].id; });
4627 						// all the connections for the other endpoint now need to be repainted
4628 						for (var k = 0; k < otherEndpoint.connections.length; k++) {
4629 							if (otherEndpoint.connections[k] !== endpointConnections[i][0])							
4630 	                            _addWithFunction(connectionsToPaint, otherEndpoint.connections[k], function(c) { return c.id == otherEndpoint.connections[k].id; });
4631 						}
4632 					} else if (otherEndpoint.anchor.constructor == Anchor) {					
4633 	                    _addWithFunction(connectionsToPaint, endpointConnections[i][0], function(c) { return c.id == endpointConnections[i][0].id; });
4634 					}
4635 				}
4636 				// paint current floating connection for this element, if there is one.
4637 				var fc = floatingConnections[elementId];
4638 				if (fc) 
4639 					fc.paint({timestamp:timestamp, recalc:false, elId:elementId});
4640 					
4641 				// paint all the connections
4642 				for (var i = 0; i < connectionsToPaint.length; i++) {
4643 					connectionsToPaint[i].paint({elId:elementId, timestamp:timestamp, recalc:false});
4644 				}
4645 			}
4646 		};
4647 		this.rehomeEndpoint = function(currentId, element) {
4648 			var eps = _amEndpoints[currentId] || [], //, 
4649 				elementId = _currentInstance.getId(element);
4650 			if (elementId !== currentId) {
4651 				for (var i = 0; i < eps.length; i++) {
4652 					self.add(eps[i], elementId);
4653 				}
4654 				eps.splice(0, eps.length);
4655 			}
4656 		};
4657 	};
4658 	_currentInstance.anchorManager = new AnchorManager();				
4659 	_currentInstance.continuousAnchorFactory = {
4660 		get:function(params) {
4661 			var existing = continuousAnchors[params.elementId];
4662 			if (!existing) {
4663 				existing = {
4664 					type:"Continuous",
4665 					compute : function(params) {
4666 						return continuousAnchorLocations[params.element.id] || [0,0];
4667 					},
4668 					getCurrentLocation : function(endpoint) {
4669 						return continuousAnchorLocations[endpoint.id] || [0,0];
4670 					},
4671 					getOrientation : function(endpoint) {
4672 						return continuousAnchorOrientations[endpoint.id] || [0,0];
4673 					},
4674 					isDynamic : true,
4675 					isContinuous : true
4676 				};
4677 				continuousAnchors[params.elementId] = existing;
4678 			}
4679 			return existing;
4680 		}
4681 	};
4682 
4683 	if (!jsPlumbAdapter.headless)
4684 		_currentInstance.dragManager = jsPlumbAdapter.getDragManager(_currentInstance);
4685 
4686 		/*
4687 		 * Class: Connection
4688 		 * The connecting line between two Endpoints.
4689 		 */
4690 		/*
4691 		 * Function: Connection
4692 		 * Connection constructor. You should not ever create one of these directly. If you make a call to jsPlumb.connect, all of
4693 		 * the parameters that you pass in to that function will be passed to the Connection constructor; if your UI
4694 		 * uses the various Endpoint-centric methods like addEndpoint/makeSource/makeTarget, along with drag and drop,
4695 		 * then the parameters you set on those functions are translated and passed in to the Connection constructor. So
4696 		 * you should check the documentation for each of those methods.
4697 		 * 
4698 		 * Parameters:
4699 		 * 	source 	- either an element id, a selector for an element, or an Endpoint.
4700 		 * 	target	- either an element id, a selector for an element, or an Endpoint
4701 		 * 	scope	- scope descriptor for this connection. optional.
4702 		 *  container - optional id or selector instructing jsPlumb where to attach all the elements it creates for this connection.  you should read the documentation for a full discussion of this.
4703 		 *  detachable - optional, defaults to true. Defines whether or not the connection may be detached using the mouse.
4704 		 *  reattach	- optional, defaults to false. Defines whether not the connection should be retached if it was dragged off an Endpoint and then dropped in whitespace.
4705 		 *  endpoint - Optional. Endpoint definition to use for both ends of the connection.
4706 		 *  endpoints - Optional. Array of two Endpoint definitions, one for each end of the Connection. This and 'endpoint' are mutually exclusive parameters.
4707 		 *  endpointStyle - Optional. Endpoint style definition to use for both ends of the Connection.
4708 		 *  endpointStyles - Optional. Array of two Endpoint style definitions, one for each end of the Connection. This and 'endpoint' are mutually exclusive parameters.
4709 		 *  paintStyle - Parameters defining the appearance of the Connection. Optional; jsPlumb will use the defaults if you supply nothing here.
4710 		 *  hoverPaintStyle - Parameters defining the appearance of the Connection when the mouse is hovering over it. Optional; jsPlumb will use the defaults if you supply nothing here (note that the default hoverPaintStyle is null).
4711 		 *  cssClass - optional CSS class to set on the display element associated with this Connection.
4712 		 *  hoverClass - optional CSS class to set on the display element associated with this Connection when it is in hover state.
4713 		 *  overlays - Optional array of Overlay definitions to appear on this Connection.
4714 		 *  drawEndpoints - if false, instructs jsPlumb to not draw the endpoints for this Connection.  Be careful with this: it only really works when you tell jsPlumb to attach elements to the document body. Read the documentation for a full discussion of this. 
4715 		 *  parameters - Optional JS object containing parameters to set on the Connection. These parameters are then available via the getParameter method.
4716 		 */
4717 		var Connection = function(params) {
4718 			var self = this, visible = true, _internalHover, _superClassHover;
4719 			self.idPrefix = "_jsplumb_c_";
4720 			self.defaultLabelLocation = 0.5;
4721 			self.defaultOverlayKeys = ["Overlays", "ConnectionOverlays"];
4722 			this.parent = params.parent;
4723 			overlayCapableJsPlumbUIComponent.apply(this, arguments);
4724 			// ************** get the source and target and register the connection. *******************
4725 			
4726 // VISIBILITY						
4727 			/*
4728 			* Function: isVisible
4729 			* Returns whether or not the Connection is currently visible.
4730 			*/
4731 			this.isVisible = function() { return visible; };
4732 			/*
4733 			* Function: setVisible
4734 			* Sets whether or not the Connection should be visible.
4735 			*
4736 			* Parameters:
4737 			*	visible - boolean indicating desired visible state.
4738 			*/
4739 			this.setVisible = function(v) {
4740 				visible = v;
4741 				self[v ? "showOverlays" : "hideOverlays"]();
4742 				if (self.connector && self.connector.canvas) self.connector.canvas.style.display = v ? "block" : "none";
4743 				self.repaint();
4744 			};
4745 // END VISIBILITY						
4746 		
4747 // TYPE		
4748 			
4749 			this.getTypeDescriptor = function() { return "connection"; };
4750 			this.getDefaultType = function() {
4751 				return {
4752 					parameters:{},
4753 					scope:null,
4754 					detachable:self._jsPlumb.Defaults.ConnectionsDetachable,
4755 					rettach:self._jsPlumb.Defaults.ReattachConnections,
4756 					paintStyle:self._jsPlumb.Defaults.PaintStyle || jsPlumb.Defaults.PaintStyle,
4757 					connector:self._jsPlumb.Defaults.Connector || jsPlumb.Defaults.Connector,
4758 					hoverPaintStyle:self._jsPlumb.Defaults.HoverPaintStyle || jsPlumb.Defaults.HoverPaintStyle,				
4759 					overlays:self._jsPlumb.Defaults.ConnectorOverlays || jsPlumb.Defaults.ConnectorOverlays
4760 				};
4761 			};
4762 			var superAt = this.applyType;
4763 			this.applyType = function(t) {
4764 				superAt(t);
4765 				if (t.detachable != null) self.setDetachable(t.detachable);
4766 				if (t.reattach != null) self.setReattach(t.reattach);
4767 				if (t.scope) self.scope = t.scope;
4768 				self.setConnector(t.connector);
4769 			};			
4770 // END TYPE
4771 
4772 // HOVER			
4773 			// override setHover to pass it down to the underlying connector
4774 			_superClassHover = self.setHover;
4775 			self.setHover = function(state) {
4776 				var zi = _currentInstance.ConnectorZIndex || jsPlumb.Defaults.ConnectorZIndex;
4777 				if (zi)
4778 					self.connector.setZIndex(zi + (state ? 1 : 0));
4779 				self.connector.setHover.apply(self.connector, arguments);				
4780 				_superClassHover.apply(self, arguments);
4781 			};
4782 			
4783 			_internalHover = function(state) {
4784 				if (_connectionBeingDragged == null) {
4785 					self.setHover(state, false);
4786 				}
4787 			};
4788 // END HOVER
4789 
4790 			/*
4791 			 * Function: setConnector
4792 			 * Sets the Connection's connector (eg "Bezier", "Flowchart", etc).  You pass a Connector definition into this method, the same
4793 			 * thing that you would set as the 'connector' property on a jsPlumb.connect call.
4794 			 * 
4795 			 * Parameters:
4796 			 * 	connector		-	Connector definition
4797 			 */
4798 			this.setConnector = function(connector, doNotRepaint) {
4799 				if (self.connector != null) _removeElements(self.connector.getDisplayElements(), self.parent);
4800 				var connectorArgs = { _jsPlumb:self._jsPlumb, parent:params.parent, 
4801 					cssClass:params.cssClass, container:params.container, tooltip:self.tooltip
4802 				};
4803 				if (_isString(connector)) 
4804 					this.connector = new jsPlumb.Connectors[renderMode][connector](connectorArgs); // lets you use a string as shorthand.
4805 				else if (_isArray(connector)) {
4806 					if (connector.length == 1)
4807 						this.connector = new jsPlumb.Connectors[renderMode][connector[0]](connectorArgs);
4808 					else
4809 						this.connector = new jsPlumb.Connectors[renderMode][connector[0]](jsPlumb.extend(connector[1], connectorArgs));
4810 				}
4811 				self.canvas = self.connector.canvas;
4812 				// binds mouse listeners to the current connector.
4813 				_bindListeners(self.connector, self, _internalHover);
4814 				
4815 				// set z-index if it was set on Defaults.
4816 				var zi = _currentInstance.ConnectorZIndex || jsPlumb.Defaults.ConnectorZIndex;
4817 				if (zi)
4818 					self.connector.setZIndex(zi);
4819 					
4820 				if (!doNotRepaint) self.repaint();
4821 			};
4822 			
4823 // INITIALISATION CODE			
4824 						
4825 			this.source = _getElementObject(params.source);
4826 			this.target = _getElementObject(params.target);
4827 			// sourceEndpoint and targetEndpoint override source/target, if they are present. but 
4828 			// source is not overridden if the Endpoint has declared it is not the final target of a connection;
4829 			// instead we use the source that the Endpoint declares will be the final source element.
4830 			if (params.sourceEndpoint) this.source = params.sourceEndpoint.endpointWillMoveTo || params.sourceEndpoint.getElement();			
4831 			if (params.targetEndpoint) this.target = params.targetEndpoint.getElement();
4832 			
4833 			// if a new connection is the result of moving some existing connection, params.previousConnection
4834 			// will have that Connection in it. listeners for the jsPlumbConnection event can look for that
4835 			// member and take action if they need to.
4836 			self.previousConnection = params.previousConnection;
4837 						
4838 			this.sourceId = _getAttribute(this.source, "id");
4839 			this.targetId = _getAttribute(this.target, "id");
4840 			this.scope = params.scope; // scope may have been passed in to the connect call. if it wasn't, we will pull it from the source endpoint, after having initialised the endpoints.			
4841 			this.endpoints = [];
4842 			this.endpointStyles = [];
4843 			// wrapped the main function to return null if no input given. this lets us cascade defaults properly.
4844 			var _makeAnchor = function(anchorParams, elementId) {
4845 				return (anchorParams) ? _currentInstance.makeAnchor(anchorParams, elementId, _currentInstance) : null;
4846 			},
4847 			prepareEndpoint = function(existing, index, params, element, elementId, connectorPaintStyle, connectorHoverPaintStyle) {
4848 				var e;
4849 				if (existing) {
4850 					self.endpoints[index] = existing;
4851 					existing.addConnection(self);					
4852 				} else {
4853 					if (!params.endpoints) params.endpoints = [ null, null ];
4854 					var ep = params.endpoints[index] 
4855 					        || params.endpoint
4856 							|| _currentInstance.Defaults.Endpoints[index]
4857 							|| jsPlumb.Defaults.Endpoints[index]
4858 							|| _currentInstance.Defaults.Endpoint
4859 							|| jsPlumb.Defaults.Endpoint;
4860 
4861 					if (!params.endpointStyles) params.endpointStyles = [ null, null ];
4862 					if (!params.endpointHoverStyles) params.endpointHoverStyles = [ null, null ];
4863 					var es = params.endpointStyles[index] || params.endpointStyle || _currentInstance.Defaults.EndpointStyles[index] || jsPlumb.Defaults.EndpointStyles[index] || _currentInstance.Defaults.EndpointStyle || jsPlumb.Defaults.EndpointStyle;
4864 					// Endpoints derive their fillStyle from the connector's strokeStyle, if no fillStyle was specified.
4865 					if (es.fillStyle == null && connectorPaintStyle != null)
4866 						es.fillStyle = connectorPaintStyle.strokeStyle;
4867 					
4868 					// TODO: decide if the endpoint should derive the connection's outline width and color.  currently it does:
4869 					//*
4870 					if (es.outlineColor == null && connectorPaintStyle != null) 
4871 						es.outlineColor = connectorPaintStyle.outlineColor;
4872 					if (es.outlineWidth == null && connectorPaintStyle != null) 
4873 						es.outlineWidth = connectorPaintStyle.outlineWidth;
4874 					//*/
4875 					
4876 					var ehs = params.endpointHoverStyles[index] || params.endpointHoverStyle || _currentInstance.Defaults.EndpointHoverStyles[index] || jsPlumb.Defaults.EndpointHoverStyles[index] || _currentInstance.Defaults.EndpointHoverStyle || jsPlumb.Defaults.EndpointHoverStyle;
4877 					// endpoint hover fill style is derived from connector's hover stroke style.  TODO: do we want to do this by default? for sure?
4878 					if (connectorHoverPaintStyle != null) {
4879 						if (ehs == null) ehs = {};
4880 						if (ehs.fillStyle == null) {
4881 							ehs.fillStyle = connectorHoverPaintStyle.strokeStyle;
4882 						}
4883 					}
4884 					var a = params.anchors ? params.anchors[index] : 
4885 						params.anchor ? params.anchor :
4886 						_makeAnchor(_currentInstance.Defaults.Anchors[index], elementId) || 
4887 						_makeAnchor(jsPlumb.Defaults.Anchors[index], elementId) || 
4888 						_makeAnchor(_currentInstance.Defaults.Anchor, elementId) || 
4889 						_makeAnchor(jsPlumb.Defaults.Anchor, elementId),					
4890 					u = params.uuids ? params.uuids[index] : null;
4891 					e = _newEndpoint({ 
4892 						paintStyle : es,  hoverPaintStyle:ehs,  endpoint : ep,  connections : [ self ], 
4893 						uuid : u,  anchor : a,  source : element, scope  : params.scope, container:params.container,
4894 						reattach:params.reattach || _currentInstance.Defaults.ReattachConnections,
4895 						detachable:params.detachable || _currentInstance.Defaults.ConnectionsDetachable
4896 					});
4897 					self.endpoints[index] = e;
4898 					
4899 					if (params.drawEndpoints === false) e.setVisible(false, true, true);
4900 										
4901 				}
4902 				return e;
4903 			};					
4904 
4905 			var eS = prepareEndpoint(params.sourceEndpoint, 0, params, self.source,
4906 									 self.sourceId, params.paintStyle, params.hoverPaintStyle);			
4907 			if (eS) _addToList(endpointsByElement, this.sourceId, eS);						
4908 			var eT = prepareEndpoint(params.targetEndpoint, 1, params, self.target, 
4909 									 self.targetId, params.paintStyle, params.hoverPaintStyle);
4910 			if (eT) _addToList(endpointsByElement, this.targetId, eT);
4911 			// if scope not set, set it to be the scope for the source endpoint.
4912 			if (!this.scope) this.scope = this.endpoints[0].scope;		
4913 			
4914 			// if delete endpoints on detach, keep a record of just exactly which endpoints they are.
4915 			self.endpointsToDeleteOnDetach = [null, null];
4916 			if (params.deleteEndpointsOnDetach) {
4917 				if (params.sourceIsNew) self.endpointsToDeleteOnDetach[0] = self.endpoints[0];
4918 				if (params.targetIsNew) self.endpointsToDeleteOnDetach[1] = self.endpoints[1];
4919 			}
4920 						
4921 			self.setConnector(this.endpoints[0].connector || 
4922 							  this.endpoints[1].connector || 
4923 							  params.connector || 
4924 							  _currentInstance.Defaults.Connector || 
4925 							  jsPlumb.Defaults.Connector, true);							  							  		
4926 			
4927 			this.setPaintStyle(this.endpoints[0].connectorStyle || 
4928 							   this.endpoints[1].connectorStyle || 
4929 							   params.paintStyle || 
4930 							   _currentInstance.Defaults.PaintStyle || 
4931 							   jsPlumb.Defaults.PaintStyle, true);
4932 						
4933 			this.setHoverPaintStyle(this.endpoints[0].connectorHoverStyle || 
4934 									this.endpoints[1].connectorHoverStyle || 
4935 									params.hoverPaintStyle || 
4936 									_currentInstance.Defaults.HoverPaintStyle || 
4937 									jsPlumb.Defaults.HoverPaintStyle, true);
4938 			
4939 			this.paintStyleInUse = this.getPaintStyle();
4940 			
4941 			_updateOffset( { elId : this.sourceId, timestamp:_suspendedAt });
4942 			_updateOffset( { elId : this.targetId, timestamp:_suspendedAt });
4943 			
4944 			// paint the endpoints
4945 			var myOffset = offsets[this.sourceId], myWH = sizes[this.sourceId],
4946 				otherOffset = offsets[this.targetId],
4947 				otherWH = sizes[this.targetId],
4948 				initialTimestamp = _suspendedAt || _timestamp(),
4949 				anchorLoc = this.endpoints[0].anchor.compute( {
4950 					xy : [ myOffset.left, myOffset.top ], wh : myWH, element : this.endpoints[0],
4951 					elementId:this.endpoints[0].elementId,
4952 					txy : [ otherOffset.left, otherOffset.top ], twh : otherWH, tElement : this.endpoints[1],
4953 					timestamp:initialTimestamp
4954 				});
4955 
4956 			this.endpoints[0].paint( { anchorLoc : anchorLoc, timestamp:initialTimestamp });
4957 
4958 			anchorLoc = this.endpoints[1].anchor.compute( {
4959 				xy : [ otherOffset.left, otherOffset.top ], wh : otherWH, element : this.endpoints[1],
4960 				elementId:this.endpoints[1].elementId,				
4961 				txy : [ myOffset.left, myOffset.top ], twh : myWH, tElement : this.endpoints[0],
4962 				timestamp:initialTimestamp				
4963 			});
4964 			this.endpoints[1].paint({ anchorLoc : anchorLoc, timestamp:initialTimestamp });
4965 									
4966 // END INITIALISATION CODE			
4967 			
4968 // DETACHABLE 				
4969             var _detachable = _currentInstance.Defaults.ConnectionsDetachable;
4970             if (params.detachable === false) _detachable = false;
4971             if(self.endpoints[0].connectionsDetachable === false) _detachable = false;
4972             if(self.endpoints[1].connectionsDetachable === false) _detachable = false;
4973 			/*
4974             * Function: isDetachable
4975             * Returns whether or not this connection can be detached from its target/source endpoint.  by default this
4976             * is false; use it in conjunction with the 'reattach' parameter.
4977             */
4978             this.isDetachable = function() {
4979                 return _detachable === true;
4980             };
4981             /*
4982             * Function: setDetachable
4983             * Sets whether or not this connection is detachable.
4984             *
4985             * Parameters:
4986             * 	detachable - whether or not to set the Connection to be detachable.
4987             */
4988             this.setDetachable = function(detachable) {
4989               _detachable = detachable === true;
4990             };
4991 // END DETACHABLE
4992 
4993 // REATTACH
4994 			var _reattach = params.reattach ||
4995 				self.endpoints[0].reattachConnections ||
4996 				self.endpoints[1].reattachConnections ||
4997 				_currentInstance.Defaults.ReattachConnections;
4998             /*
4999             * Function: isReattach
5000             * Returns whether or not this connection will be reattached after having been detached via the mouse and dropped.  by default this
5001             * is false; use it in conjunction with the 'detachable' parameter.
5002             */
5003             this.isReattach = function() {
5004                 return _reattach === true;
5005             };
5006             /*
5007             * Function: setReattach
5008             * Sets whether or not this connection will reattach after having been detached via the mouse and dropped.
5009             *
5010             * Parameters:
5011             * 	reattach	-	whether or not to set the Connection to reattach after drop in whitespace.
5012             */
5013             this.setReattach = function(reattach) {
5014               _reattach = reattach === true;
5015             };
5016 
5017 // END REATTACH
5018 			
5019 // COST + DIRECTIONALITY
5020 			// if cost not supplied, try to inherit from source endpoint
5021 			var _cost = params.cost || self.endpoints[0].getConnectionCost();			
5022 			self.getCost = function() { return _cost; };
5023 			self.setCost = function(c) { _cost = c; };			
5024 			var _bidirectional = !(params.bidirectional === false);
5025 			// inherit bidirectional flag if set no source endpoint
5026             if (params.bidirectional == null) _bidirectional = self.endpoints[0].areConnectionsBidirectional();
5027 			self.isBidirectional = function() { return _bidirectional; };
5028 // END COST + DIRECTIONALITY
5029                         
5030 // PARAMETERS						
5031 			// merge all the parameters objects into the connection.  parameters set
5032 			// on the connection take precedence; then target endpoint params, then
5033 			// finally source endpoint params.
5034 			// TODO jsPlumb.extend could be made to take more than two args, and it would
5035 			// apply the second through nth args in order.
5036 			var _p = jsPlumb.extend({}, this.endpoints[0].getParameters());
5037 			jsPlumb.extend(_p, this.endpoints[1].getParameters());
5038 			jsPlumb.extend(_p, self.getParameters());
5039 			self.setParameters(_p);
5040 // END PARAMETERS
5041 						
5042 // MISCELLANEOUS			
5043 			/**
5044 			 * implementation of abstract method in jsPlumbUtil.EventGenerator
5045 			 * @return list of attached elements. in our case, a list of Endpoints.
5046 			 */
5047 			this.getAttachedElements = function() {
5048 				return self.endpoints;
5049 			};
5050 			
5051 			/**
5052 			 * changes the parent element of this connection to newParent.  not exposed for the public API.
5053 			 */
5054 			this.moveParent = function(newParent) {
5055 				var jpcl = jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary, curParent = jpcl.getParent(self.connector.canvas);				
5056 				if (self.connector.bgCanvas) {
5057 				    jpcl.removeElement(self.connector.bgCanvas, curParent);
5058 				    jpcl.appendElement(self.connector.bgCanvas, newParent);
5059                 }
5060 				jpcl.removeElement(self.connector.canvas, curParent);
5061 				jpcl.appendElement(self.connector.canvas, newParent);                
5062                 // this only applies for DOMOverlays
5063 				for (var i = 0; i < self.overlays.length; i++) {
5064                     if (self.overlays[i].isAppendedAtTopLevel) {
5065 					    jpcl.removeElement(self.overlays[i].canvas, curParent);
5066 					    jpcl.appendElement(self.overlays[i].canvas, newParent);
5067 					    if (self.overlays[i].reattachListeners) 
5068 					    	self.overlays[i].reattachListeners(self.connector);
5069                     }
5070 				}
5071 				if (self.connector.reattachListeners)		// this is for SVG/VML; change an element's parent and you have to reinit its listeners.
5072 					self.connector.reattachListeners();     // the Canvas implementation doesn't have to care about this
5073 			};
5074 		    
5075 // END MISCELLANEOUS
5076 
5077 // PAINTING
5078 
5079 			/*
5080 			 * Paints the Connection.  Not exposed for public usage. 
5081 			 * 
5082 			 * Parameters:
5083 			 * 	elId - Id of the element that is in motion.
5084 			 * 	ui - current library's event system ui object (present if we came from a drag to get here).
5085 			 *  recalc - whether or not to recalculate all anchors etc before painting. 
5086 			 *  timestamp - timestamp of this paint.  If the Connection was last painted with the same timestamp, it does not paint again.
5087 			 */
5088 			var lastPaintedAt = null;			
5089 			this.paint = function(params) {
5090 				
5091 				if (visible) {
5092 						
5093 					params = params || {};
5094 					var elId = params.elId, ui = params.ui, recalc = params.recalc, timestamp = params.timestamp,
5095 						// if the moving object is not the source we must transpose the two references.
5096 						swap = false,
5097 						tId = swap ? this.sourceId : this.targetId, sId = swap ? this.targetId : this.sourceId,
5098 						tIdx = swap ? 0 : 1, sIdx = swap ? 1 : 0;
5099 
5100 					if (timestamp == null || timestamp != lastPaintedAt) {
5101 						var sourceInfo = _updateOffset( { elId : elId, offset : ui, recalc : recalc, timestamp : timestamp }),
5102 							targetInfo = _updateOffset( { elId : tId, timestamp : timestamp }); // update the target if this is a forced repaint. otherwise, only the source has been moved.
5103 						
5104 						var sE = this.endpoints[sIdx], tE = this.endpoints[tIdx],
5105 							sAnchorP = sE.anchor.getCurrentLocation(sE),				
5106 							tAnchorP = tE.anchor.getCurrentLocation(tE);
5107 									
5108 						/* paint overlays*/
5109 						var maxSize = 0;
5110 						for ( var i = 0; i < self.overlays.length; i++) {
5111 							var o = self.overlays[i];
5112 							if (o.isVisible()) maxSize = Math.max(maxSize, o.computeMaxSize());
5113 						}
5114 		
5115 						var dim = this.connector.compute(
5116 							sAnchorP,
5117 							tAnchorP, 
5118 							this.endpoints[sIdx],
5119 							this.endpoints[tIdx],
5120 							this.endpoints[sIdx].anchor,
5121 							this.endpoints[tIdx].anchor, 
5122 							self.paintStyleInUse.lineWidth,
5123 							maxSize,
5124 							sourceInfo,
5125 							targetInfo );
5126 												
5127 						self.connector.paint(dim, self.paintStyleInUse);
5128 						
5129 						/* paint overlays*/
5130 						for ( var i = 0; i < self.overlays.length; i++) {
5131 							var o = self.overlays[i];
5132 							if (o.isVisible) self.overlayPlacements[i] = o.draw(self.connector, self.paintStyleInUse, dim, timestamp);
5133 						}
5134 					}
5135 					lastPaintedAt = timestamp;						
5136 				}		
5137 			};			
5138 
5139 			/*
5140 			 * Function: repaint
5141 			 * Repaints the Connection. No parameters exposed to public API.
5142 			 */
5143 			this.repaint = function(params) {
5144 				params = params || {};
5145                 var recalc = !(params.recalc === false);
5146 				this.paint({ elId : this.sourceId, recalc : recalc, timestamp:params.timestamp });
5147 			};
5148 			
5149 			// the very last thing we do is check to see if a 'type' was supplied in the params
5150 			var _type = params.type || self.endpoints[0].connectionType || self.endpoints[1].connectionType;
5151 			if (_type)
5152 				self.addType(_type);
5153 			
5154 // END PAINTING
5155 
5156 // ***************************** PLACEHOLDERS FOR NATURAL DOCS *************************************************
5157 			/*
5158 			 * Function: bind
5159 			 * Bind to an event on the Connection.  
5160 			 * 
5161 			 * Parameters:
5162 			 * 	event - the event to bind.  Available events on a Connection are:
5163 			 *         - *click*						:	notification that a Connection was clicked.  
5164 			 *         - *dblclick*						:	notification that a Connection was double clicked.
5165 			 *         - *mouseenter*					:	notification that the mouse is over a Connection. 
5166 			 *         - *mouseexit*					:	notification that the mouse exited a Connection.
5167 			 * 		   - *contextmenu*                  :   notification that the user right-clicked on the Connection.
5168 			 *         
5169 			 *  callback - function to callback. This function will be passed the Connection that caused the event, and also the original event.    
5170 			 */
5171 			
5172 			/*
5173 		     * Function: setPaintStyle
5174 		     * Sets the Connection's paint style and then repaints the Connection.
5175 		     * 
5176 		     * Parameters:
5177 		     * 	style - Style to use.
5178 		     */
5179 
5180 		     /*
5181 		     * Function: getPaintStyle
5182 		     * Gets the Connection's paint style. This is not necessarily the paint style in use at the time;
5183 		     * this is the paint style for the connection when the mouse it not hovering over it.
5184 		     */
5185 			
5186 			/*
5187 		     * Function: setHoverPaintStyle
5188 		     * Sets the paint style to use when the mouse is hovering over the Connection. This is null by default.
5189 		     * The hover paint style is applied as extensions to the paintStyle; it does not entirely replace
5190 		     * it.  This is because people will most likely want to change just one thing when hovering, say the
5191 		     * color for example, but leave the rest of the appearance the same.
5192 		     * 
5193 		     * Parameters:
5194 		     * 	style - Style to use when the mouse is hovering.
5195 		     *  doNotRepaint - if true, the Connection will not be repainted.  useful when setting things up initially.
5196 		     */
5197 			
5198 			/*
5199 		     * Function: setHover
5200 		     * Sets/unsets the hover state of this Connection.
5201 		     * 
5202 		     * Parameters:
5203 		     * 	hover - hover state boolean
5204 		     * 	ignoreAttachedElements - if true, does not notify any attached elements of the change in hover state.  used mostly to avoid infinite loops.
5205 		     */
5206 
5207 		     /*
5208 		     * Function: getParameter
5209 		     * Gets the named parameter; returns null if no parameter with that name is set. Parameter values may have been supplied to a 'connect' or 'addEndpoint' call (connections made with the mouse get a copy of all parameters set on each of their Endpoints), or the parameter value may have been set with setParameter.
5210 		     *
5211 		     * Parameters:
5212 		     *   key - Parameter name.
5213 		     */
5214 
5215 		     /*
5216 		     * Function: setParameter
5217 		     * Sets the named parameter to the given value.
5218 		     *
5219 		     * Parameters:
5220 		     *   key - Parameter name.
5221 		     *   value - Parameter value.
5222 		     */
5223 			 
5224 			 /*
5225 			 * Property: connector
5226 			 * The underlying Connector for this Connection (eg. a Bezier connector, straight line connector, flowchart connector etc)
5227 			 */
5228 			 
5229 			 /*
5230 			 * Property: sourceId
5231 			 * Id of the source element in the connection.
5232 			 */
5233 			/*
5234 			 * Property: targetId
5235 			 * Id of the target element in the connection.
5236 			 */
5237 			/*
5238 			 * Property: scope
5239 			 * Optional scope descriptor for the connection.
5240 			 */
5241 			/*
5242 			 * Property: endpoints
5243 			 * Array of [source, target] Endpoint objects.
5244 			 */
5245 			/*
5246 			 *	Property: source
5247 			 *	The source element for this Connection.
5248 			 */
5249 			/*
5250 			 *	Property: target
5251 			 *	The target element for this Connection.
5252 			 */
5253 			/*
5254 			 * Property: overlays
5255 			 * List of Overlays for this component.
5256 			 */
5257 			/*
5258 			 * Function: addOverlay
5259 			 * Adds an Overlay to the Connection.
5260 			 * 
5261 			 * Parameters:
5262 			 * 	overlay - Overlay to add.
5263 			 */
5264 			/*
5265 			 * Function: getOverlay
5266 			 * Gets an overlay, by ID. Note: by ID.  You would pass an 'id' parameter
5267 			 * in to the Overlay's constructor arguments, and then use that to retrieve
5268 			 * it via this method.
5269 			 *
5270 			 * Parameters:
5271 			 * 	overlayId 	-	id of the overlay to retrieve.
5272 			 */
5273 			/*
5274 			* Function: getOverlays
5275 			* Gets all the overlays for this component.
5276 			*/
5277 			/*
5278 			 * Function: hideOverlay
5279 			 * Hides the overlay specified by the given id.
5280 			 *
5281 			 * Parameters:
5282 			 * 	overlayId 	-	id of the overlay to hide.
5283 			 */
5284 			/*
5285 			 * Function: hideOverlays
5286 			 * Hides all Overlays
5287 			 */
5288 			/*
5289 			 * Function: showOverlay
5290 			 * Shows the overlay specified by the given id.
5291 			 *
5292 			 * Parameters:
5293 			 * 	overlayId 	-	id of the overlay to show. 
5294 			 */
5295 			/*
5296 			 * Function: showOverlays
5297 			 * Shows all Overlays 
5298 			 */
5299 			/**
5300 			 * Function: removeAllOverlays
5301 			 * Removes all overlays from the Connection, and then repaints.
5302 			 */
5303 			/**
5304 			 * Function: removeOverlay
5305 			 * Removes an overlay by ID.  Note: by ID.  this is a string you set in the overlay spec.
5306 			 * 
5307 			 * Parameters:
5308 			 * 	overlayId - id of the overlay to remove.
5309 			 */
5310 			/**
5311 			 * Function: removeOverlays
5312 			 * Removes a set of overlays by ID.  Note: by ID.  this is a string you set in the overlay spec.
5313 			 * 
5314 			 * Parameters:
5315 			 * 	overlayIds - this function takes an arbitrary number of arguments, each of which is a single overlay id.
5316 			 */
5317 			/*
5318 			 * Function: setLabel
5319 			 * Sets the Connection's label.  
5320 			 * 
5321 			 * Parameters:
5322 			 * 	l	- label to set. May be a String, a Function that returns a String, or a params object containing { "label", "labelStyle", "location", "cssClass" }.  Note that this uses innerHTML on the label div, so keep
5323 			 * that in mind if you need escaped HTML.
5324 			 */
5325 			/*
5326 			* Function: getLabel
5327 			* Returns the label text for this Connection (or a function if you are labelling with a function).
5328 			* 
5329 			* This does not return the overlay itself; this is a convenience method which is a pair with
5330 			* setLabel; together they allow you to add and access a Label Overlay without having to create the
5331 			* Overlay object itself.  For access to the underlying label overlay that jsPlumb has created,
5332 			* use getLabelOverlay.
5333 			*
5334 			* See Also:
5335 			* 	<getOverlay>
5336 			*/
5337 			/*
5338 			* Function: getLabelOverlay
5339 			* Returns the underlying internal label overlay, which will exist if you specified a label on
5340 			* a connect call, or have called setLabel at any stage.   
5341 			*/
5342 			
5343 // ***************************** END OF PLACEHOLDERS FOR NATURAL DOCS *************************************************												
5344 
5345 			
5346 		}; // END Connection class
5347 		
5348 // ENDPOINT HELPER FUNCTIONS
5349 		var _makeConnectionDragHandler = function(placeholder) {
5350             var stopped = false;
5351             return {
5352                 drag : function() {
5353                     if (stopped) {
5354                         stopped = false;
5355                         return true;
5356                     }
5357                     var _ui = jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.getUIPosition(arguments, _currentInstance.getZoom()),
5358                         el = placeholder.element;
5359             
5360                     if (el) {
5361                         jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.setOffset(el, _ui);
5362                         _draw(_getElementObject(el), _ui);
5363                     }
5364                 },
5365                 stopDrag : function() {
5366                     stopped = true;
5367                 }
5368             };
5369 		};		
5370 		
5371 		var _makeFloatingEndpoint = function(paintStyle, referenceAnchor, endpoint, referenceCanvas, sourceElement) {			
5372 				var floatingAnchor = new FloatingAnchor( { reference : referenceAnchor, referenceCanvas : referenceCanvas });
5373         //setting the scope here should not be the way to fix that mootools issue.  it should be fixed by not
5374         // adding the floating endpoint as a droppable.  that makes more sense anyway!
5375         return _newEndpoint({ paintStyle : paintStyle, endpoint : endpoint, anchor : floatingAnchor, source : sourceElement, scope:"__floating" });
5376 		};
5377 		
5378 		/**
5379 		 * creates a placeholder div for dragging purposes, adds it to the DOM, and pre-computes its offset.
5380 		 */
5381 		var _makeDraggablePlaceholder = function(placeholder, parent) {
5382 			var n = document.createElement("div");
5383 			n.style.position = "absolute";
5384 			var placeholderDragElement = _getElementObject(n);
5385 			_appendElement(n, parent);
5386 			var id = _getId(placeholderDragElement);
5387 			_updateOffset( { elId : id });
5388 			// create and assign an id, and initialize the offset.
5389 			placeholder.id = id;
5390 			placeholder.element = placeholderDragElement;
5391 		};
5392 
5393 		/*
5394 		 * Class: Endpoint 
5395 		 * 
5396 		 * Models an endpoint. Can have 1 to 'maxConnections' Connections emanating from it (set maxConnections to -1 
5397 		 * to allow unlimited).  Typically, if you use 'jsPlumb.connect' to programmatically connect two elements, you won't
5398 		 * actually deal with the underlying Endpoint objects.  But if you wish to support drag and drop Connections, one of the ways you
5399 		 * do so is by creating and registering Endpoints using 'jsPlumb.addEndpoint', and marking these Endpoints as 'source' and/or
5400 		 * 'target' Endpoints for Connections.  
5401 		 * 
5402 		 * 
5403 		 */
5404 
5405 		/*
5406 		 * Function: Endpoint 
5407 		 * 
5408 		 * Endpoint constructor.
5409 		 * 
5410 		 * Parameters: 
5411 		 * anchor - definition of the Anchor for the endpoint.  You can include one or more Anchor definitions here; if you include more than one, jsPlumb creates a 'dynamic' Anchor, ie. an Anchor which changes position relative to the other elements in a Connection.  Each Anchor definition can be either a string nominating one of the basic Anchors provided by jsPlumb (eg. "TopCenter"), or a four element array that designates the Anchor's location and orientation (eg, and this is equivalent to TopCenter, [ 0.5, 0, 0, -1 ]).  To provide more than one Anchor definition just put them all in an array. You can mix string definitions with array definitions.
5412 		 * endpoint - optional Endpoint definition. This takes the form of either a string nominating one of the basic Endpoints provided by jsPlumb (eg. "Rectangle"), or an array containing [name,params] for those cases where you don't wish to use the default values, eg. [ "Rectangle", { width:5, height:10 } ].
5413 		 * enabled - optional, defaults to true. Indicates whether or not the Endpoint should be enabled for mouse events (drag/drop).
5414 		 * paintStyle - endpoint style, a js object. may be null. 
5415 		 * hoverPaintStyle - style to use when the mouse is hovering over the Endpoint. A js object. may be null; defaults to null.
5416 		 * cssClass - optional CSS class to set on the display element associated with this Endpoint.
5417 		 * hoverClass - optional CSS class to set on the display element associated with this Endpoint when it is in hover state.
5418 		 * source - element the Endpoint is attached to, of type String (an element id) or element selector. Required.
5419 		 * canvas - canvas element to use. may be, and most often is, null.
5420 		 * container - optional id or selector instructing jsPlumb where to attach the element it creates for this endpoint.  you should read the documentation for a full discussion of this.
5421 		 * connections - optional list of Connections to configure the Endpoint with. 
5422 		 * isSource - boolean. indicates the endpoint can act as a source of new connections. Optional; defaults to false.
5423 		 * maxConnections - integer; defaults to 1.  a value of -1 means no upper limit.
