7059         var _translateLocation = function(curve, location, absolute) {
7060             if (absolute)
7061                 location = jsBezier.locationAlongCurveFrom(curve, location > 0 ? 0 : 1, location);
7062 
7063             return location;
7064         };
7065         
7066         /**
7067          * returns the point on the connector's path that is 'location' along the length of the path, where 'location' is a decimal from
7068          * 0 to 1 inclusive. for the straight line connector this is simple maths.  for Bezier, not so much.
7069          */
7070         this.pointOnPath = function(location, absolute) {
7071             var c = _makeCurve();
7072             location = _translateLocation(c, location, absolute);
7073             return jsBezier.pointOnCurve(c, location);
7074         };
7075         
7076         /**
7077          * returns the gradient of the connector at the given point.
7078          */
7079         this.gradientAtPoint = function(location, absolute) {
7080             var c = _makeCurve();
7081             location = _translateLocation(c, location, absolute);
7082             return jsBezier.gradientAtPoint(c, location);        	
7083         };	              
7084         
7085         /**
7086          * for Bezier curves this method is a little tricky, cos calculating path distance algebraically is notoriously difficult.
7087          * this method is iterative, jumping forward .05% of the path at a time and summing the distance between this point and the previous
7088          * one, until the sum reaches 'distance'. the method may turn out to be computationally expensive; we'll see.
7089          * another drawback of this method is that if the connector gets quite long, .05% of the length of it is not necessarily smaller
7090          * than the desired distance, in which case the loop returns immediately and the arrow is mis-shapen. so a better strategy might be to
7091          * calculate the step as a function of distance/distance between endpoints.  
7092          */
7093         this.pointAlongPathFrom = function(location, distance, absolute) {
7094             var c = _makeCurve();
7095             location = _translateLocation(c, location, absolute);
7096             return jsBezier.pointAlongCurveFrom(c, location, distance);
7097         };           
7098     };        
7099     
7100     
7101     /**
7102      * Class: Connectors.Flowchart
7103      * Provides 'flowchart' connectors, consisting of vertical and horizontal line segments.
7104      */
7105     /**
7106      * Function: Constructor
7107      * 
7108      * Parameters:
7109      * 	stub - minimum length for the stub at each end of the connector. This can be an integer, giving a value for both ends of the connections, 
7110      * or an array of two integers, giving separate values for each end. The default is an integer with value 30 (pixels). 
7111      *  gap  - gap to leave between the end of the connector and the element on which the endpoint resides. if you make this larger than stub then you will see some odd looking behaviour.  defaults to 0 pixels.     
7112      */
7113     jsPlumb.Connectors.Flowchart = function(params) {
7114     	this.type = "Flowchart";
7115     	params = params || {};
7116         var self = this, 
7117         	stub = params.stub || params.minStubLength /* bwds compat. */ || 30, 
7118             sourceStub = jsPlumbUtil.isArray(stub) ? stub[0] : stub,
7119             targetStub = jsPlumbUtil.isArray(stub) ? stub[1] : stub,
7120             gap = params.gap || 0,
7121         	segments = [],
7122             totalLength = 0,
7123         	segmentProportions = [],
7124         	segmentProportionalLengths = [],
7125         	points = [],
7126         	swapX, swapY,
7127             maxX = -Infinity, maxY = -Infinity,
7128             minX = Infinity, minY = Infinity,
7129 			grid = params.grid,
7130 			_gridClamp = function(n, g) { var e = n % g, f = Math.floor(n / g), inc = e > (g / 2) ? 1 : 0; return (f + inc) * g; },
7131 			clampToGrid = function(x, y, dontClampX, dontClampY) {
7132 				return [
7133 					dontClampX || grid == null ? x : _gridClamp(x, grid[0]),
7134 					dontClampY || grid == null ? y : _gridClamp(y, grid[1])
7135 				];
7136 			},
7137 		/**
7138 		 * recalculates the points at which the segments begin and end, proportional to the total length travelled
7139 		 * by all the segments that constitute the connector.   we use this to help with pointOnPath calculations.
7140 		 */
7141 		updateSegmentProportions = function(startX, startY, endX, endY) {
7142 			var curLoc = 0;
7143 			for (var i = 0; i < segments.length; i++) {
7144 				segmentProportionalLengths[i] = segments[i][5] / totalLength;
7145 				segmentProportions[i] = [curLoc, (curLoc += (segments[i][5] / totalLength)) ];
7146 			}
7147 		},
7148 		appendSegmentsToPoints = function() {
7149 			points.push(segments.length);
7150 			for (var i = 0; i < segments.length; i++) {
7151 				points.push(segments[i][0]);
7152 				points.push(segments[i][1]);
7153 			}
7154 		},		
7155 		/**
7156 		 * helper method to add a segment.
7157 		 */
7158 		addSegment = function(x, y, sx, sy, tx, ty/*, doGridX, doGridY*/) {
7159 			var lx = segments.length == 0 ? sx : segments[segments.length - 1][0],
7160 			    ly = segments.length == 0 ? sy : segments[segments.length - 1][1],
7161                 m = x == lx ? Infinity : 0;
7162 				/*,
7163 				gridded = clampToGrid(x, y),
7164 				doGridX = true,
7165 				doGridY = true;
7166 				
7167 			// grid experiment. TODO: have two more params that indicate whether or not to lock to a grid in each
7168 			// axis. the reason for this is that anchor points wont always be located on the grid, so until a connector
7169 			// emanating from that anchor has turned a right angle, we can't actually clamp it to a grid for that axis.
7170 			// so if a line came out horizontally heading left, then it will probably not be clamped in the y axis, but
7171 			// we can choose to clamp its first corner in the x axis.  the same principle goes for the target anchor.
7172 			//if (segments.length == 0) {
7173 			console.log("this is the first segment...if sx == x then do not do grid in X.")
7174 			doGridX = !(sx == x) && !(tx == x);
7175 			doGridY = !(sy == y) && !(ty == y);						
7176 			x = doGridX ? gridded[0] : x;
7177 			y = doGridY ? gridded[1] : y;
7178 			*/			
7179 			
7180 			var l = Math.abs(x == lx ? y - ly : x - lx);
7181 			
7182 			segments.push([x, y, lx, ly, m, l]);
7183             totalLength += l;
7184 			
7185             maxX = Math.max(maxX, x);
7186             maxY = Math.max(maxY, y);
7187             minX = Math.min(minX, x);
7188             minY = Math.min(minY, y);
7189 		},
7190 		/**
7191 		 * returns [segment, proportion of travel in segment, segment index] for the segment 
7192 		 * that contains the point which is 'location' distance along the entire path, where 
7193 		 * 'location' is a decimal between 0 and 1 inclusive. in this connector type, paths 
7194 		 * are made up of a list of segments, each of which contributes some fraction to
7195 		 * the total length. 
7196          * From 1.3.10 this also supports the 'absolute' property, which lets us specify a location
7197          * as the absolute distance in pixels, rather than a proportion of the total path. 
7198 		 */
7199 		findSegmentForLocation = function(location, absolute) {
7200             if (absolute) {
7201                 location = location > 0 ? location / totalLength : (totalLength + location) / totalLength;
7202             }
7203 
7204 			var idx = segmentProportions.length - 1, inSegmentProportion = 1;
7205 			for (var i = 0; i < segmentProportions.length; i++) {
7206 				if (segmentProportions[i][1] >= location) {
7207 					idx = i;
7208 					inSegmentProportion = (location - segmentProportions[i][0]) / segmentProportionalLengths[i];                    
7209  					break;
7210 				}
7211 			}
7212 			return { segment:segments[idx], proportion:inSegmentProportion, index:idx };
7213 		};
7214 		
7215 		this.compute = function(sourcePos, targetPos, sourceEndpoint, targetEndpoint, 
7216             sourceAnchor, targetAnchor, lineWidth, minWidth, sourceInfo, targetInfo) {
7217             segments = [];
7218             segmentProportions = [];
7219             totalLength = 0;
7220             segmentProportionalLengths = [];
7221             maxX = maxY = -Infinity;
7222             minX = minY = Infinity;
7223 			
7224 			self.lineWidth = lineWidth;
7225             
7226             swapX = targetPos[0] < sourcePos[0]; 
7227             swapY = targetPos[1] < sourcePos[1];
7228             
7229             var lw = lineWidth || 1,                
7230                 sourceOffx = (lw / 2) + (sourceStub + targetStub), 
7231                 targetOffx = (lw / 2) + (targetStub + sourceStub),                 
7232                 sourceOffy = (lw / 2) + (sourceStub + targetStub),
7233                 targetOffy = (lw / 2) + (targetStub + sourceStub),
7234                 so = sourceAnchor.orientation || sourceAnchor.getOrientation(sourceEndpoint), 
7235                 to = targetAnchor.orientation || targetAnchor.getOrientation(targetEndpoint),
7236                 x = swapX ? targetPos[0] : sourcePos[0], 
7237                 y = swapY ? targetPos[1] : sourcePos[1],
7238                 w = Math.abs(targetPos[0] - sourcePos[0]) + sourceOffx + targetOffx, 
7239                 h = Math.abs(targetPos[1] - sourcePos[1]) + sourceOffy + targetOffy;
7240 
7241             // if either anchor does not have an orientation set, we derive one from their relative
7242             // positions.  we fix the axis to be the one in which the two elements are further apart, and
7243             // point each anchor at the other element.  this is also used when dragging a new connection.
7244             if (so[0] == 0 && so[1] == 0 || to[0] == 0 && to[1] == 0) {
7245                 var index = w > h ? 0 : 1, oIndex = [1,0][index];
7246                 so = []; to = [];
7247                 so[index] = sourcePos[index] > targetPos[index] ? -1 : 1;
7248                 to[index] = sourcePos[index] > targetPos[index] ? 1 : -1;
7249                 so[oIndex] = 0;
7250                 to[oIndex] = 0;
7251             }
7252             
7253 			/*
7254 			 this code is unexplained and causes paint errors with continuous anchors sometimes.
7255 			 commenting it out until i can get to the bottom of it.
7256             if (w < minWidth) {      
7257                 sourceOffx += (minWidth - w) / 2;
7258                 w = minWidth;
7259             }
7260             if (h < minWidth) {             
7261                 sourceOffy += (minWidth - h) / 2;
7262                 h = minWidth;
7263             }
7264             */
7265 
7266             var sx = swapX ? (w - targetOffx) +( gap * so[0])  : sourceOffx + (gap * so[0]), 
7267                 sy = swapY ? (h - targetOffy) + (gap * so[1])  : sourceOffy + (gap * so[1]), 
7268                 tx = swapX ? sourceOffx + (gap * to[0]) : (w - targetOffx) + (gap * to[0]),
7269                 ty = swapY ? sourceOffy + (gap * to[1]) : (h - targetOffy) + (gap * to[1]),
7270                 startStubX = sx + (so[0] * sourceStub), 
7271                 startStubY = sy + (so[1] * sourceStub),
7272                 endStubX = tx + (to[0] * targetStub), 
7273                 endStubY = ty + (to[1] * targetStub),
7274                 isXGreaterThanStubTimes2 = Math.abs(sx - tx) > (sourceStub + targetStub),
7275                 isYGreaterThanStubTimes2 = Math.abs(sy - ty) > (sourceStub + targetStub),
7276                 midx = startStubX + ((endStubX - startStubX) / 2),
7277                 midy = startStubY + ((endStubY - startStubY) / 2),
7278                 oProduct = ((so[0] * to[0]) + (so[1] * to[1])),
7279                 opposite = oProduct == -1,
7280                 perpendicular = oProduct == 0,
7281                 orthogonal = oProduct == 1; 
7282             
7283             x -= sourceOffx; y -= sourceOffy;
7284             points = [x, y, w, h, sx, sy, tx, ty];
7285             var extraPoints = [];                                        
7286                       
7287             var sourceAxis = so[0] == 0 ? "y" : "x",
7288                 anchorOrientation = opposite ? "opposite" : orthogonal ? "orthogonal" : "perpendicular",
7289                 segment = jsPlumbUtil.segment([sx, sy], [tx, ty]),
7290                 flipSourceSegments = so[sourceAxis == "x" ? 0 : 1] == -1,
7291                 flipSegments = {
7292                     "x":[null, 4, 3, 2, 1],
7293                     "y":[null, 2, 1, 4, 3]
7294                 }        
7295                 
7296             if (flipSourceSegments)                
7297                 segment = flipSegments[sourceAxis][segment];                                    
7298             
7299 			addSegment(startStubX, startStubY, sx, sy, tx, ty);
7300 
7301             var findClearedLine = function(start, mult, anchorPos, dimension) {
7302                 return start + (mult * (( 1 - anchorPos) * dimension) + Math.max(sourceStub, targetStub));
7303                 //mx = so[0] == 0 ? startStubX + ((1 - sourceAnchor.x) * sourceInfo.width) + stub : startStubX,
7304             },
7305 
7306             lineCalculators = {
7307                 oppositex : function() {
7308                     if (sourceEndpoint.elementId == targetEndpoint.elementId) {
7309                         var _y = startStubY + ((1 - sourceAnchor.y) * sourceInfo.height) + Math.max(sourceStub, targetStub);
7310                         return [ [ startStubX, _y ], [ endStubX, _y ]];
7311                     }
7312                     else if (isXGreaterThanStubTimes2 && (segment == 1 || segment == 2)) {
7313                         return [[ midx, sy ], [ midx, ty ]];
7314                     }    
7315                     else {
7316                         return [[ startStubX, midy ], [endStubX, midy ]];                
7317                     }
7318                 },
7319                 orthogonalx : function() {
7320                     if (segment == 1 || segment == 2) {
7321                         return [ [ endStubX, startStubY  ]];
7322                     }
7323                     else {
7324                         return [ [ startStubX, endStubY ]];
7325                     }
7326                 },
7327                 perpendicularx : function() {                
7328                     var my = (ty + sy) / 2;
7329                     if ((segment == 1 && to[1] == 1) || (segment == 2 && to[1] == -1)) {                  
7330                         if (Math.abs(tx - sx) > Math.max(sourceStub, targetStub))
7331                             return [ [endStubX, startStubY ]];            
7332                         else
7333                             return [ [startStubX, startStubY ], [ startStubX, my ], [ endStubX, my ]];                                
7334                     }  
7335                     else if ((segment == 3 && to[1] == -1) || (segment == 4 && to[1] == 1)) {                    
7336                         return [ [ startStubX, my ], [ endStubX, my ]];
7337                     }
7338                     else if ((segment == 3 && to[1] == 1) || (segment == 4 && to[1] == -1)) {                
7339                         return [ [ startStubX, endStubY ]];
7340                     }
7341                     else if ((segment == 1 && to[1] == -1) || (segment == 2 && to[1] == 1)) {                
7342                         if (Math.abs(tx - sx) > Math.max(sourceStub, targetStub))                    
7343                             return [ [ midx, startStubY ], [ midx, endStubY ]];                    
7344                         else
7345                             return [ [ startStubX, endStubY ]];                                        
7346                     }
7347                 },
7348                 oppositey : function() {
7349                     if (sourceEndpoint.elementId == targetEndpoint.elementId) {
7350                         var _x = startStubX + ((1 - sourceAnchor.x) * sourceInfo.width) + Math.max(sourceStub, targetStub);
7351                         return [ [ _x, startStubY ], [ _x, endStubY ]];
7352                     }
7353                     else if (isYGreaterThanStubTimes2 && (segment == 2 || segment == 3)) {
7354                         return [[ sx, midy ], [ tx, midy ]];
7355                     }    
7356                     else {
7357                         return [[ midx, startStubY ], [midx, endStubY ]];                
7358                     }
7359                 },
7360                 orthogonaly : function() {
7361                     if (segment == 2 || segment == 3) {
7362                         return [ [ startStubX, endStubY  ]];
7363                     }
7364                     else {
7365                         return [ [ endStubX, startStubY ]];
7366                     }
7367                 },
7368                 perpendiculary : function() {                
7369                     var mx = (tx + sx) / 2;
7370                     if ((segment == 2 && to[0] == -1) || (segment == 3 && to[0] == 1)) {                    
7371                         if (Math.abs(tx - sx) > Math.max(sourceStub, targetStub))
7372                             return [ [startStubX, endStubY ]];                    
7373                         else
7374                             return [ [startStubX, midy ], [ endStubX, midy ]];                                        
7375                     }  
7376                     else if ((segment == 1 && to[0] == -1) || (segment == 4 && to[0] == 1)) {
7377                         var mx = (tx + sx) / 2;
7378                         return [ [ mx, startStubY ], [ mx, endStubY ]];
7379                     }
7380                     else if ((segment == 1 && to[0] == 1) || (segment == 4 && to[0] == -1)) {                
7381                         return [ [ endStubX, startStubY ]];
7382                     }
7383                     else if ((segment == 2 && to[0] == 1) || (segment == 3 && to[0] == -1)) {                
7384                         if (Math.abs(ty - sy) > Math.max(sourceStub, targetStub))                    
7385                             return [ [ startStubX, midy ], [ endStubX, midy ]];                  
7386                         else
7387                             return [ [ endStubX, startStubY ]];                                    
7388                     }
7389                 }
7390             };                                                 
7391 
7392             var p = lineCalculators[anchorOrientation + sourceAxis]();
7393             if (p) {
7394                 for (var i = 0; i < p.length; i++) {
7395                     addSegment(p[i][0], p[i][1], sx, sy, tx, ty);
7396                 }
7397             }                                                    
7398 
7399             addSegment(endStubX, endStubY, sx, sy, tx, ty);
7400             addSegment(tx, ty, sx, sy, tx, ty);
7401             
7402             appendSegmentsToPoints();
7403             updateSegmentProportions(sx, sy, tx, ty);                        
7404             
7405             // adjust the max values of the canvas if we have a value that is larger than what we previously set.
7406             // 
7407             if (maxY > points[3]) points[3] = maxY + (lineWidth * 2);            
7408             if (maxX > points[2]) points[2] = maxX + (lineWidth * 2);
7409             
7410             return points;
7411         };
7412 		
7413 		/**
7414          * returns the point on the connector's path that is 'location' along the length of the path, where 'location' is a decimal from
7415          * 0 to 1 inclusive. for this connector we must first figure out which segment the given point lies in, and then compute the x,y position
7416          * from our knowledge of the segment's start and end points.
7417          */
7418         this.pointOnPath = function(location, absolute) {            
7419         	return self.pointAlongPathFrom(location, 0, absolute);
7420         };
7421         
7422         /**
7423          * returns the gradient of the connector at the given point; the gradient will be either 0 or Infinity, depending on the direction of the
7424          * segment the point falls in. segment gradients are calculated in the compute method.  
7425          */
7426         this.gradientAtPoint = function(location, absolute) { 
7427         	return segments[findSegmentForLocation(location, absolute)["index"]][4];
7428         };
7429         
7430         /**
7431          * returns the point on the connector's path that is 'distance' along the length of the path from 'location', where 
7432          * 'location' is a decimal from 0 to 1 inclusive, and 'distance' is a number of pixels.  when you consider this concept from the point of view
7433          * of this connector, it starts to become clear that there's a problem with the overlay paint code: given that this connector makes several
7434          * 90 degree turns, it's entirely possible that an arrow overlay could be forced to paint itself around a corner, which would look stupid. this is
7435          * because jsPlumb uses this method (and pointOnPath) so determine the locations of the various points that go to make up an overlay.  a better
7436          * solution would probably be to just use pointOnPath along with gradientAtPoint, and draw the overlay so that its axis ran along
7437          * a tangent to the connector.  for straight line connectors this would obviously mean the overlay was painted directly on the connector, since a 
7438          * tangent to a straight line is the line itself, which is what we want; for this connector, and for beziers, the results would probably be better.  an additional
7439          * advantage is, of course, that there's less computation involved doing it that way. 
7440          */
7441         this.pointAlongPathFrom = function(location, distance, absolute) {
7442         	var s = findSegmentForLocation(location, absolute), seg = s.segment, p = s.proportion, sl = segments[s.index][5], m = segments[s.index][4];
7443         	var e = {         		
7444         		x 	: m == Infinity ? seg[2] : seg[2] > seg[0] ? seg[0] + ((1 - p) * sl) - distance : seg[2] + (p * sl) + distance,
7445         		y 	: m == 0 ? seg[3] : seg[3] > seg[1] ? seg[1] + ((1 - p) * sl) - distance  : seg[3] + (p * sl) + distance,
7446         		segmentInfo : s
7447         	};
7448         	
7449         	return e;
7450         };
7451     };
7452 
7453  // ********************************* END OF CONNECTOR TYPES *******************************************************************
7454     
7455  // ********************************* ENDPOINT TYPES *******************************************************************
7456     
7457     /**
7458      * Class: Endpoints.Dot
7459      * A round endpoint, with default radius 10 pixels.
7460      */    	
7461     	
7462 	/**
7463 	 * Function: Constructor
7464 	 * 
7465 	 * Parameters:
7466 	 * 
7467 	 * 	radius	-	radius of the endpoint.  defaults to 10 pixels.
7468 	 */
7469 	jsPlumb.Endpoints.Dot = function(params) {
7470 		this.type = "Dot";
7471 		var self = this;
7472 		params = params || {};				
7473 		this.radius = params.radius || 10;
7474 		this.defaultOffset = 0.5 * this.radius;
7475 		this.defaultInnerRadius = this.radius / 3;			
7476 		
7477 		this.compute = function(anchorPoint, orientation, endpointStyle, connectorPaintStyle) {
7478 			var r = endpointStyle.radius || self.radius,
7479 				x = anchorPoint[0] - r,
7480 				y = anchorPoint[1] - r;
7481 			return [ x, y, r * 2, r * 2, r ];
7482 		};
7483 	};
7484 	
7485 	/**
7486 	 * Class: Endpoints.Rectangle
7487 	 * A Rectangular Endpoint, with default size 20x20.
7488 	 */
7489 	/**
7490 	 * Function: Constructor
7491 	 * 
7492 	 * Parameters:
7493 	 * 
7494 	 * 	width	- width of the endpoint. defaults to 20 pixels.
7495 	 * 	height	- height of the endpoint. defaults to 20 pixels.	
7496 	 */
7497 	jsPlumb.Endpoints.Rectangle = function(params) {
7498 		this.type = "Rectangle";
7499 		var self = this;
7500 		params = params || {};
7501 		this.width = params.width || 20;
7502 		this.height = params.height || 20;
7503 		
7504 		this.compute = function(anchorPoint, orientation, endpointStyle, connectorPaintStyle) {
7505 			var width = endpointStyle.width || self.width,
7506 				height = endpointStyle.height || self.height,
7507 				x = anchorPoint[0] - (width/2),
7508 				y = anchorPoint[1] - (height/2);
7509 			return [ x, y, width, height];
7510 		};
7511 	};
7512 	
7513 
7514     var DOMElementEndpoint = function(params) {
7515         jsPlumb.DOMElementComponent.apply(this, arguments);
7516         var self = this;
7517 
7518         var displayElements = [  ];
7519         this.getDisplayElements = function() { 
7520             return displayElements; 
7521         };
7522         
7523         this.appendDisplayElement = function(el) {
7524             displayElements.push(el);
7525         };            
7526     };
7527 	/**
7528 	 * Class: Endpoints.Image
7529 	 * Draws an image as the Endpoint.
7530 	 */
7531 	/**
7532 	 * Function: Constructor
7533 	 * 
7534 	 * Parameters:
7535 	 * 
7536 	 * 	src	-	location of the image to use.
7537 	 */
7538 	jsPlumb.Endpoints.Image = function(params) {
7539 				
7540 		this.type = "Image";
7541 		DOMElementEndpoint.apply(this, arguments);
7542 		
7543 		var self = this, 
7544 			initialized = false,
7545 			deleted = false,
7546 			widthToUse = params.width,
7547 			heightToUse = params.height,
7548             _onload = null,
7549             _endpoint = params.endpoint;
7550 			
7551 		this.img = new Image();
7552 		self.ready = false;
7553 
7554 		this.img.onload = function() {
7555 			self.ready = true;
7556 			widthToUse = widthToUse || self.img.width;
7557 			heightToUse = heightToUse || self.img.height;
7558             if (_onload) {
7559                 _onload(self);
7560             }
7561 		};
7562 
7563         /*
7564             Function: setImage
7565             Sets the Image to use in this Endpoint.  
7566 
7567             Parameters:
7568             img         -   may be a URL or an Image object
7569             onload      -   optional; a callback to execute once the image has loaded.
7570         */
7571         _endpoint.setImage = function(img, onload) {
7572             var s = img.constructor == String ? img : img.src;
7573             _onload = onload;
7574             self.img.src = img;
7575 
7576             if (self.canvas != null)
7577                 self.canvas.setAttribute("src", img);
7578         };
7579 
7580         _endpoint.setImage(params.src || params.url, params.onload);
7581 
7582 		this.compute = function(anchorPoint, orientation, endpointStyle, connectorPaintStyle) {
7583 			self.anchorPoint = anchorPoint;
7584 			if (self.ready) return [anchorPoint[0] - widthToUse / 2, anchorPoint[1] - heightToUse / 2, 
7585 									widthToUse, heightToUse];
7586 			else return [0,0,0,0];
7587 		};
7588 		
7589 		self.canvas = document.createElement("img"), initialized = false;
7590 		self.canvas.style["margin"] = 0;
7591 		self.canvas.style["padding"] = 0;
7592 		self.canvas.style["outline"] = 0;
7593 		self.canvas.style["position"] = "absolute";
7594 		var clazz = params.cssClass ? " " + params.cssClass : "";
7595 		self.canvas.className = jsPlumb.endpointClass + clazz;
7596 		if (widthToUse) self.canvas.setAttribute("width", widthToUse);
7597 		if (heightToUse) self.canvas.setAttribute("height", heightToUse);		
7598 		jsPlumb.appendElement(self.canvas, params.parent);
7599 		self.attachListeners(self.canvas, self);
7600 		
7601 		self.cleanup = function() {
7602 			deleted = true;
7603 		};
7604 		
7605 		var actuallyPaint = function(d, style, anchor) {
7606 			if (!deleted) {
7607 				if (!initialized) {
7608 					self.canvas.setAttribute("src", self.img.src);
7609 					self.appendDisplayElement(self.canvas);
7610 					initialized = true;
7611 				}
7612 				var x = self.anchorPoint[0] - (widthToUse / 2),
7613 					y = self.anchorPoint[1] - (heightToUse / 2);
7614 				jsPlumb.sizeCanvas(self.canvas, x, y, widthToUse, heightToUse);
7615 			}
7616 		};
7617 		
7618 		this.paint = function(d, style, anchor) {
7619 			if (self.ready) {
7620     			actuallyPaint(d, style, anchor);
7621 			}
7622 			else { 
7623 				window.setTimeout(function() {    					
7624 					self.paint(d, style, anchor);
7625 				}, 200);
7626 			}
7627 		};				
7628 	};
7629 	
7630 	/**
7631 	 * Class: Endpoints.Blank
7632 	 * An Endpoint that paints nothing (visible) on the screen.  Supports cssClass and hoverClass parameters like all Endpoints.
7633 	 */
7634 	jsPlumb.Endpoints.Blank = function(params) {
7635 		var self = this;
7636 		this.type = "Blank";
7637 		DOMElementEndpoint.apply(this, arguments);		
7638 		this.compute = function(anchorPoint, orientation, endpointStyle, connectorPaintStyle) {
7639 			return [anchorPoint[0], anchorPoint[1],10,0];
7640 		};
7641 		
7642 		self.canvas = document.createElement("div");
7643 		self.canvas.style.display = "block";
7644 		self.canvas.style.width = "1px";
7645 		self.canvas.style.height = "1px";
7646 		self.canvas.style.background = "transparent";
7647 		self.canvas.style.position = "absolute";
7648 		self.canvas.className = self._jsPlumb.endpointClass;
7649 		jsPlumb.appendElement(self.canvas, params.parent);
7650 		
7651 		this.paint = function(d, style, anchor) {
7652 			jsPlumb.sizeCanvas(self.canvas, d[0], d[1], d[2], d[3]);	
7653 		};
7654 	};
7655 	
7656 	/**
7657 	 * Class: Endpoints.Triangle
7658 	 * A triangular Endpoint.  
7659 	 */
7660 	/**
7661 	 * Function: Constructor
7662 	 * 
7663 	 * Parameters:
7664 	 * 
7665 	 * 	width	-	width of the triangle's base.  defaults to 55 pixels.
7666 	 * 	height	-	height of the triangle from base to apex.  defaults to 55 pixels.
7667 	 */
7668 	jsPlumb.Endpoints.Triangle = function(params) {
7669 		this.type = "Triangle";
7670 		params = params || {  };
7671 		params.width = params.width || 55;
7672 		params.height = params.height || 55;
7673 		this.width = params.width;
7674 		this.height = params.height;
7675 		this.compute = function(anchorPoint, orientation, endpointStyle, connectorPaintStyle) {
7676 			var width = endpointStyle.width || self.width,
7677 			height = endpointStyle.height || self.height,
7678 			x = anchorPoint[0] - (width/2),
7679 			y = anchorPoint[1] - (height/2);
7680 			return [ x, y, width, height ];
7681 		};
7682 	};
7683 // ********************************* END OF ENDPOINT TYPES *******************************************************************
7684 	
7685 
7686 // ********************************* OVERLAY DEFINITIONS ***********************************************************************    
7687 
7688 	var AbstractOverlay = function(params) {
7689 		var visible = true, self = this;
7690         this.isAppendedAtTopLevel = true;
7691 		this.component = params.component;
7692 		this.loc = params.location == null ? 0.5 : params.location;
7693         this.endpointLoc = params.endpointLocation == null ? [ 0.5, 0.5] : params.endpointLocation;
7694 		this.setVisible = function(val) { 
7695 			visible = val;
7696 			self.component.repaint();
7697 		};
7698     	this.isVisible = function() { return visible; };
7699     	this.hide = function() { self.setVisible(false); };
7700     	this.show = function() { self.setVisible(true); };
7701     	
7702     	this.incrementLocation = function(amount) {
7703     		self.loc += amount;
7704     		self.component.repaint();
7705     	};
7706     	this.setLocation = function(l) {
7707     		self.loc = l;
7708     		self.component.repaint();
7709     	};
7710     	this.getLocation = function() {
7711     		return self.loc;
7712     	};
7713 	};
7714 	
7715 	
7716 	/**
7717 	 * Class: Overlays.Arrow
7718 	 * 
7719 	 * An arrow overlay, defined by four points: the head, the two sides of the tail, and a 'foldback' point at some distance along the length
7720 	 * of the arrow that lines from each tail point converge into.  The foldback point is defined using a decimal that indicates some fraction
7721 	 * of the length of the arrow and has a default value of 0.623.  A foldback point value of 1 would mean that the arrow had a straight line
7722 	 * across the tail.  
7723 	 */
7724 	/**
7725 	 * Function: Constructor
7726 	 * 
7727 	 * Parameters:
7728 	 * 
7729 	 * 	length - distance in pixels from head to tail baseline. default 20.
7730 	 * 	width - width in pixels of the tail baseline. default 20.
7731 	 * 	fillStyle - style to use when filling the arrow.  defaults to "black".
7732 	 * 	strokeStyle - style to use when stroking the arrow. defaults to null, which means the arrow is not stroked.
7733 	 * 	lineWidth - line width to use when stroking the arrow. defaults to 1, but only used if strokeStyle is not null.
7734 	 * 	foldback - distance (as a decimal from 0 to 1 inclusive) along the length of the arrow marking the point the tail points should fold back to.  defaults to 0.623.
7735 	 * 	location - distance (as a decimal from 0 to 1 inclusive) marking where the arrow should sit on the connector. defaults to 0.5.
7736 	 * 	direction - indicates the direction the arrow points in. valid values are -1 and 1; 1 is default.
7737 	 */
7738 	jsPlumb.Overlays.Arrow = function(params) {
7739 		this.type = "Arrow";
7740 		AbstractOverlay.apply(this, arguments);
7741         this.isAppendedAtTopLevel = false;
7742 		params = params || {};
7743 		var self = this;
7744 		
7745     	this.length = params.length || 20;
7746     	this.width = params.width || 20;
7747     	this.id = params.id;
7748     	var direction = (params.direction || 1) < 0 ? -1 : 1,
7749     	    paintStyle = params.paintStyle || { lineWidth:1 },
7750     	    // how far along the arrow the lines folding back in come to. default is 62.3%.
7751     	    foldback = params.foldback || 0.623;
7752 
7753     	    	
7754     	this.computeMaxSize = function() { return self.width * 1.5; };
7755     	
7756     	this.cleanup = function() { };  // nothing to clean up for Arrows
7757     	
7758     	this.draw = function(connector, currentConnectionPaintStyle, connectorDimensions) {
7759 
7760             var hxy, mid, txy, tail, cxy;
7761             if (connector.pointAlongPathFrom) {
7762 
7763                 if (jsPlumbUtil.isString(self.loc) || self.loc > 1 || self.loc < 0) {
7764                     var l = parseInt(self.loc);
7765                     hxy = connector.pointAlongPathFrom(l, direction * self.length / 2, true),
7766                     mid = connector.pointOnPath(l, true),
7767                     txy = jsPlumbUtil.pointOnLine(hxy, mid, self.length);
7768                 }
7769                 else if (self.loc == 1) {
7770                     hxy = connector.pointOnPath(self.loc);
7771                     mid = connector.pointAlongPathFrom(self.loc, -1);                    
7772                     txy = jsPlumbUtil.pointOnLine(hxy, mid, self.length);
7773                 }
7774                 else if (self.loc == 0) {
7775                     txy = connector.pointOnPath(self.loc);
7776                     mid = connector.pointAlongPathFrom(self.loc, 1);
7777                     hxy = jsPlumbUtil.pointOnLine(txy, mid, self.length);
7778                 }
7779                 else {
7780     			    hxy = connector.pointAlongPathFrom(self.loc, direction * self.length / 2),
7781                     mid = connector.pointOnPath(self.loc),
7782                     txy = jsPlumbUtil.pointOnLine(hxy, mid, self.length);
7783                 }
7784 
7785                 tail = jsPlumbUtil.perpendicularLineTo(hxy, txy, self.width);
7786                 cxy = jsPlumbUtil.pointOnLine(hxy, txy, foldback * self.length);
7787 
7788     			var minx = Math.min(hxy.x, tail[0].x, tail[1].x),
7789     				maxx = Math.max(hxy.x, tail[0].x, tail[1].x),
7790     				miny = Math.min(hxy.y, tail[0].y, tail[1].y),
7791     				maxy = Math.max(hxy.y, tail[0].y, tail[1].y);
7792     			
7793     			var d = { hxy:hxy, tail:tail, cxy:cxy },
7794     			    strokeStyle = paintStyle.strokeStyle || currentConnectionPaintStyle.strokeStyle,
7795     			    fillStyle = paintStyle.fillStyle || currentConnectionPaintStyle.strokeStyle,
7796     			    lineWidth = paintStyle.lineWidth || currentConnectionPaintStyle.lineWidth;
7797     			
7798     			self.paint(connector, d, lineWidth, strokeStyle, fillStyle, connectorDimensions);							
7799 			
7800 			    return [ minx, maxx, miny, maxy]; 
7801             }
7802             else return [0,0,0,0];
7803     	};
7804     };          
7805     
7806     /**
7807      * Class: Overlays.PlainArrow
7808 	 * 
7809 	 * A basic arrow.  This is in fact just one instance of the more generic case in which the tail folds back on itself to some
7810 	 * point along the length of the arrow: in this case, that foldback point is the full length of the arrow.  so it just does
7811 	 * a 'call' to Arrow with foldback set appropriately.       
7812 	 */
7813     /**
7814      * Function: Constructor
7815      * See <Overlays.Arrow> for allowed parameters for this overlay.
7816      */
7817     jsPlumb.Overlays.PlainArrow = function(params) {
7818     	params = params || {};    	
7819     	var p = jsPlumb.extend(params, {foldback:1});
7820     	jsPlumb.Overlays.Arrow.call(this, p);
7821     	this.type = "PlainArrow";
7822     };
7823         
7824     /**
7825      * Class: Overlays.Diamond
7826      * 
7827 	 * A diamond. Like PlainArrow, this is a concrete case of the more generic case of the tail points converging on some point...it just
7828 	 * happens that in this case, that point is greater than the length of the the arrow.    
7829 	 * 
7830 	 *      this could probably do with some help with positioning...due to the way it reuses the Arrow paint code, what Arrow thinks is the
7831 	 *      center is actually 1/4 of the way along for this guy.  but we don't have any knowledge of pixels at this point, so we're kind of
7832 	 *      stuck when it comes to helping out the Arrow class. possibly we could pass in a 'transpose' parameter or something. the value
7833 	 *      would be -l/4 in this case - move along one quarter of the total length.
7834 	 */
7835     /**
7836      * Function: Constructor
7837      * See <Overlays.Arrow> for allowed parameters for this overlay.
7838      */
7839     jsPlumb.Overlays.Diamond = function(params) {
7840     	params = params || {};    	
7841     	var l = params.length || 40,
7842     	    p = jsPlumb.extend(params, {length:l/2, foldback:2});
7843     	jsPlumb.Overlays.Arrow.call(this, p);
7844     	this.type = "Diamond";
7845     };
7846     
7847 	
7848 	// abstract superclass for overlays that add an element to the DOM.
7849     var AbstractDOMOverlay = function(params) {
7850 		jsPlumb.DOMElementComponent.apply(this, arguments);
7851     	AbstractOverlay.apply(this, arguments);
7852 		
7853 		var self = this, initialised = false;
7854 		params = params || {};
7855 		this.id = params.id;
7856 		var div;
7857 		
7858 		var makeDiv = function() {
7859 			div = params.create(params.component);
7860 			div = jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.getDOMElement(div);
7861 			div.style["position"] 	= 	"absolute";    	
7862 			var clazz = params["_jsPlumb"].overlayClass + " " + 
7863 				(self.cssClass ? self.cssClass : 
7864 				params.cssClass ? params.cssClass : "");    	
7865 			div.className =	clazz;
7866 			jsPlumb.appendElement(div, params.component.parent);
7867 			params["_jsPlumb"].getId(div);		
7868 	    	self.attachListeners(div, self);
7869 	    	self.canvas = div;
7870 		};
7871 		
7872 		this.getElement = function() {
7873 			if (div == null) {
7874 				makeDiv();
7875 			}
7876     		return div;
7877     	};
7878 		
7879 		this.getDimensions = function() {
7880     		return jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.getSize(jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.getElementObject(self.getElement()));
7881     	};
7882 		
7883 		var cachedDimensions = null,
7884 			_getDimensions = function(component) {
7885 				if (cachedDimensions == null)
7886 					cachedDimensions = self.getDimensions();
7887 				return cachedDimensions;
7888 			};
7889 		
7890 		/*
7891 		 * Function: clearCachedDimensions
7892 		 * Clears the cached dimensions for the label. As a performance enhancement, label dimensions are
7893 		 * cached from 1.3.12 onwards. The cache is cleared when you change the label text, of course, but
7894 		 * there are other reasons why the text dimensions might change - if you make a change through CSS, for
7895 		 * example, you might change the font size.  in that case you should explicitly call this method.
7896 		 */
7897 		this.clearCachedDimensions = function() {
7898 			cachedDimensions = null;
7899 		};
7900 		
7901 		this.computeMaxSize = function() {
7902     		var td = _getDimensions();
7903 			return Math.max(td[0], td[1]);
7904     	}; 
7905 		
7906 		//override setVisible
7907     	var osv = self.setVisible;
7908     	self.setVisible = function(state) {
7909     		osv(state); // call superclass
7910     		div.style.display = state ? "block" : "none";
7911     	};
7912 		
7913 		this.cleanup = function() {
7914     		if (div != null) jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.removeElement(div);
7915     	};
7916 		
7917 		this.paint = function(component, d, componentDimensions) {
7918 			if (!initialised) {
7919 				self.getElement();
7920 				component.appendDisplayElement(div);
7921 				self.attachListeners(div, component);
7922 				initialised = true;
7923 			}
7924 			div.style.left = (componentDimensions[0] + d.minx) + "px";
7925 			div.style.top = (componentDimensions[1] + d.miny) + "px";			
7926     	};
7927 				
7928 		this.draw = function(component, currentConnectionPaintStyle, componentDimensions) {
7929 	    	var td = _getDimensions();
7930 	    	if (td != null && td.length == 2) {
7931 				var cxy = {x:0,y:0};
7932                 if (component.pointOnPath) {
7933                     var loc = self.loc, absolute = false;
7934                     if (jsPlumbUtil.isString(self.loc) || self.loc < 0 || self.loc > 1) {
7935                         loc = parseInt(self.loc);
7936                         absolute = true;
7937                     }
7938                     cxy = component.pointOnPath(loc, absolute);  // a connection
7939                 }
7940                 else {
7941                     var locToUse = self.loc.constructor == Array ? self.loc : self.endpointLoc;
7942                     cxy = { x:locToUse[0] * componentDimensions[2],
7943                             y:locToUse[1] * componentDimensions[3] };      
7944                 } 
7945                            
7946 				minx = cxy.x - (td[0] / 2),
7947 				miny = cxy.y - (td[1] / 2);				
7948 				self.paint(component, { minx:minx, miny:miny, td:td, cxy:cxy }, componentDimensions);				
7949 				return [minx, minx + td[0], miny, miny + td[1]];
7950         	}
7951 	    	else return [0,0,0,0];
7952 	    };
7953 	    
7954 	    this.reattachListeners = function(connector) {
7955 	    	if (div) {
7956 	    		self.reattachListenersForElement(div, self, connector);
7957 	    	}
7958 	    };
7959 		
7960 	};
7961 	
7962 	/**
7963      * Class: Overlays.Custom
7964      * A Custom overlay. You supply a 'create' function which returns some DOM element, and jsPlumb positions it.
7965      * The 'create' function is passed a Connection or Endpoint.
7966      */
7967     /**
7968      * Function: Constructor
7969      * 
7970      * Parameters:
7971      * 	create - function for jsPlumb to call that returns a DOM element.
7972      * 	location - distance (as a decimal from 0 to 1 inclusive) marking where the label should sit on the connector. defaults to 0.5.
7973      * 	id - optional id to use for later retrieval of this overlay.
7974      * 	
7975      */
7976     jsPlumb.Overlays.Custom = function(params) {
7977     	this.type = "Custom";    	
7978     	AbstractDOMOverlay.apply(this, arguments);		    	        		    	    		
7979     };
7980     
7981     /**
7982      * Class: Overlays.Label
7983      * A Label overlay. For all different renderer types (SVG/Canvas/VML), jsPlumb draws a Label overlay as a styled DIV.  Version 1.3.0 of jsPlumb
7984      * introduced the ability to set css classes on the label; this is now the preferred way for you to style a label.  The 'labelStyle' parameter
7985      * is still supported in 1.3.0 but its usage is deprecated.  Under the hood, jsPlumb just turns that object into a bunch of CSS directive that it 
7986      * puts on the Label's 'style' attribute, so the end result is the same. 
7987      */
7988     /**
7989      * Function: Constructor
7990      * 
7991      * Parameters:
7992      * 	cssClass - optional css class string to append to css class. This string is appended "as-is", so you can of course have multiple classes
7993      *             defined.  This parameter is preferred to using labelStyle, borderWidth and borderStyle.
7994      * 	label - the label to paint.  May be a string or a function that returns a string.  Nothing will be painted if your label is null or your
7995      *         label function returns null.  empty strings _will_ be painted.
7996      * 	location - distance (as a decimal from 0 to 1 inclusive) marking where the label should sit on the connector. defaults to 0.5.
7997      * 	id - optional id to use for later retrieval of this overlay.
7998      * 	
7999      */
8000     jsPlumb.Overlays.Label = function(params) {
8001 		var self = this;    	
8002 		this.labelStyle = params.labelStyle || jsPlumb.Defaults.LabelStyle;
8003 		this.cssClass = this.labelStyle != null ? this.labelStyle.cssClass : null;
8004 		params.create = function() {
8005 			return document.createElement("div");
8006 		};
8007     	jsPlumb.Overlays.Custom.apply(this, arguments);
8008 		this.type = "Label";
8009     	
8010         var label = params.label || "",
8011             self = this,    	    
8012             labelText = null;
8013     	
8014     	/*
8015     	 * Function: setLabel
8016     	 * sets the label's, um, label.  you would think i'd call this function
8017     	 * 'setText', but you can pass either a Function or a String to this, so
8018     	 * it makes more sense as 'setLabel'. This uses innerHTML on the label div, so keep
8019          * that in mind if you need escaped HTML.
8020     	 */
8021     	this.setLabel = function(l) {
8022     		label = l;
8023     		labelText = null;
8024 			self.clearCachedDimensions();
8025 			_update();
8026     		self.component.repaint();
8027     	};
8028     	
8029 		var _update = function() {
8030 			if (typeof label == "function") {
8031     			var lt = label(self);
8032     			self.getElement().innerHTML = lt.replace(/\r\n/g, "<br/>");
8033     		}
8034     		else {
8035     			if (labelText == null) {
8036     				labelText = label;
8037     				self.getElement().innerHTML = labelText.replace(/\r\n/g, "<br/>");
8038     			}
8039     		}
8040 		};
8041 		
8042     	this.getLabel = function() {
8043     		return label;
8044     	};
8045     	
8046 		var superGD = this.getDimensions;		
8047 		this.getDimensions = function() {				
8048     		_update();
8049 			return superGD();
8050     	};
8051 		
8052     };
8053 		
8054 
8055  // ********************************* END OF OVERLAY DEFINITIONS ***********************************************************************
8056     
8057 })();/*
8058  * jsPlumb
8059  *
8060  * Title:jsPlumb 1.3.15
8061  *
8062  * Provides a way to visually connect elements on an HTML page, using either SVG, Canvas
8063  * elements, or VML.
8064  *
8065  * This file contains the state machine connectors.
8066  *
8067  * Thanks to Brainstorm Mobile Solutions for supporting the development of these.
8068  *
8069  * Copyright (c) 2010 - 2012 Simon Porritt (simon.porritt@gmail.com)
8070  *
8071  * http://jsplumb.org
8072  * http://github.com/sporritt/jsplumb
8073  * http://code.google.com/p/jsplumb
8074  *
8075  * Dual licensed under the MIT and GPL2 licenses.
8076  */
8077 
8078 ;(function() {
8079 
8080 	var Line = function(x1, y1, x2, y2) {
8081 
8082 		this.m = (y2 - y1) / (x2 - x1);
8083 		this.b = -1 * ((this.m * x1) - y1);
8084 	
8085 		this.rectIntersect = function(x,y,w,h) {
8086 			var results = [];
8087 		
8088 			// 	try top face
8089 			// 	the equation of the top face is y = (0 * x) + b; y = b.
8090 			var xInt = (y - this.b) / this.m;
8091 			// test that the X value is in the line's range.
8092 			if (xInt >= x && xInt <= (x + w)) results.push([ xInt, (this.m * xInt) + this.b ]);
8093 		
8094 			// try right face
8095 			var yInt = (this.m * (x + w)) + this.b;
8096 			if (yInt >= y && yInt <= (y + h)) results.push([ (yInt - this.b) / this.m, yInt ]);
8097 		
8098 			// 	bottom face
8099 			var xInt = ((y + h) - this.b) / this.m;
8100 			// test that the X value is in the line's range.
8101 			if (xInt >= x && xInt <= (x + w)) results.push([ xInt, (this.m * xInt) + this.b ]);
8102 		
8103 			// try left face
8104 			var yInt = (this.m * x) + this.b;
8105 			if (yInt >= y && yInt <= (y + h)) results.push([ (yInt - this.b) / this.m, yInt ]);
8106 
8107 			if (results.length == 2) {
8108 				var midx = (results[0][0] + results[1][0]) / 2, midy = (results[0][1] + results[1][1]) / 2;
8109 				results.push([ midx,midy ]);
8110 				// now calculate the segment inside the rectangle where the midpoint lies.
8111 				var xseg = midx <= x + (w / 2) ? -1 : 1,
8112 					yseg = midy <= y + (h / 2) ? -1 : 1;
8113 				results.push([xseg, yseg]);
8114 				return results;
8115 			}
8116 		
8117 			return null;
8118 
8119 		};
8120 	},
8121 	_segment = function(x1, y1, x2, y2) {
8122 		if (x1 <= x2 && y2 <= y1) return 1;
8123 		else if (x1 <= x2 && y1 <= y2) return 2;
8124 		else if (x2 <= x1 && y2 >= y1) return 3;
8125 		return 4;
8126 	},
8127 		
8128 		// the control point we will use depends on the faces to which each end of the connection is assigned, specifically whether or not the
8129 		// two faces are parallel or perpendicular.  if they are parallel then the control point lies on the midpoint of the axis in which they
8130 		// are parellel and varies only in the other axis; this variation is proportional to the distance that the anchor points lie from the
8131 		// center of that face.  if the two faces are perpendicular then the control point is at some distance from both the midpoints; the amount and
8132 		// direction are dependent on the orientation of the two elements. 'seg', passed in to this method, tells you which segment the target element
8133 		// lies in with respect to the source: 1 is top right, 2 is bottom right, 3 is bottom left, 4 is top left.
8134 		//
8135 		// sourcePos and targetPos are arrays of info about where on the source and target each anchor is located.  their contents are:
8136 		//
8137 		// 0 - absolute x
8138 		// 1 - absolute y
8139 		// 2 - proportional x in element (0 is left edge, 1 is right edge)
8140 		// 3 - proportional y in element (0 is top edge, 1 is bottom edge)
8141 		// 	
8142 	_findControlPoint = function(midx, midy, segment, sourceEdge, targetEdge, dx, dy, distance, proximityLimit) {
8143 
8144         // TODO (maybe)
8145         // - if anchor pos is 0.5, make the control point take into account the relative position of the elements.
8146         if (distance <= proximityLimit) return [midx, midy];
8147 
8148         if (segment == 1) {
8149             if (sourceEdge[3] <= 0 && targetEdge[3] >= 1) return [ midx + (sourceEdge[2] < 0.5 ? -1 * dx : dx), midy ];
8150             else if (sourceEdge[2] >= 1 && targetEdge[2] <= 0) return [ midx, midy + (sourceEdge[3] < 0.5 ? -1 * dy : dy) ];
8151             else return [ midx + (-1 * dx) , midy + (-1 * dy) ];
8152         }
8153         else if (segment == 2) {
8154             if (sourceEdge[3] >= 1 && targetEdge[3] <= 0) return [ midx + (sourceEdge[2] < 0.5 ? -1 * dx : dx), midy ];
8155             else if (sourceEdge[2] >= 1 && targetEdge[2] <= 0) return [ midx, midy + (sourceEdge[3] < 0.5 ? -1 * dy : dy) ];
8156             else return [ midx + (1 * dx) , midy + (-1 * dy) ];
8157         }
8158         else if (segment == 3) {
8159             if (sourceEdge[3] >= 1 && targetEdge[3] <= 0) return [ midx + (sourceEdge[2] < 0.5 ? -1 * dx : dx), midy ];
8160             else if (sourceEdge[2] <= 0 && targetEdge[2] >= 1) return [ midx, midy + (sourceEdge[3] < 0.5 ? -1 * dy : dy) ];
8161             else return [ midx + (-1 * dx) , midy + (-1 * dy) ];
8162         }
8163         else if (segment == 4) {
8164             if (sourceEdge[3] <= 0 && targetEdge[3] >= 1) return [ midx + (sourceEdge[2] < 0.5 ? -1 * dx : dx), midy ];
8165             else if (sourceEdge[2] <= 0 && targetEdge[2] >= 1) return [ midx, midy + (sourceEdge[3] < 0.5 ? -1 * dy : dy) ];
8166             else return [ midx + (1 * dx) , midy + (-1 * dy) ];
8167         }
8168 	};
8169 
8170 	/**
8171      * Class: Connectors.StateMachine
8172      * Provides 'state machine' connectors.
8173      */
8174 	/*
8175 	 * Function: Constructor
8176 	 * 
8177 	 * Parameters:
8178 	 * curviness -	measure of how "curvy" the connectors will be.  this is translated as the distance that the
8179      *                Bezier curve's control point is from the midpoint of the straight line connecting the two
8180      *              endpoints, and does not mean that the connector is this wide.  The Bezier curve never reaches
8181      *              its control points; they act as gravitational masses. defaults to 10.
8182 	 * margin	-	distance from element to start and end connectors, in pixels.  defaults to 5.
8183 	 * proximityLimit  -   sets the distance beneath which the elements are consider too close together to bother
8184 	 *						with fancy curves. by default this is 80 pixels.
8185 	 * loopbackRadius	-	the radius of a loopback connector.  optional; defaults to 25.
8186 	 * showLoopback   -   If set to false this tells the connector that it is ok to paint connections whose source and target is the same element with a connector running through the element. The default value for this is true; the connector always makes a loopback connection loop around the element rather than passing through it.
8187 	*/
8188 	jsPlumb.Connectors.StateMachine = function(params) {
8189 		var self = this,
8190 		currentPoints = null,
8191 		_sx, _sy, _tx, _ty, _controlPoint = [],
8192 		curviness = params.curviness || 10,
8193 		margin = params.margin || 5,
8194 		proximityLimit = params.proximityLimit || 80,
8195 		clockwise = params.orientation && params.orientation == "clockwise",
8196 		loopbackRadius = params.loopbackRadius || 25,
8197 		isLoopback = false,
8198 		showLoopback = params.showLoopback !== false;
8199 
8200 		this.type = "StateMachine";
8201 		params = params || {};		
8202 		
8203 		this.compute = function(sourcePos, targetPos, sourceEndpoint, targetEndpoint, sourceAnchor, targetAnchor, lineWidth, minWidth) {
8204 
8205 			var w = Math.abs(sourcePos[0] - targetPos[0]),
8206    	 	       	h = Math.abs(sourcePos[1] - targetPos[1]),
8207 	   	     	// these are padding to ensure the whole connector line appears
8208    	   	   		xo = 0.45 * w, yo = 0.45 * h;
8209    		   		// these are padding to ensure the whole connector line appears
8210             	w *= 1.9; h *= 1.9;
8211                 //ensure at least one pixel width
8212                 lineWidth = lineWidth || 1;
8213             	var x = Math.min(sourcePos[0], targetPos[0]) - xo,
8214         		    y = Math.min(sourcePos[1], targetPos[1]) - yo;
8215 		
8216 			if (!showLoopback || (sourceEndpoint.elementId != targetEndpoint.elementId)) {
8217                             
8218                 isLoopback = false;
8219                             
8220         		_sx = sourcePos[0] < targetPos[0] ?  xo : w-xo;
8221             	_sy = sourcePos[1] < targetPos[1] ? yo:h-yo;
8222             	_tx = sourcePos[0] < targetPos[0] ? w-xo : xo;
8223             	_ty = sourcePos[1] < targetPos[1] ? h-yo : yo;
8224             
8225             	// now adjust for the margin
8226             	if (sourcePos[2] == 0) _sx -= margin;
8227             	if (sourcePos[2] == 1) _sx += margin;
8228             	if (sourcePos[3] == 0) _sy -= margin;
8229             	if (sourcePos[3] == 1) _sy += margin;
8230             	if (targetPos[2] == 0) _tx -= margin;
8231             	if (targetPos[2] == 1) _tx += margin;
8232             	if (targetPos[3] == 0) _ty -= margin;
8233             	if (targetPos[3] == 1) _ty += margin;
8234 
8235             	//
8236 	            // these connectors are quadratic bezier curves, having a single control point. if both anchors 
8237     	        // are located at 0.5 on their respective faces, the control point is set to the midpoint and you
8238         	    // get a straight line.  this is also the case if the two anchors are within 'proximityLimit', since
8239            	 	// it seems to make good aesthetic sense to do that. outside of that, the control point is positioned 
8240            	 	// at 'curviness' pixels away along the normal to the straight line connecting the two anchors.
8241 	            // 
8242    	        	// there may be two improvements to this.  firstly, we might actually support the notion of avoiding nodes
8243             	// in the UI, or at least making a good effort at doing so.  if a connection would pass underneath some node,
8244             	// for example, we might increase the distance the control point is away from the midpoint in a bid to
8245             	// steer it around that node.  this will work within limits, but i think those limits would also be the likely
8246             	// limits for, once again, aesthetic good sense in the layout of a chart using these connectors.
8247             	//
8248             	// the second possible change is actually two possible changes: firstly, it is possible we should gradually
8249             	// decrease the 'curviness' as the distance between the anchors decreases; start tailing it off to 0 at some
8250             	// point (which should be configurable).  secondly, we might slightly increase the 'curviness' for connectors
8251             	// with respect to how far their anchor is from the center of its respective face. this could either look cool,
8252             	// or stupid, and may indeed work only in a way that is so subtle as to have been a waste of time.
8253             	//
8254 
8255 				var _midx = (_sx + _tx) / 2, _midy = (_sy + _ty) / 2, 
8256             	    m2 = (-1 * _midx) / _midy, theta2 = Math.atan(m2),
8257             	    dy =  (m2 == Infinity || m2 == -Infinity) ? 0 : Math.abs(curviness / 2 * Math.sin(theta2)),
8258 				    dx =  (m2 == Infinity || m2 == -Infinity) ? 0 : Math.abs(curviness / 2 * Math.cos(theta2)),
8259 				    segment = _segment(_sx, _sy, _tx, _ty),
8260 				    distance = Math.sqrt(Math.pow(_tx - _sx, 2) + Math.pow(_ty - _sy, 2));
8261 			
8262             	// calculate the control point.  this code will be where we'll put in a rudimentary element avoidance scheme; it
8263             	// will work by extending the control point to force the curve to be, um, curvier.
8264 				_controlPoint = _findControlPoint(_midx,
8265                                                   _midy,
8266                                                   segment,
8267                                                   sourcePos,
8268                                                   targetPos,
8269                                                   curviness, curviness,
8270                                                   distance,
8271                                                   proximityLimit);
8272 
8273 	            	
8274             	var requiredWidth = Math.max(Math.abs(_controlPoint[0] - _sx) * 3, Math.abs(_controlPoint[0] - _tx) * 3, Math.abs(_tx-_sx), 2 * lineWidth, minWidth),
8275             		requiredHeight = Math.max(Math.abs(_controlPoint[1] - _sy) * 3, Math.abs(_controlPoint[1] - _ty) * 3, Math.abs(_ty-_sy), 2 * lineWidth, minWidth);
8276 
8277             	if (w < requiredWidth) {      	
8278             		var dw = requiredWidth - w;            		
8279             		x -= (dw / 2);
8280             		_sx += (dw / 2);
8281             		_tx  += (dw / 2);
8282             		w = requiredWidth;
8283                     _controlPoint[0] += (dw / 2);
8284             	}
8285             	
8286             	if (h < requiredHeight) {
8287             		var dh = requiredHeight - h;
8288             		y -= (dh / 2);
8289             		_sy += (dh / 2);
8290             		_ty += (dh / 2);
8291             		h = requiredHeight;
8292                     _controlPoint[1] += (dh / 2);
8293             	}
8294             	currentPoints = [ x, y, w, h, _sx, _sy, _tx, _ty, _controlPoint[0], _controlPoint[1] ];                                        
8295             }
8296             else {
8297             	isLoopback = true;
8298             	// a loopback connector.  draw an arc from one anchor to the other.
8299             	// i guess we'll do this the same way as the others.  just the control point will be a fair distance away.
8300         		var x1 = sourcePos[0], x2 = sourcePos[0], y1 = sourcePos[1] - margin, y2 = sourcePos[1] - margin, 				
8301 					cx = x1, cy = y1 - loopbackRadius;
8302 				
8303 				// canvas sizing stuff, to ensure the whole painted area is visible.
8304 				w = ((2 * lineWidth) + (4 * loopbackRadius)), h = ((2 * lineWidth) + (4 * loopbackRadius));
8305 				x = cx - loopbackRadius - lineWidth - loopbackRadius, y = cy - loopbackRadius - lineWidth - loopbackRadius;
8306 				currentPoints = [ x, y, w, h, cx-x, cy-y, loopbackRadius, clockwise, x1-x, y1-y, x2-x, y2-y];
8307             }
8308                 
8309             return currentPoints;
8310         };
8311         
8312         var _makeCurve = function() {
8313         	return [	
8314 	        	{ x:_tx, y:_ty },
8315 	        	{ x:_controlPoint[0], y:_controlPoint[1] },
8316 	        	{ x:_controlPoint[0] + 1, y:_controlPoint[1] + 1},	        	
8317 	        	{ x:_sx, y:_sy }
8318          	];
8319         };     
8320 
8321         var _translateLocation = function(curve, location, absolute) {
8322             if (absolute)
8323                 location = jsBezier.locationAlongCurveFrom(curve, location > 0 ? 0 : 1, location);
8324 
8325             return location;
8326         };
8327         
8328         /**
8329          * returns the point on the connector's path that is 'location' along the length of the path, where 'location' is a decimal from
8330          * 0 to 1 inclusive. for the straight line connector this is simple maths.  for Bezier, not so much.
8331          */
8332         this.pointOnPath = function(location, absolute) {   
8333 			if (isLoopback) {
8334 				if (absolute) {
8335 					var circumference = Math.PI * 2 * loopbackRadius;
8336 					location = location / circumference;
8337 				}
8338 
8339                 if (location > 0 && location < 1) location = 1 - location;
8340                 
8341 // current points are [ x, y, width, height, center x, center y, radius, clockwise, startx, starty, endx, endy ]				
8342 				// so the path length is the circumference of the circle
8343 				//var len = 2 * Math.PI * currentPoints[6],
8344 				// map 'location' to an angle. 0 is PI/2 when the connector is on the top face; if we
8345 				// support other faces it will have to be calculated for each one. 1 is also PI/2.
8346 				// 0.5 is -PI/2.
8347 				var startAngle = (location * 2 * Math.PI) + (Math.PI / 2),
8348 					startX = currentPoints[4] + (currentPoints[6] * Math.cos(startAngle)),
8349 					startY = currentPoints[5] + (currentPoints[6] * Math.sin(startAngle));					
8350 
8351                 return {x:startX, y:startY};
8352 					
8353 			}
8354         	else {
8355         		var c = _makeCurve();
8356         		location = _translateLocation(c, location, absolute);
8357 	        	return jsBezier.pointOnCurve(c, location);
8358 	        }
8359         };
8360         
8361         /**
8362          * returns the gradient of the connector at the given point.
8363          */
8364         this.gradientAtPoint = function(location, absolute) {
8365 			if (isLoopback) {
8366 				// todo if absolute, location is a proportion of circumference
8367 				if (absolute) {
8368 					var circumference = Math.PI * 2 * loopbackRadius;
8369 					location = location / circumference;
8370 				}
8371 
8372 				return Math.atan(location * 2 * Math.PI);
8373 			}
8374         	else {
8375         		var c = _makeCurve();
8376         		location = _translateLocation(c, location, absolute);
8377                 return jsBezier.gradientAtPoint(c, location);
8378             }
8379         };	        
8380         
8381         /**
8382          * for Bezier curves this method is a little tricky, cos calculating path distance algebraically is notoriously difficult.
8383          * this method is iterative, jumping forward .05% of the path at a time and summing the distance between this point and the previous
8384          * one, until the sum reaches 'distance'. the method may turn out to be computationally expensive; we'll see.
8385          * another drawback of this method is that if the connector gets quite long, .05% of the length of it is not necessarily smaller
8386          * than the desired distance, in which case the loop returns immediately and the arrow is mis-shapen. so a better strategy might be to
8387          * calculate the step as a function of distance/distance between endpoints.  
8388          */
8389         this.pointAlongPathFrom = function(location, distance, absolute) {        	
8390 			if (isLoopback) {
8391 
8392 				if (absolute) {
8393 					var circumference = Math.PI * 2 * loopbackRadius;
8394 					location = location / circumference;
8395 				}
8396 
8397                 if (location > 0 && location < 1) location = 1 - location;
8398 
8399 				var circumference = 2 * Math.PI * currentPoints[6],
8400 					arcSpan = distance / circumference * 2 * Math.PI,
8401 					startAngle = (location * 2 * Math.PI) - arcSpan + (Math.PI / 2),	
8402 					
8403 					startX = currentPoints[4] + (currentPoints[6] * Math.cos(startAngle)),
8404 					startY = currentPoints[5] + (currentPoints[6] * Math.sin(startAngle));	
8405 
8406 				return {x:startX, y:startY};
8407 			}
8408 			else {
8409 				var c = _makeCurve();
8410         		location = _translateLocation(c, location, absolute);
8411         		return jsBezier.pointAlongCurveFrom(c, location, distance);
8412         	}
8413         };                       
8414 	
8415 	};
8416 	
8417 	/*
8418      * Canvas state machine renderer. 
8419      */
8420     jsPlumb.Connectors.canvas.StateMachine = function(params) {   	 
8421     	params = params || {};
8422 		var self = this, drawGuideline = params.drawGuideline || true, avoidSelector = params.avoidSelector;
8423 		jsPlumb.Connectors.StateMachine.apply(this, arguments);
8424 		jsPlumb.CanvasConnector.apply(this, arguments);
8425 	
8426 		
8427 		this._paint = function(dimensions) {
8428 			
8429 			if (dimensions.length == 10) {
8430 		        self.ctx.beginPath();
8431 				self.ctx.moveTo(dimensions[4], dimensions[5]);
8432 				self.ctx.bezierCurveTo(dimensions[8], dimensions[9], dimensions[8], dimensions[9], dimensions[6], dimensions[7]);
8433 				self.ctx.stroke();            				
8434 			}
8435 			else {
8436 				// a loopback connector
8437 				self.ctx.save();
8438 				self.ctx.beginPath();        	
8439 	        	var startAngle = 0,                     // Starting point on circle
8440 	        	endAngle   = 2 * Math.PI, // End point on circle
8441 	        	clockwise  = dimensions[7]; // clockwise or anticlockwise 
8442 	        	self.ctx.arc(dimensions[4],dimensions[5],dimensions[6],0, endAngle, clockwise);
8443 				self.ctx.stroke();
8444 				self.ctx.closePath();
8445 				self.ctx.restore();
8446 			}
8447 	    };	    
8448 	    
8449 	    this.createGradient = function(dim, ctx) {
8450         	return ctx.createLinearGradient(dim[4], dim[5], dim[6], dim[7]);
8451         };
8452     };
8453     
8454     /*
8455      * SVG State Machine renderer
8456      */
8457     jsPlumb.Connectors.svg.StateMachine = function() {   	 
8458 		var self = this;
8459 		jsPlumb.Connectors.StateMachine.apply(this, arguments);
8460 		jsPlumb.SvgConnector.apply(this, arguments);
8461 		this.getPath = function(d) { 	
8462 				
8463 			if (d.length == 10) 
8464 				return "M " + d[4] + " " + d[5] + " C " + d[8] + " " + d[9] + " " + d[8] + " " + d[9] + " " + d[6] + " " + d[7]; 
8465 			else {
8466 				// loopback
8467 				return "M" + (d[8] + 4) + " " + d[9] + " A " + d[6] + " " + d[6] + " 0 1,0 " + (d[8]-4) + " " + d[9];			
8468 			}
8469 		};	    	    
8470     };
8471     
8472     /*
8473      * VML state machine renderer
8474      */
8475     jsPlumb.Connectors.vml.StateMachine = function() {
8476 		jsPlumb.Connectors.StateMachine.apply(this, arguments);	
8477 		jsPlumb.VmlConnector.apply(this, arguments);
8478 		var _conv = jsPlumb.vml.convertValue;
8479 		this.getPath = function(d) {	
8480 			if (d.length == 10) {
8481 				return "m" + _conv(d[4]) + "," + _conv(d[5]) + 
8482 					   " c" + _conv(d[8]) + "," + _conv(d[9]) + "," + _conv(d[8]) + "," + _conv(d[9]) + "," + _conv(d[6]) + "," + _conv(d[7]) + " e";
8483 			}
8484 			else {
8485 				// loopback
8486 				var left = _conv(d[8] - d[6]),
8487 					top = _conv(d[9] - (2 * d[6])),
8488 					right = left + _conv(2 * d[6]),
8489 					bottom = top + _conv(2 * d[6]),
8490 					posString = left + "," + top + "," + right + "," + bottom;
8491 					
8492 				var o = "ar " + posString + "," + _conv(d[8]) + ","
8493 						+ _conv(d[9]) + "," + _conv(d[8]) + "," + _conv(d[9]) + " e";
8494 				
8495 				 return o;
8496 			}
8497 		};
8498 	};
8499 
8500 })();
8501 
8502 /*
8503     	// now for a rudimentary avoidance scheme. TODO: how to set this in a cross-library way?
8504         //      if (avoidSelector) {
8505 		//		    var testLine = new Line(sourcePos[0] + _sx,sourcePos[1] + _sy,sourcePos[0] + _tx,sourcePos[1] + _ty);
8506 		//		    var sel = jsPlumb.getSelector(avoidSelector);
8507 		//		    for (var i = 0; i < sel.length; i++) {
8508 		//			    var id = jsPlumb.getId(sel[i]);
8509 		//			    if (id != sourceEndpoint.elementId && id != targetEndpoint.elementId) {
8510 		//				    o = jsPlumb.getOffset(id), s = jsPlumb.getSize(id);
8511 //
8512 //						    if (o && s) {
8513 //							    var collision = testLine.rectIntersect(o.left,o.top,s[0],s[1]);
8514 //							    if (collision) {
8515 								    // set the control point to be a certain distance from the midpoint of the two points that
8516 								    // the line crosses on the rectangle.
8517 								    // TODO where will this 75 number come from?
8518 					//			    _controlX = collision[2][0] + (75 * collision[3][0]);
8519 				//	/			    _controlY = collision[2][1] + (75 * collision[3][1]);
8520 //							    }
8521 //						    }
8522 					//  }
8523 	//			    }
8524               //}
8525     *//*
8526  * jsPlumb
8527  * 
8528  * Title:jsPlumb 1.3.15
8529  * 
8530  * Provides a way to visually connect elements on an HTML page, using either SVG, Canvas
8531  * elements, or VML.  
8532  * 
8533  * This file contains the VML renderers.
8534  *
8535  * Copyright (c) 2010 - 2012 Simon Porritt (http://jsplumb.org)
8536  * 
8537  * http://jsplumb.org
8538  * http://github.com/sporritt/jsplumb
8539  * http://code.google.com/p/jsplumb
8540  * 
8541  * Dual licensed under the MIT and GPL2 licenses.
8542  */
8543 
8544 ;(function() {
8545 	
8546 	// http://ajaxian.com/archives/the-vml-changes-in-ie-8
8547 	// http://www.nczonline.net/blog/2010/01/19/internet-explorer-8-document-and-browser-modes/
8548 	// http://www.louisremi.com/2009/03/30/changes-in-vml-for-ie8-or-what-feature-can-the-ie-dev-team-break-for-you-today/
8549 	
8550 	var vmlAttributeMap = {
8551 		"stroke-linejoin":"joinstyle",
8552 		"joinstyle":"joinstyle",		
8553 		"endcap":"endcap",
8554 		"miterlimit":"miterlimit"
8555 	},
8556 	jsPlumbStylesheet = null;
8557 	
8558 	if (document.createStyleSheet && document.namespaces) {			
8559 		
8560 		var ruleClasses = [
8561 				".jsplumb_vml", "jsplumb\\:textbox", "jsplumb\\:oval", "jsplumb\\:rect", 
8562 				"jsplumb\\:stroke", "jsplumb\\:shape", "jsplumb\\:group"
8563 			],
8564 			rule = "behavior:url(#default#VML);position:absolute;";
8565 
8566 		jsPlumbStylesheet = document.createStyleSheet();
8567 
8568 		for (var i = 0; i < ruleClasses.length; i++)
8569 			jsPlumbStylesheet.addRule(ruleClasses[i], rule);
8570 
8571 		// in this page it is also mentioned that IE requires the extra arg to the namespace
8572 		// http://www.louisremi.com/2009/03/30/changes-in-vml-for-ie8-or-what-feature-can-the-ie-dev-team-break-for-you-today/
8573 		// but someone commented saying they didn't need it, and it seems jsPlumb doesnt need it either.
8574 		// var iev = document.documentMode;
8575 		//if (!iev || iev < 8)
8576 			document.namespaces.add("jsplumb", "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:vml");
8577 		//else
8578 		//	document.namespaces.add("jsplumb", "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:vml", "#default#VML");
8579 	}
8580 	
8581 	jsPlumb.vml = {};
8582 	
8583 	var scale = 1000,
8584 
8585     _groupMap = {},
8586     _getGroup = function(container, connectorClass) {
8587         var id = jsPlumb.getId(container),
8588             g = _groupMap[id];
8589         if(!g) {
8590             g = _node("group", [0,0,scale, scale], {"class":connectorClass});
8591             //g.style.position=absolute;
8592             //g["coordsize"] = "1000,1000";
8593             g.style.backgroundColor="red";
8594             _groupMap[id] = g;
8595             jsPlumb.appendElement(g, container);  // todo if this gets reinstated, remember to use the current jsplumb instance.
8596             //document.body.appendChild(g);
8597         }
8598         return g;
8599     },
8600 	_atts = function(o, atts) {
8601 		for (var i in atts) { 
8602 			// IE8 fix: setattribute does not work after an element has been added to the dom!
8603 			// http://www.louisremi.com/2009/03/30/changes-in-vml-for-ie8-or-what-feature-can-the-ie-dev-team-break-for-you-today/
8604 			//o.setAttribute(i, atts[i]);
8605 
8606 			/*There is an additional problem when accessing VML elements by using get/setAttribute. The simple solution is following:
8607 
8608 			if (document.documentMode==8) {
8609 			ele.opacity=1;
8610 			} else {
8611 			ele.setAttribute(opacity,1);
8612 			}
8613 			*/
8614 
8615 			o[i] = atts[i];
8616 		}
8617 	},
8618 	_node = function(name, d, atts, parent, _jsPlumb, deferToJsPlumbContainer) {
8619 		atts = atts || {};
8620 		var o = document.createElement("jsplumb:" + name);
8621 		if (deferToJsPlumbContainer)
8622 			_jsPlumb.appendElement(o, parent);
8623 		else
8624 			jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.appendElement(o, parent);
8625 		o.className = (atts["class"] ? atts["class"] + " " : "") + "jsplumb_vml";
8626 		_pos(o, d);
8627 		_atts(o, atts);
8628 		return o;
8629 	},
8630 	_pos = function(o,d, zIndex) {
8631 		o.style.left = d[0] + "px";		
8632 		o.style.top =  d[1] + "px";
8633 		o.style.width= d[2] + "px";
8634 		o.style.height= d[3] + "px";
8635 		o.style.position = "absolute";
8636 		if (zIndex)
8637 			o.style.zIndex = zIndex;
8638 	},
8639 	_conv = jsPlumb.vml.convertValue = function(v) {
8640 		return Math.floor(v * scale);
8641 	},	
8642 	// tests if the given style is "transparent" and then sets the appropriate opacity node to 0 if so,
8643 	// or 1 if not.  TODO in the future, support variable opacity.
8644 	_maybeSetOpacity = function(styleToWrite, styleToCheck, type, component) {
8645 		if ("transparent" === styleToCheck)
8646 			component.setOpacity(type, "0.0");
8647 		else
8648 			component.setOpacity(type, "1.0");
8649 	},
8650 	_applyStyles = function(node, style, component, _jsPlumb) {
8651 		var styleToWrite = {};
8652 		if (style.strokeStyle) {
8653 			styleToWrite["stroked"] = "true";
8654 			var strokeColor = jsPlumbUtil.convertStyle(style.strokeStyle, true);
8655 			styleToWrite["strokecolor"] = strokeColor;
8656 			_maybeSetOpacity(styleToWrite, strokeColor, "stroke", component);
8657 			styleToWrite["strokeweight"] = style.lineWidth + "px";
8658 		}
8659 		else styleToWrite["stroked"] = "false";
8660 		
8661 		if (style.fillStyle) {
8662 			styleToWrite["filled"] = "true";
8663 			var fillColor = jsPlumbUtil.convertStyle(style.fillStyle, true);
8664 			styleToWrite["fillcolor"] = fillColor;
8665 			_maybeSetOpacity(styleToWrite, fillColor, "fill", component);
8666 		}
8667 		else styleToWrite["filled"] = "false";
8668 		
8669 		if(style["dashstyle"]) {
8670 			if (component.strokeNode == null) {
8671 				component.strokeNode = _node("stroke", [0,0,0,0], { dashstyle:style["dashstyle"] }, node, _jsPlumb);				
8672 			}
8673 			else
8674 				component.strokeNode.dashstyle = style["dashstyle"];
8675 		}					
8676 		else if (style["stroke-dasharray"] && style["lineWidth"]) {
8677 			var sep = style["stroke-dasharray"].indexOf(",") == -1 ? " " : ",",
8678 			parts = style["stroke-dasharray"].split(sep),
8679 			styleToUse = "";
8680 			for(var i = 0; i < parts.length; i++) {
8681 				styleToUse += (Math.floor(parts[i] / style.lineWidth) + sep);
8682 			}
8683 			if (component.strokeNode == null) {
8684 				component.strokeNode = _node("stroke", [0,0,0,0], { dashstyle:styleToUse }, node, _jsPlumb);				
8685 			}
8686 			else
8687 				component.strokeNode.dashstyle = styleToUse;
8688 		}
8689 		
8690 		_atts(node, styleToWrite);
8691 	},
8692 	/*
8693 	 * Base class for Vml endpoints and connectors. Extends jsPlumbUIComponent. 
8694 	 */
8695 	VmlComponent = function() {				
8696 		var self = this;		
8697 		jsPlumb.jsPlumbUIComponent.apply(this, arguments);		
8698 		this.opacityNodes = {
8699 			"stroke":null,
8700 			"fill":null
8701 		};
8702 		this.initOpacityNodes = function(vml) {
8703 			self.opacityNodes["stroke"] = _node("stroke", [0,0,1,1], {opacity:"0.0"}, vml, self._jsPlumb);
8704 			self.opacityNodes["fill"] = _node("fill", [0,0,1,1], {opacity:"0.0"}, vml, self._jsPlumb);							
8705 		};
8706 		this.setOpacity = function(type, value) {
8707 			var node = self.opacityNodes[type];
8708 			if (node) node["opacity"] = "" + value;
8709 		};
8710 		var displayElements = [ ];
8711 		this.getDisplayElements = function() { 
8712 			return displayElements; 
8713 		};
8714 		
8715 		this.appendDisplayElement = function(el, doNotAppendToCanvas) {
8716 			if (!doNotAppendToCanvas) self.canvas.parentNode.appendChild(el);
8717 			displayElements.push(el);
8718 		};
8719 	},	
8720 	/*
8721 	 * Base class for Vml connectors. extends VmlComponent.
8722 	 */
8723 	VmlConnector = jsPlumb.VmlConnector = function(params) {
8724 		var self = this;
8725 		self.strokeNode = null;
8726 		self.canvas = null;
8727 		VmlComponent.apply(this, arguments);
8728 		var clazz = self._jsPlumb.connectorClass + (params.cssClass ? (" " + params.cssClass) : "");
8729 		this.paint = function(d, style, anchor) {
8730 			if (style != null) {				
8731 				var path = self.getPath(d), p = { "path":path };				
8732 
8733                 //*
8734 				if (style.outlineColor) {
8735 					var outlineWidth = style.outlineWidth || 1,
8736 					outlineStrokeWidth = style.lineWidth + (2 * outlineWidth),
8737 					outlineStyle = {
8738 						strokeStyle : jsPlumbUtil.convertStyle(style.outlineColor),
8739 						lineWidth : outlineStrokeWidth
8740 					};
