8741 					for (var aa in vmlAttributeMap) outlineStyle[aa] = style[aa];
8742 					
8743 					if (self.bgCanvas == null) {						
8744 						p["class"] = clazz;
8745 						p["coordsize"] = (d[2] * scale) + "," + (d[3] * scale);
8746 						self.bgCanvas = _node("shape", d, p, params.parent, self._jsPlumb, true);						
8747 						_pos(self.bgCanvas, d, self.getZIndex());
8748 						self.appendDisplayElement(self.bgCanvas, true);	
8749 						self.attachListeners(self.bgCanvas, self);					
8750 						self.initOpacityNodes(self.bgCanvas, ["stroke"]);		
8751 					}
8752 					else {
8753 						p["coordsize"] = (d[2] * scale) + "," + (d[3] * scale);
8754 						_pos(self.bgCanvas, d, self.getZIndex());
8755 						_atts(self.bgCanvas, p);
8756 					}
8757 					
8758 					_applyStyles(self.bgCanvas, outlineStyle, self);
8759 				}
8760 				//*/
8761 				
8762 				if (self.canvas == null) {										
8763 					p["class"] = clazz;
8764 					p["coordsize"] = (d[2] * scale) + "," + (d[3] * scale);
8765 					if (self.tooltip) p["label"] = self.tooltip;
8766 					self.canvas = _node("shape", d, p, params.parent, self._jsPlumb, true);					                
8767                     //var group = _getGroup(params.parent);                   // test of append everything to a group
8768                     //group.appendChild(self.canvas);                           // sort of works but not exactly;
8769 					//params["_jsPlumb"].appendElement(self.canvas, params.parent);    //before introduction of groups
8770 
8771 					self.appendDisplayElement(self.canvas, true);										
8772 					self.attachListeners(self.canvas, self);					
8773 					self.initOpacityNodes(self.canvas, ["stroke"]);		
8774 				}
8775 				else {
8776 					p["coordsize"] = (d[2] * scale) + "," + (d[3] * scale);
8777 					_pos(self.canvas, d, self.getZIndex());
8778 					_atts(self.canvas, p);
8779 				}
8780 				
8781 				_applyStyles(self.canvas, style, self, self._jsPlumb);
8782 			}
8783 		};
8784 		
8785 		//self.appendDisplayElement(self.canvas);
8786 		
8787 		this.reattachListeners = function() {
8788 			if (self.canvas) self.reattachListenersForElement(self.canvas, self);
8789 		};
8790 	},		
8791 	/*
8792 	 * 
8793 	 * Base class for Vml Endpoints. extends VmlComponent.
8794 	 * 
8795 	 */
8796 	VmlEndpoint = window.VmlEndpoint = function(params) {
8797 		VmlComponent.apply(this, arguments);
8798 		var vml = null, self = this, opacityStrokeNode = null, opacityFillNode = null;
8799 		self.canvas = document.createElement("div");
8800 		self.canvas.style["position"] = "absolute";
8801 
8802 		var clazz = self._jsPlumb.endpointClass + (params.cssClass ? (" " + params.cssClass) : "");
8803 
8804 		//var group = _getGroup(params.parent);
8805         //group.appendChild(self.canvas);
8806 		params["_jsPlumb"].appendElement(self.canvas, params.parent);
8807 
8808         if (self.tooltip) self.canvas.setAttribute("label", self.tooltip);
8809 		
8810 		this.paint = function(d, style, anchor) {
8811 			var p = { };					
8812 			
8813 			jsPlumb.sizeCanvas(self.canvas, d[0], d[1], d[2], d[3]);
8814 			if (vml == null) {
8815 				p["class"] = clazz;
8816 				vml = self.getVml([0,0, d[2], d[3]], p, anchor, self.canvas, self._jsPlumb);				
8817 				self.attachListeners(vml, self);
8818 
8819 				self.appendDisplayElement(vml, true);
8820 				self.appendDisplayElement(self.canvas, true);
8821 				
8822 				self.initOpacityNodes(vml, ["fill"]);			
8823 			}
8824 			else {				
8825 				_pos(vml, [0,0, d[2], d[3]]);
8826 				_atts(vml, p);
8827 			}
8828 			
8829 			_applyStyles(vml, style, self);
8830 		};
8831 		
8832 		this.reattachListeners = function() {
8833 			if (vml) self.reattachListenersForElement(vml, self);
8834 		};
8835 	};
8836 	
8837 	jsPlumb.Connectors.vml.Bezier = function() {
8838 		jsPlumb.Connectors.Bezier.apply(this, arguments);	
8839 		VmlConnector.apply(this, arguments);
8840 		this.getPath = function(d) {			
8841 			return "m" + _conv(d[4]) + "," + _conv(d[5]) + 
8842 				   " c" + _conv(d[8]) + "," + _conv(d[9]) + "," + _conv(d[10]) + "," + _conv(d[11]) + "," + _conv(d[6]) + "," + _conv(d[7]) + " e";
8843 		};
8844 	};
8845 	
8846 	jsPlumb.Connectors.vml.Straight = function() {
8847 		jsPlumb.Connectors.Straight.apply(this, arguments);	
8848 		VmlConnector.apply(this, arguments);
8849 		this.getPath = function(d) {
8850 			return "m" + _conv(d[4]) + "," + _conv(d[5]) + " l" + _conv(d[6]) + "," + _conv(d[7]) + " e";
8851 		};
8852 	};
8853 	
8854 	jsPlumb.Connectors.vml.Flowchart = function() {
8855     	jsPlumb.Connectors.Flowchart.apply(this, arguments);
8856 		VmlConnector.apply(this, arguments);
8857     	this.getPath = function(dimensions) {
8858     		var p = "m " + _conv(dimensions[4]) + "," + _conv(dimensions[5]) + " l";
8859 	        // loop through extra points
8860 	        for (var i = 0; i < dimensions[8]; i++) {
8861 	        	p = p + " " + _conv(dimensions[9 + (i*2)]) + "," + _conv(dimensions[10 + (i*2)]);
8862 	        }
8863 	        // finally draw a line to the end
8864 	        p = p  + " " + _conv(dimensions[6]) + "," +  _conv(dimensions[7]) + " e";
8865 	        return p;
8866     	};
8867     };
8868 	
8869 	jsPlumb.Endpoints.vml.Dot = function() {
8870 		jsPlumb.Endpoints.Dot.apply(this, arguments);
8871 		VmlEndpoint.apply(this, arguments);
8872 		this.getVml = function(d, atts, anchor, parent, _jsPlumb) { return _node("oval", d, atts, parent, _jsPlumb); };
8873 	};
8874 	
8875 	jsPlumb.Endpoints.vml.Rectangle = function() {
8876 		jsPlumb.Endpoints.Rectangle.apply(this, arguments);
8877 		VmlEndpoint.apply(this, arguments);
8878 		this.getVml = function(d, atts, anchor, parent, _jsPlumb) { return _node("rect", d, atts, parent, _jsPlumb); };
8879 	};
8880 	
8881 	/*
8882 	 * VML Image Endpoint is the same as the default image endpoint.
8883 	 */
8884 	jsPlumb.Endpoints.vml.Image = jsPlumb.Endpoints.Image;
8885 	
8886 	/**
8887 	 * placeholder for Blank endpoint in vml renderer.
8888 	 */
8889 	jsPlumb.Endpoints.vml.Blank = jsPlumb.Endpoints.Blank;
8890 	
8891 	/**
8892 	 * VML Label renderer. uses the default label renderer (which adds an element to the DOM)
8893 	 */
8894 	jsPlumb.Overlays.vml.Label  = jsPlumb.Overlays.Label;
8895 	
8896 	/**
8897 	 * VML Custom renderer. uses the default Custom renderer (which adds an element to the DOM)
8898 	 */
8899 	jsPlumb.Overlays.vml.Custom = jsPlumb.Overlays.Custom;
8900 	
8901 	var AbstractVmlArrowOverlay = function(superclass, originalArgs) {
8902     	superclass.apply(this, originalArgs);
8903     	VmlComponent.apply(this, originalArgs);
8904     	var self = this, path = null;
8905     	self.canvas = null; 
8906     	self.isAppendedAtTopLevel = true;
8907     	var getPath = function(d, connectorDimensions) {    		
8908     		return "m " + _conv(d.hxy.x) + "," + _conv(d.hxy.y) +
8909     		       " l " + _conv(d.tail[0].x) + "," + _conv(d.tail[0].y) + 
8910     		       " " + _conv(d.cxy.x) + "," + _conv(d.cxy.y) + 
8911     		       " " + _conv(d.tail[1].x) + "," + _conv(d.tail[1].y) + 
8912     		       " x e";
8913     	};
8914     	this.paint = function(connector, d, lineWidth, strokeStyle, fillStyle, connectorDimensions) {
8915     		var p = {};
8916 			if (strokeStyle) {
8917 				p["stroked"] = "true";
8918 				p["strokecolor"] = jsPlumbUtil.convertStyle(strokeStyle, true);    				
8919 			}
8920 			if (lineWidth) p["strokeweight"] = lineWidth + "px";
8921 			if (fillStyle) {
8922 				p["filled"] = "true";
8923 				p["fillcolor"] = fillStyle;
8924 			}
8925 			var xmin = Math.min(d.hxy.x, d.tail[0].x, d.tail[1].x, d.cxy.x),
8926 			ymin = Math.min(d.hxy.y, d.tail[0].y, d.tail[1].y, d.cxy.y),
8927 			xmax = Math.max(d.hxy.x, d.tail[0].x, d.tail[1].x, d.cxy.x),
8928 			ymax = Math.max(d.hxy.y, d.tail[0].y, d.tail[1].y, d.cxy.y),
8929 			w = Math.abs(xmax - xmin),
8930 			h = Math.abs(ymax - ymin),
8931 			dim = [xmin, ymin, w, h];
8932 			
8933 			// for VML, we create overlays using shapes that have the same dimensions and
8934 			// coordsize as their connector - overlays calculate themselves relative to the
8935 			// connector (it's how it's been done since the original canvas implementation, because
8936 			// for canvas that makes sense).
8937 			p["path"] = getPath(d, connectorDimensions);
8938 			p["coordsize"] = (connectorDimensions[2] * scale) + "," + (connectorDimensions[3] * scale);
8939 			
8940 			dim[0] = connectorDimensions[0];
8941 			dim[1] = connectorDimensions[1];
8942 			dim[2] = connectorDimensions[2];
8943 			dim[3] = connectorDimensions[3];
8944 			
8945     		if (self.canvas == null) {
8946     			//p["class"] = jsPlumb.overlayClass; // TODO currentInstance?
8947 				self.canvas = _node("shape", dim, p, connector.canvas.parentNode, connector._jsPlumb, true);								
8948 				connector.appendDisplayElement(self.canvas, true);
8949 				self.attachListeners(self.canvas, connector);
8950 				self.attachListeners(self.canvas, self);
8951 			}
8952 			else {				
8953 				_pos(self.canvas, dim);
8954 				_atts(self.canvas, p);
8955 			}    		
8956     	};
8957     	
8958     	this.reattachListeners = function() {
8959 			if (self.canvas) self.reattachListenersForElement(self.canvas, self);
8960 		};
8961 
8962 		this.cleanup = function() {
8963     		if (self.canvas != null) jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.removeElement(self.canvas);
8964     	};
8965     };
8966 	
8967 	jsPlumb.Overlays.vml.Arrow = function() {
8968     	AbstractVmlArrowOverlay.apply(this, [jsPlumb.Overlays.Arrow, arguments]);    	
8969     };
8970     
8971     jsPlumb.Overlays.vml.PlainArrow = function() {
8972     	AbstractVmlArrowOverlay.apply(this, [jsPlumb.Overlays.PlainArrow, arguments]);    	
8973     };
8974     
8975     jsPlumb.Overlays.vml.Diamond = function() {
8976     	AbstractVmlArrowOverlay.apply(this, [jsPlumb.Overlays.Diamond, arguments]);    	
8977     };
8978 })();/*
8979  * jsPlumb
8980  * 
8981  * Title:jsPlumb 1.3.15
8982  * 
8983  * Provides a way to visually connect elements on an HTML page, using either SVG, Canvas
8984  * elements, or VML.  
8985  * 
8986  * This file contains the SVG renderers.
8987  *
8988  * Copyright (c) 2010 - 2012 Simon Porritt (http://jsplumb.org)
8989  * 
8990  * http://jsplumb.org
8991  * http://github.com/sporritt/jsplumb
8992  * http://code.google.com/p/jsplumb
8993  * 
8994  * Dual licensed under the MIT and GPL2 licenses.
8995  */
8996 
8997 /**
8998  * SVG support for jsPlumb.
8999  * 
9000  * things to investigate:
9001  * 
9002  * gradients:  https://developer.mozilla.org/en/svg_in_html_introduction
9003  * css:http://tutorials.jenkov.com/svg/svg-and-css.html
9004  * text on a path: http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG/text.html#TextOnAPath
9005  * pointer events: https://developer.mozilla.org/en/css/pointer-events
9006  *
9007  * IE9 hover jquery: http://forum.jquery.com/topic/1-6-2-broke-svg-hover-events
9008  *
9009  */
9010 ;(function() {
9011 	
9012 	var svgAttributeMap = {
9013 		"joinstyle":"stroke-linejoin",
9014 		"stroke-linejoin":"stroke-linejoin",		
9015 		"stroke-dashoffset":"stroke-dashoffset",
9016 		"stroke-linecap":"stroke-linecap"
9017 	},
9018 	STROKE_DASHARRAY = "stroke-dasharray",
9019 	DASHSTYLE = "dashstyle",
9020 	LINEAR_GRADIENT = "linearGradient",
9021 	RADIAL_GRADIENT = "radialGradient",
9022 	FILL = "fill",
9023 	STOP = "stop",
9024 	STROKE = "stroke",
9025 	STROKE_WIDTH = "stroke-width",
9026 	STYLE = "style",
9027 	NONE = "none",
9028 	JSPLUMB_GRADIENT = "jsplumb_gradient_",
9029 	LINE_WIDTH = "lineWidth",
9030 	ns = {
9031 		svg:"http://www.w3.org/2000/svg",
9032 		xhtml:"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"
9033 	},
9034 	_attr = function(node, attributes) {
9035 		for (var i in attributes)
9036 			node.setAttribute(i, "" + attributes[i]);
9037 	},	
9038 	_node = function(name, attributes) {
9039 		var n = document.createElementNS(ns.svg, name);
9040 		attributes = attributes || {};
9041 		attributes["version"] = "1.1";
9042 		attributes["xmlns"] = ns.xhtml;
9043 		_attr(n, attributes);
9044 		return n;
9045 	},
9046 	_pos = function(d) { return "position:absolute;left:" + d[0] + "px;top:" + d[1] + "px"; },	
9047 	_clearGradient = function(parent) {
9048 		for (var i = 0; i < parent.childNodes.length; i++) {
9049 			if (parent.childNodes[i].tagName == LINEAR_GRADIENT || parent.childNodes[i].tagName == RADIAL_GRADIENT)
9050 				parent.removeChild(parent.childNodes[i]);
9051 		}
9052 	},		
9053 	_updateGradient = function(parent, node, style, dimensions, uiComponent) {
9054 		var id = JSPLUMB_GRADIENT + uiComponent._jsPlumb.idstamp();
9055 		// first clear out any existing gradient
9056 		_clearGradient(parent);
9057 		// this checks for an 'offset' property in the gradient, and in the absence of it, assumes
9058 		// we want a linear gradient. if it's there, we create a radial gradient.
9059 		// it is possible that a more explicit means of defining the gradient type would be
9060 		// better. relying on 'offset' means that we can never have a radial gradient that uses
9061 		// some default offset, for instance.
9062 		// issue 244 suggested the 'gradientUnits' attribute; without this, straight/flowchart connectors with gradients would
9063 		// not show gradients when the line was perfectly horizontal or vertical.
9064 		if (!style.gradient.offset) {
9065 			var g = _node(LINEAR_GRADIENT, {id:id, gradientUnits:"userSpaceOnUse"});
9066 			parent.appendChild(g);
9067 		}
9068 		else {
9069 			var g = _node(RADIAL_GRADIENT, {
9070 				id:id
9071 			});
9072 			parent.appendChild(g);
9073 		}
9074 		
9075 		// the svg radial gradient seems to treat stops in the reverse 
9076 		// order to how canvas does it.  so we want to keep all the maths the same, but
9077 		// iterate the actual style declarations in reverse order, if the x indexes are not in order.
9078 		for (var i = 0; i < style.gradient.stops.length; i++) {
9079 			// Straight Connectors and Bezier connectors act slightly differently; this code is a bit of a kludge.  but next version of
9080 			// jsplumb will be replacing both Straight and Bezier to be generic instances of 'Connector', which has a list of segments.
9081 			// so, not too concerned about leaving this in for now.
9082 			var styleToUse = i;
9083 			if (dimensions.length == 8) 
9084 				styleToUse = dimensions[4] < dimensions[6] ? i: style.gradient.stops.length - 1 - i;
9085 			else
9086 				styleToUse = dimensions[4] < dimensions[6] ? style.gradient.stops.length - 1 - i : i;
9087 			var stopColor = jsPlumbUtil.convertStyle(style.gradient.stops[styleToUse][1], true);
9088 			var s = _node(STOP, {"offset":Math.floor(style.gradient.stops[i][0] * 100) + "%", "stop-color":stopColor});
9089 			g.appendChild(s);
9090 		}
9091 		var applyGradientTo = style.strokeStyle ? STROKE : FILL;
9092 		node.setAttribute(STYLE, applyGradientTo + ":url(#" + id + ")");
9093 	},
9094 	_applyStyles = function(parent, node, style, dimensions, uiComponent) {
9095 		
9096 		if (style.gradient) {
9097 			_updateGradient(parent, node, style, dimensions, uiComponent);			
9098 		}
9099 		else {
9100 			// make sure we clear any existing gradient
9101 			_clearGradient(parent);
9102 			node.setAttribute(STYLE, "");
9103 		}
9104 		
9105 		node.setAttribute(FILL, style.fillStyle ? jsPlumbUtil.convertStyle(style.fillStyle, true) : NONE);
9106 		node.setAttribute(STROKE, style.strokeStyle ? jsPlumbUtil.convertStyle(style.strokeStyle, true) : NONE);		
9107 		if (style.lineWidth) {
9108 			node.setAttribute(STROKE_WIDTH, style.lineWidth);
9109 		}
9110 	
9111 		// in SVG there is a stroke-dasharray attribute we can set, and its syntax looks like
9112 		// the syntax in VML but is actually kind of nasty: values are given in the pixel
9113 		// coordinate space, whereas in VML they are multiples of the width of the stroked
9114 		// line, which makes a lot more sense.  for that reason, jsPlumb is supporting both
9115 		// the native svg 'stroke-dasharray' attribute, and also the 'dashstyle' concept from
9116 		// VML, which will be the preferred method.  the code below this converts a dashstyle
9117 		// attribute given in terms of stroke width into a pixel representation, by using the
9118 		// stroke's lineWidth. 
9119 		if (style[DASHSTYLE] && style[LINE_WIDTH] && !style[STROKE_DASHARRAY]) {
9120 			var sep = style[DASHSTYLE].indexOf(",") == -1 ? " " : ",",
9121 			parts = style[DASHSTYLE].split(sep),
9122 			styleToUse = "";
9123 			parts.forEach(function(p) {
9124 				styleToUse += (Math.floor(p * style.lineWidth) + sep);
9125 			});
9126 			node.setAttribute(STROKE_DASHARRAY, styleToUse);
9127 		}		
9128 		else if(style[STROKE_DASHARRAY]) {
9129 			node.setAttribute(STROKE_DASHARRAY, style[STROKE_DASHARRAY]);
9130 		}
9131 		
9132 		// extra attributes such as join type, dash offset.
9133 		for (var i in svgAttributeMap) {
9134 			if (style[i]) {
9135 				node.setAttribute(svgAttributeMap[i], style[i]);
9136 			}
9137 		}
9138 	},
9139 	_decodeFont = function(f) {
9140 		var r = /([0-9].)(p[xt])\s(.*)/;
9141 		var bits = f.match(r);
9142 		return {size:bits[1] + bits[2], font:bits[3]};		
9143 	},
9144 	_classManip = function(el, add, clazz) {
9145 		var classesToAddOrRemove = clazz.split(" "),
9146 			className = el.className,
9147 			curClasses = className.baseVal.split(" ");
9148 			
9149 		for (var i = 0; i < classesToAddOrRemove.length; i++) {
9150 			if (add) {
9151 				if (curClasses.indexOf(classesToAddOrRemove[i]) == -1)
9152 					curClasses.push(classesToAddOrRemove[i]);
9153 			}
9154 			else {
9155 				var idx = curClasses.indexOf(classesToAddOrRemove[i]);
9156 				if (idx != -1)
9157 					curClasses.splice(idx, 1);
9158 			}
9159 		}
9160 		
9161 		el.className.baseVal = curClasses.join(" ");
9162 	},
9163 	_addClass = function(el, clazz) {
9164 		_classManip(el, true, clazz);
9165 	},
9166 	_removeClass = function(el, clazz) {
9167 		_classManip(el, false, clazz);
9168 	};
9169 	
9170 	/**
9171 		utility methods for other objects to use.
9172 	*/
9173 	jsPlumbUtil.svg = {
9174 		addClass:_addClass,
9175 		removeClass:_removeClass,
9176 		node:_node,
9177 		attr:_attr,
9178 		pos:_pos
9179 	};
9180 	
9181 	/*
9182 	 * Base class for SVG components.
9183 	 */	
9184 	var SvgComponent = function(params) {
9185 		var self = this,
9186 		pointerEventsSpec = params.pointerEventsSpec || "all";
9187 		jsPlumb.jsPlumbUIComponent.apply(this, params.originalArgs);
9188 		self.canvas = null, self.path = null, self.svg = null; 
9189 	
9190 		var clazz = params.cssClass + " " + (params.originalArgs[0].cssClass || ""),		
9191 			svgParams = {
9192 				"style":"",
9193 				"width":0,
9194 				"height":0,
9195 				"pointer-events":pointerEventsSpec,
9196 				"position":"absolute"
9197 			};		
9198 		if (self.tooltip) svgParams["title"] = self.tooltip;
9199 		self.svg = _node("svg", svgParams);
9200 		if (params.useDivWrapper) {
9201 			self.canvas = document.createElement("div");
9202 			self.canvas.style["position"] = "absolute";
9203 			jsPlumb.sizeCanvas(self.canvas,0,0,1,1);
9204 			self.canvas.className = clazz;
9205 			if (self.tooltip) self.canvas.setAttribute("title", self.tooltip);
9206 		}
9207 		else {
9208 			_attr(self.svg, { "class":clazz });
9209 			self.canvas = self.svg;
9210 		}
9211 			
9212 		params._jsPlumb.appendElement(self.canvas, params.originalArgs[0]["parent"]);
9213 		if (params.useDivWrapper) self.canvas.appendChild(self.svg);
9214 		
9215 		// TODO this displayElement stuff is common between all components, across all
9216 		// renderers.  would be best moved to jsPlumbUIComponent.
9217 		var displayElements = [ self.canvas ];
9218 		this.getDisplayElements = function() { 
9219 			return displayElements; 
9220 		};
9221 		
9222 		this.appendDisplayElement = function(el) {
9223 			displayElements.push(el);
9224 		};
9225 		
9226 		this.paint = function(d, style, anchor) {	   
9227 			if (style != null) {
9228 				var x = d[0], y = d[1];
9229 				if (params.useDivWrapper) {
9230 					jsPlumb.sizeCanvas(self.canvas, d[0], d[1], d[2], d[3]);
9231 					x = 0, y = 0;
9232 				}
9233 				var p = _pos([x, y, d[2], d[3]]);
9234 				if (self.getZIndex()) p += ";z-index:" + self.getZIndex() + ";";
9235 		    	_attr(self.svg, {
9236 	    			"style":p,
9237 	    			"width": d[2],
9238 	    			"height": d[3]
9239 	    		});
9240 		    	self._paint.apply(this, arguments);		    			    	
9241 			}
9242 	    };	
9243 	};
9244 	
9245 	/*
9246 	 * Base class for SVG connectors.
9247 	 */
9248 	var SvgConnector = jsPlumb.SvgConnector = function(params) {
9249 		var self = this;
9250 		SvgComponent.apply(this, [ { 
9251 			cssClass:params["_jsPlumb"].connectorClass, 
9252 			originalArgs:arguments, 
9253 			pointerEventsSpec:"none", 
9254 			tooltip:params.tooltip,
9255 			_jsPlumb:params["_jsPlumb"] 
9256 		} ]);
9257 		this._paint = function(d, style) {
9258 			var p = self.getPath(d), a = { "d":p }, outlineStyle = null;									
9259 			a["pointer-events"] = "all";
9260 			
9261 			// outline style.  actually means drawing an svg object underneath the main one.
9262 			if (style.outlineColor) {
9263 				var outlineWidth = style.outlineWidth || 1,
9264 				outlineStrokeWidth = style.lineWidth + (2 * outlineWidth),
9265 				outlineStyle = jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.extend({}, style);
9266 				outlineStyle.strokeStyle = jsPlumbUtil.convertStyle(style.outlineColor);
9267 				outlineStyle.lineWidth = outlineStrokeWidth;
9268 				
9269 				if (self.bgPath == null) {
9270 					self.bgPath = _node("path", a);
9271 			    	self.svg.appendChild(self.bgPath);
9272 		    		self.attachListeners(self.bgPath, self);
9273 				}
9274 				else {
9275 					_attr(self.bgPath, a);
9276 				}
9277 				
9278 				_applyStyles(self.svg, self.bgPath, outlineStyle, d, self);
9279 			}
9280 			
9281 			
9282 			// test - see below
9283 	    	//	a["clip-path"]= "url(#testClip)"; 
9284 			
9285 	    	if (self.path == null) {
9286 		    	self.path = _node("path", a);
9287 		    	self.svg.appendChild(self.path);
9288 	    		self.attachListeners(self.path, self);	    	
9289 	    		
9290 	    		/*
9291 	    		this is a test of a clip path.  i'm looking into using one of these to animate a jsplumb connection.
9292 	    		you could do this by walking along the line, stepping along a little at a time, and setting the clip
9293 	    		path to extend as far as that point.
9294 	    		
9295 	    		self.clip = _node("clipPath", {id:"testClip", clipPathUnits:"objectBoundingBox"});
9296 	    		self.svg.appendChild(self.clip);
9297 	    		self.clip.appendChild(_node("rect", {
9298 	    			x:"0",y:"0",width:"0.5",height:"1" 
9299 	    		}));
9300 	    		*/
9301 	    	}
9302 	    	else {
9303 	    		_attr(self.path, a);
9304 	    	}
9305 	    		    	
9306 	    	_applyStyles(self.svg, self.path, style, d, self);
9307 		};
9308 		
9309 		this.reattachListeners = function() {
9310 			if (self.bgPath) self.reattachListenersForElement(self.bgPath, self);
9311 			if (self.path) self.reattachListenersForElement(self.path, self);
9312 		};
9313 			
9314 	};		
9315 
9316 	/*
9317 	 * SVG Bezier Connector
9318 	 */
9319 	jsPlumb.Connectors.svg.Bezier = function(params) {	
9320 		jsPlumb.Connectors.Bezier.apply(this, arguments);
9321 		SvgConnector.apply(this, arguments);	
9322 		this.getPath = function(d) {
9323 			var _p = "M " + d[4] + " " + d[5];						
9324 			_p += (" C " + d[8] + " " + d[9] + " " + d[10] + " " + d[11] + " " + d[6] + " " + d[7]);			
9325 			return _p;
9326 		};
9327 	};
9328 	
9329 	/*
9330 	 * SVG straight line Connector
9331 	 */
9332 	jsPlumb.Connectors.svg.Straight = function(params) {			
9333 		jsPlumb.Connectors.Straight.apply(this, arguments);
9334 		SvgConnector.apply(this, arguments);	    		    
9335 	    this.getPath = function(d) { return "M " + d[4] + " " + d[5] + " L " + d[6] + " " + d[7]; };	    
9336 	};
9337 	
9338 	jsPlumb.Connectors.svg.Flowchart = function() {
9339     	var self = this;
9340     	jsPlumb.Connectors.Flowchart.apply(this, arguments);
9341 		SvgConnector.apply(this, arguments);
9342     	this.getPath = function(dimensions) {
9343     		var p = "M " + dimensions[4] + "," + dimensions[5],
9344 				lx = dimensions[4],
9345 				ly = dimensions[5];
9346 				
9347 	        // loop through extra points
9348 	        for (var i = 0; i < dimensions[8]; i++) {
9349 				
9350 				var x1 = dimensions[9 + (i*2)], y1 = dimensions[10 + (i*2)],
9351 					x2 =  dimensions[9 + ((i + 1) * 2)], y2 = dimensions[10 + ((i + 1) * 2)],					
9352 					horiz = (x1 != lx) && (y1 == ly),
9353 					vert = (x1 == lx) && (y1 != ly),
9354 					multX = horiz ? x1 > x2 ? 1 : -1 : 0,
9355 					multY = vert ? y1 > y2 ? 1 : -1 : 0,
9356 					halfStroke = self.lineWidth / 2;								
9357 					
9358 				// previously:
9359 				//p = p + " L " + x1 + " " + y1;
9360 				//p = p + " M " + x1 + " " + y1;
9361 									
9362 				// now, with support for painting an extra bit at the end each line:
9363 	        	p = p + " L " + x1 + " " + y1;											
9364 				p = p + " L " + (x1 + (multX * halfStroke)) + " " + (y1 + (multY * halfStroke));
9365 					
9366 				lx = x1;
9367 				ly = y1;				
9368 				p = p + " M " + x1 + " " + y1;				
9369 	        }
9370 	        // finally draw a line to the end
9371 	        p = p  + " L " + dimensions[6] + "," +  dimensions[7];
9372 	        return p;
9373     	};
9374     };
9375     
9376     /*
9377 	 * Base class for SVG endpoints.
9378 	 */
9379 	var SvgEndpoint = window.SvgEndpoint = function(params) {
9380 		var self = this;
9381 		SvgComponent.apply(this, [ {
9382 			cssClass:params["_jsPlumb"].endpointClass, 
9383 			originalArgs:arguments, 
9384 			pointerEventsSpec:"all",
9385 			useDivWrapper:true,
9386 			_jsPlumb:params["_jsPlumb"]
9387 		} ]);
9388 		this._paint = function(d, style) {
9389 			var s = jsPlumb.extend({}, style);
9390 			if (s.outlineColor) {
9391 				s.strokeWidth = s.outlineWidth;
9392 				s.strokeStyle = jsPlumbUtil.convertStyle(s.outlineColor, true);
9393 			}
9394 			
9395 			if (self.node == null) {
9396 				self.node = self.makeNode(d, s);
9397 				self.svg.appendChild(self.node);
9398 				self.attachListeners(self.node, self);
9399 			}
9400 			_applyStyles(self.svg, self.node, s, d, self);
9401 			_pos(self.node, d);
9402 		};
9403 		
9404 		this.reattachListeners = function() {
9405 			if (self.node) self.reattachListenersForElement(self.node, self);
9406 		};
9407 	};
9408 	
9409 	/*
9410 	 * SVG Dot Endpoint
9411 	 */
9412 	jsPlumb.Endpoints.svg.Dot = function() {
9413 		jsPlumb.Endpoints.Dot.apply(this, arguments);
9414 		SvgEndpoint.apply(this, arguments);		
9415 		this.makeNode = function(d, style) { 
9416 			return _node("circle", {
9417 					"cx"	:	d[2] / 2,
9418 					"cy"	:	d[3] / 2,
9419 					"r"		:	d[2] / 2
9420 				});			
9421 		};
9422 	};
9423 	
9424 	/*
9425 	 * SVG Rectangle Endpoint 
9426 	 */
9427 	jsPlumb.Endpoints.svg.Rectangle = function() {
9428 		jsPlumb.Endpoints.Rectangle.apply(this, arguments);
9429 		SvgEndpoint.apply(this, arguments);		
9430 		this.makeNode = function(d, style) {
9431 			return _node("rect", {
9432 				"width":d[2],
9433 				"height":d[3]
9434 			});
9435 		};			
9436 	};		
9437 	
9438 	/*
9439 	 * SVG Image Endpoint is the default image endpoint.
9440 	 */
9441 	jsPlumb.Endpoints.svg.Image = jsPlumb.Endpoints.Image;
9442 	/*
9443 	 * Blank endpoint in svg renderer is the default Blank endpoint.
9444 	 */
9445 	jsPlumb.Endpoints.svg.Blank = jsPlumb.Endpoints.Blank;	
9446 	/*
9447 	 * Label overlay in svg renderer is the default Label overlay.
9448 	 */
9449 	jsPlumb.Overlays.svg.Label = jsPlumb.Overlays.Label;
9450 	/*
9451 	 * Custom overlay in svg renderer is the default Custom overlay.
9452 	 */
9453 	jsPlumb.Overlays.svg.Custom = jsPlumb.Overlays.Custom;
9454 		
9455 	var AbstractSvgArrowOverlay = function(superclass, originalArgs) {
9456     	superclass.apply(this, originalArgs);
9457     	jsPlumb.jsPlumbUIComponent.apply(this, originalArgs);
9458         this.isAppendedAtTopLevel = false;
9459     	var self = this, path = null;
9460     	this.paint = function(connector, d, lineWidth, strokeStyle, fillStyle) {
9461     		if (path == null) {
9462     			path = _node("path", {
9463     				"pointer-events":"all"	
9464     			});
9465     			connector.svg.appendChild(path);
9466     			
9467     			self.attachListeners(path, connector);
9468     			self.attachListeners(path, self);
9469     		}
9470     		var clazz = originalArgs && (originalArgs.length == 1) ? (originalArgs[0].cssClass || "") : "";
9471     		
9472     		_attr(path, { 
9473     			"d"		:	makePath(d),
9474     			"class" :	clazz,
9475     			stroke 	: 	strokeStyle ? strokeStyle : null,
9476     			fill 	: 	fillStyle ? fillStyle : null
9477     		});    		
9478     	};
9479     	var makePath = function(d) {
9480     		return "M" + d.hxy.x + "," + d.hxy.y +
9481     				" L" + d.tail[0].x + "," + d.tail[0].y + 
9482     				" L" + d.cxy.x + "," + d.cxy.y + 
9483     				" L" + d.tail[1].x + "," + d.tail[1].y + 
9484     				" L" + d.hxy.x + "," + d.hxy.y;
9485     	};
9486     	this.reattachListeners = function() {
9487 			if (path) self.reattachListenersForElement(path, self);
9488 		};
9489 		this.cleanup = function() {
9490     		if (path != null) jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.removeElement(path);
9491     	};
9492     };
9493     
9494     jsPlumb.Overlays.svg.Arrow = function() {
9495     	AbstractSvgArrowOverlay.apply(this, [jsPlumb.Overlays.Arrow, arguments]);    	
9496     };
9497     
9498     jsPlumb.Overlays.svg.PlainArrow = function() {
9499     	AbstractSvgArrowOverlay.apply(this, [jsPlumb.Overlays.PlainArrow, arguments]);    	
9500     };
9501     
9502     jsPlumb.Overlays.svg.Diamond = function() {
9503     	AbstractSvgArrowOverlay.apply(this, [jsPlumb.Overlays.Diamond, arguments]);    	
9504     };
9505 
9506     // a test
9507     jsPlumb.Overlays.svg.GuideLines = function() {
9508         var path = null, self = this, path2 = null, p1_1, p1_2;
9509         jsPlumb.Overlays.GuideLines.apply(this, arguments);
9510         this.paint = function(connector, d, lineWidth, strokeStyle, fillStyle) {
9511     		if (path == null) {
9512     			path = _node("path");
9513     			connector.svg.appendChild(path);
9514     			self.attachListeners(path, connector);
9515     			self.attachListeners(path, self);
9516 
9517                 p1_1 = _node("path");
9518     			connector.svg.appendChild(p1_1);
9519     			self.attachListeners(p1_1, connector);
9520     			self.attachListeners(p1_1, self);
9521 
9522                 p1_2 = _node("path");
9523     			connector.svg.appendChild(p1_2);
9524     			self.attachListeners(p1_2, connector);
9525     			self.attachListeners(p1_2, self);
9526 
9527     		}
9528 
9529     		_attr(path, {
9530     			"d"		:	makePath(d[0], d[1]),
9531     			stroke 	: 	"red",
9532     			fill 	: 	null
9533     		});
9534 
9535             _attr(p1_1, {
9536     			"d"		:	makePath(d[2][0], d[2][1]),
9537     			stroke 	: 	"blue",
9538     			fill 	: 	null
9539     		});
9540 
9541             _attr(p1_2, {
9542     			"d"		:	makePath(d[3][0], d[3][1]),
9543     			stroke 	: 	"green",
9544     			fill 	: 	null
9545     		});
9546     	};
9547 
9548         var makePath = function(d1, d2) {
9549             return "M " + d1.x + "," + d1.y +
9550                    " L" + d2.x + "," + d2.y;
9551         };
9552 
9553     };
9554 })();/*
9555  * jsPlumb
9556  * 
9557  * Title:jsPlumb 1.3.15
9558  * 
9559  * Provides a way to visually connect elements on an HTML page, using either SVG, Canvas
9560  * elements, or VML.  
9561  * 
9562  * This file contains the HTML5 canvas renderers.
9563  *
9564  * Copyright (c) 2010 - 2012 Simon Porritt (http://jsplumb.org)
9565  * 
9566  * http://jsplumb.org
9567  * http://github.com/sporritt/jsplumb
9568  * http://code.google.com/p/jsplumb
9569  * 
9570  * Dual licensed under the MIT and GPL2 licenses.
9571  */
9572 
9573 ;(function() {
9574 	
9575 // ********************************* CANVAS RENDERERS FOR CONNECTORS AND ENDPOINTS *******************************************************************
9576 		
9577 	// TODO refactor to renderer common script.  put a ref to jsPlumb.sizeCanvas in there too.
9578 	var _connectionBeingDragged = null,
9579 	    _hasClass = function(el, clazz) { return jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.hasClass(_getElementObject(el), clazz); },
9580 	    _getElementObject = function(el) { return jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.getElementObject(el); },
9581 	    _getOffset = function(el) { return jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.getOffset(_getElementObject(el)); },
9582 	    _pageXY = function(el) { return jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.getPageXY(el); },
9583 	    _clientXY = function(el) { return jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.getClientXY(el); };
9584 	
9585 	/*
9586 	 * Class:CanvasMouseAdapter
9587 	 * Provides support for mouse events on canvases.  
9588 	 */
9589 	var CanvasMouseAdapter = function() {
9590 		var self = this;
9591 		self.overlayPlacements = [];
9592 		jsPlumb.jsPlumbUIComponent.apply(this, arguments);
9593 		jsPlumbUtil.EventGenerator.apply(this, arguments);
9594 		/**
9595 		 * returns whether or not the given event is ojver a painted area of the canvas. 
9596 		 */
9597 	    this._over = function(e) {		    			  		    	
9598 	    	var o = _getOffset(_getElementObject(self.canvas)),
9599 	    	pageXY = _pageXY(e),
9600 	    	x = pageXY[0] - o.left, y = pageXY[1] - o.top;
9601 	    	if (x > 0 && y > 0 && x < self.canvas.width && y < self.canvas.height) {
9602 		    	// first check overlays
9603 		    	for ( var i = 0; i < self.overlayPlacements.length; i++) {
9604 		    		var p = self.overlayPlacements[i];
9605 		    		if (p && (p[0] <= x && p[1] >= x && p[2] <= y && p[3] >= y))
9606 		    			return true;
9607 		    	}
9608 		    	
9609 		    	// then the canvas
9610 		    	var d = self.canvas.getContext("2d").getImageData(parseInt(x), parseInt(y), 1, 1);
9611 		    	return d.data[0] != 0 || d.data[1] != 0 || d.data[2] != 0 || d.data[3] != 0;		  
9612 	    	}
9613 	    	return false;
9614 	    };
9615 	    
9616 	    var _mouseover = false, _mouseDown = false, _posWhenMouseDown = null, _mouseWasDown = false,
9617 	    _nullSafeHasClass = function(el, clazz) {
9618 	    	return el != null && _hasClass(el, clazz);
9619 	    };
9620 	    this.mousemove = function(e) {		    
9621 	    	var pageXY = _pageXY(e), clientXY = _clientXY(e),	   
9622 	    	ee = document.elementFromPoint(clientXY[0], clientXY[1]),
9623 	    	eventSourceWasOverlay = _nullSafeHasClass(ee, "_jsPlumb_overlay");	    	
9624 			var _continue = _connectionBeingDragged == null && (_nullSafeHasClass(ee, "_jsPlumb_endpoint") || _nullSafeHasClass(ee, "_jsPlumb_connector"));
9625 			if (!_mouseover && _continue && self._over(e)) {
9626 				_mouseover = true;
9627 				self.fire("mouseenter", self, e);		
9628 				return true;
9629 			}
9630 			// TODO here there is a remote chance that the overlay the mouse moved onto
9631 			// is actually not an overlay for the current component. a more thorough check would
9632 			// be to ensure the overlay belonged to the current component.  
9633 			else if (_mouseover && (!self._over(e) || !_continue) && !eventSourceWasOverlay) {
9634 				_mouseover = false;
9635 				self.fire("mouseexit", self, e);				
9636 			}
9637 			self.fire("mousemove", self, e);
9638 	    };
9639 	    		    		    
9640 	    this.click = function(e) {	    		
9641 	    	if (_mouseover && self._over(e) && !_mouseWasDown) 
9642 	    		self.fire("click", self, e);		    	
9643 	    	_mouseWasDown = false;
9644 	    };
9645 	    
9646 	    this.dblclick = function(e) {
9647 	    	if (_mouseover && self._over(e) && !_mouseWasDown) 
9648 	    		self.fire("dblclick", self, e);		    	
9649 	    	_mouseWasDown = false;
9650 	    };
9651 	    
9652 	    this.mousedown = function(e) {
9653 	    	if(self._over(e) && !_mouseDown) {
9654 	    		_mouseDown = true;	    		
9655 	    		_posWhenMouseDown = _getOffset(_getElementObject(self.canvas));
9656 	    		self.fire("mousedown", self, e);
9657 	    	}
9658 	    };
9659 	    
9660 	    this.mouseup = function(e) {
9661 	    	_mouseDown = false;
9662 	    	self.fire("mouseup", self, e);
9663 	    };
9664 
9665         this.contextmenu = function(e) {
9666           if (_mouseover && self._over(e) && !_mouseWasDown)
9667             self.fire("contextmenu", self, e);
9668           _mouseWasDown = false;
9669         };
9670 	};
9671 	
9672 	var _newCanvas = function(params) {
9673 		var canvas = document.createElement("canvas");
9674 		params["_jsPlumb"].appendElement(canvas, params.parent);
9675 		canvas.style.position = "absolute";
9676 		if (params["class"]) canvas.className = params["class"];
9677 		// set an id. if no id on the element and if uuid was supplied it
9678 		// will be used, otherwise we'll create one.
9679 		params["_jsPlumb"].getId(canvas, params.uuid);
9680 		if (params.tooltip) canvas.setAttribute("title", params.tooltip);
9681 
9682 		return canvas;
9683 	};	
9684 
9685 	var CanvasComponent = function(params) {
9686 		CanvasMouseAdapter.apply(this, arguments);
9687 
9688 		var displayElements = [ ];
9689 		this.getDisplayElements = function() { return displayElements; };
9690 		this.appendDisplayElement = function(el) { displayElements.push(el); };
9691 	};
9692 	
9693 	/**
9694 	 * Class:CanvasConnector
9695 	 * Superclass for Canvas Connector renderers.
9696 	 */
9697 	var CanvasConnector = jsPlumb.CanvasConnector = function(params) {
9698 		
9699 		CanvasComponent.apply(this, arguments);
9700 		
9701 		var _paintOneStyle = function(dim, aStyle) {
9702 			self.ctx.save();
9703 			jsPlumb.extend(self.ctx, aStyle);
9704 			if (aStyle.gradient) {
9705 				var g = self.createGradient(dim, self.ctx);
9706 				for ( var i = 0; i < aStyle.gradient.stops.length; i++)
9707 					g.addColorStop(aStyle.gradient.stops[i][0], aStyle.gradient.stops[i][1]);
9708 				self.ctx.strokeStyle = g;
9709 			}
9710 			self._paint(dim, aStyle);
9711 			self.ctx.restore();
9712 		};
9713 
9714 		var self = this,
9715 		clazz = self._jsPlumb.connectorClass + " " + (params.cssClass || "");
9716 		self.canvas = _newCanvas({ 
9717 			"class":clazz, 
9718 			_jsPlumb:self._jsPlumb,
9719 			parent:params.parent,
9720 			tooltip:params.tooltip
9721 		});	
9722 		self.ctx = self.canvas.getContext("2d");
9723 		
9724 		self.appendDisplayElement(self.canvas);
9725 		
9726 		self.paint = function(dim, style) {						
9727 			if (style != null) {																				
9728 				jsPlumb.sizeCanvas(self.canvas, dim[0], dim[1], dim[2], dim[3]);
9729 				if (self.getZIndex())
9730 					self.canvas.style.zIndex = self.getZIndex();
9731 				if (style.outlineColor != null) {
9732 					var outlineWidth = style.outlineWidth || 1,
9733 					outlineStrokeWidth = style.lineWidth + (2 * outlineWidth),
9734 					outlineStyle = {
9735 						strokeStyle:style.outlineColor,
9736 						lineWidth:outlineStrokeWidth
9737 					};
9738 					_paintOneStyle(dim, outlineStyle);
9739 				}
9740 				_paintOneStyle(dim, style);
9741 			}
9742 		};				
9743 	};		
9744 	
9745 	/**
9746 	 * Class:CanvasEndpoint
9747 	 * Superclass for Canvas Endpoint renderers.
9748 	 */
9749 	var CanvasEndpoint = function(params) {
9750 		var self = this;				
9751 		CanvasComponent.apply(this, arguments);		
9752 		var clazz = self._jsPlumb.endpointClass + " " + (params.cssClass || ""),
9753 			canvasParams = { 
9754 			"class":clazz, 
9755 			_jsPlumb:self._jsPlumb,
9756 			parent:params.parent,
9757 			tooltip:self.tooltip
9758 		};
9759 		self.canvas = _newCanvas(canvasParams);	
9760 		self.ctx = self.canvas.getContext("2d");
9761 
9762 		self.appendDisplayElement(self.canvas);
9763 		
9764 		this.paint = function(d, style, anchor) {
9765 			jsPlumb.sizeCanvas(self.canvas, d[0], d[1], d[2], d[3]);			
9766 			if (style.outlineColor != null) {
9767 				var outlineWidth = style.outlineWidth || 1,
9768 				outlineStrokeWidth = style.lineWidth + (2 * outlineWidth);
9769 				var outlineStyle = {
9770 					strokeStyle:style.outlineColor,
9771 					lineWidth:outlineStrokeWidth
9772 				};
9773 			}
9774 			
9775 			self._paint.apply(this, arguments);
9776 		};
9777 	};
9778 	
9779 	jsPlumb.Endpoints.canvas.Dot = function(params) {		
9780 		jsPlumb.Endpoints.Dot.apply(this, arguments);
9781 		CanvasEndpoint.apply(this, arguments);
9782 		var self = this,		
9783 		parseValue = function(value) {
9784 			try { return parseInt(value); }
9785 			catch(e) {
9786 				if (value.substring(value.length - 1) == '%')
9787 					return parseInt(value.substring(0, value - 1));
9788 			}
9789 		},					    	
9790 		calculateAdjustments = function(gradient) {
9791 			var offsetAdjustment = self.defaultOffset, innerRadius = self.defaultInnerRadius;
9792 			gradient.offset && (offsetAdjustment = parseValue(gradient.offset));
9793         	gradient.innerRadius && (innerRadius = parseValue(gradient.innerRadius));
9794         	return [offsetAdjustment, innerRadius];
9795 		};
9796 		this._paint = function(d, style, anchor) {
9797 			if (style != null) {			
9798 				var ctx = self.canvas.getContext('2d'), orientation = anchor.getOrientation(self);
9799 				jsPlumb.extend(ctx, style);							
9800 	            if (style.gradient) {            	
9801 	            	var adjustments = calculateAdjustments(style.gradient), 
9802 	            	yAdjust = orientation[1] == 1 ? adjustments[0] * -1 : adjustments[0],
9803 	            	xAdjust = orientation[0] == 1 ? adjustments[0] * -1:  adjustments[0],
9804 	            	g = ctx.createRadialGradient(d[4], d[4], d[4], d[4] + xAdjust, d[4] + yAdjust, adjustments[1]);
9805 		            for (var i = 0; i < style.gradient.stops.length; i++)
9806 		            	g.addColorStop(style.gradient.stops[i][0], style.gradient.stops[i][1]);
9807 		            ctx.fillStyle = g;
9808 	            }				
9809 				ctx.beginPath();    		
9810 				ctx.arc(d[4], d[4], d[4], 0, Math.PI*2, true);
9811 				ctx.closePath();				
9812 				if (style.fillStyle || style.gradient) ctx.fill();
9813 				if (style.strokeStyle) ctx.stroke();
9814 			}
9815     	};
9816 	};	
9817 		
9818 	jsPlumb.Endpoints.canvas.Rectangle = function(params) {
9819 		
9820 		var self = this;
9821 		jsPlumb.Endpoints.Rectangle.apply(this, arguments);
9822 		CanvasEndpoint.apply(this, arguments);				
9823 		
9824     	this._paint = function(d, style, anchor) {
9825 				
9826 			var ctx = self.canvas.getContext("2d"), orientation = anchor.getOrientation(self);
9827 			jsPlumb.extend(ctx, style);
9828 			
9829 			/* canvas gradient */
9830 		    if (style.gradient) {
9831 		    	// first figure out which direction to run the gradient in (it depends on the orientation of the anchors)
9832 		    	var y1 = orientation[1] == 1 ? d[3] : orientation[1] == 0 ? d[3] / 2 : 0;
9833 				var y2 = orientation[1] == -1 ? d[3] : orientation[1] == 0 ? d[3] / 2 : 0;
9834 				var x1 = orientation[0] == 1 ? d[2] : orientation[0] == 0 ? d[2] / 2 : 0;
9835 				var x2 = orientation[0] == -1 ? d[2] : orientation[0] == 0 ? d[2] / 2 : 0;
9836 			    var g = ctx.createLinearGradient(x1,y1,x2,y2);
9837 			    for (var i = 0; i < style.gradient.stops.length; i++)
9838 	            	g.addColorStop(style.gradient.stops[i][0], style.gradient.stops[i][1]);
9839 	            ctx.fillStyle = g;
9840 		    }
9841 			
9842 			ctx.beginPath();
9843 			ctx.rect(0, 0, d[2], d[3]);
9844 			ctx.closePath();				
9845 			if (style.fillStyle || style.gradient) ctx.fill();
9846 			if (style.strokeStyle) ctx.stroke();
9847     	};
9848 	};		
9849 	
9850 	jsPlumb.Endpoints.canvas.Triangle = function(params) {
9851 	        			
9852 		var self = this;
9853 		jsPlumb.Endpoints.Triangle.apply(this, arguments);
9854 		CanvasEndpoint.apply(this, arguments);			
9855 		
9856     	this._paint = function(d, style, anchor)
9857 		{    		
9858 			var width = d[2], height = d[3], x = d[0], y = d[1],			
9859 			ctx = self.canvas.getContext('2d'),
9860 			offsetX = 0, offsetY = 0, angle = 0,
9861 			orientation = anchor.getOrientation(self);
9862 			
9863 			if( orientation[0] == 1 ) {
9864 				offsetX = width;
9865 				offsetY = height;
9866 				angle = 180;
9867 			}
9868 			if( orientation[1] == -1 ) {
9869 				offsetX = width;
9870 				angle = 90;
9871 			}
9872 			if( orientation[1] == 1 ) {
9873 				offsetY = height;
9874 				angle = -90;
9875 			}
9876 			
9877 			ctx.fillStyle = style.fillStyle;
9878 			
9879 			ctx.translate(offsetX, offsetY);
9880 			ctx.rotate(angle * Math.PI/180);
9881 
9882 			ctx.beginPath();
9883 			ctx.moveTo(0, 0);
9884 			ctx.lineTo(width/2, height/2);
9885 			ctx.lineTo(0, height);
9886 			ctx.closePath();
9887 			if (style.fillStyle || style.gradient) ctx.fill();
9888 			if (style.strokeStyle) ctx.stroke();				
9889     	};
9890 	};	
9891 	
9892 	/*
9893 	 * Canvas Image Endpoint: uses the default version, which creates an <img> tag.
9894 	 */
9895 	jsPlumb.Endpoints.canvas.Image = jsPlumb.Endpoints.Image;
9896 	
9897 	/*
9898 	 * Blank endpoint in all renderers is just the default Blank endpoint.
9899 	 */
9900 	jsPlumb.Endpoints.canvas.Blank = jsPlumb.Endpoints.Blank;
9901 	
9902 	/*
9903      * Canvas Bezier Connector. Draws a Bezier curve onto a Canvas element.
9904      */
9905     jsPlumb.Connectors.canvas.Bezier = function() {
9906     	var self = this;
9907     	jsPlumb.Connectors.Bezier.apply(this, arguments); 
9908     	CanvasConnector.apply(this, arguments);
9909     	this._paint = function(dimensions, style) {
9910         	self.ctx.beginPath();
9911         	self.ctx.moveTo(dimensions[4], dimensions[5]);
9912         	self.ctx.bezierCurveTo(dimensions[8], dimensions[9], dimensions[10], dimensions[11], dimensions[6], dimensions[7]);	            
9913         	self.ctx.stroke();            
9914         };
9915         
9916         // TODO i doubt this handles the case that source and target are swapped.
9917         this.createGradient = function(dim, ctx, swap) {
9918         	return /*(swap) ? self.ctx.createLinearGradient(dim[4], dim[5], dim[6], dim[7]) : */self.ctx.createLinearGradient(dim[6], dim[7], dim[4], dim[5]);
9919         };
9920     };
9921     
9922     /*
9923      * Canvas straight line Connector. Draws a straight line onto a Canvas element.
9924      */
9925     jsPlumb.Connectors.canvas.Straight = function() {   	 
9926 		var self = this,
9927 			segmentMultipliers = [null, [1, -1], [1, 1], [-1, 1], [-1, -1] ];
9928 
9929 		jsPlumb.Connectors.Straight.apply(this, arguments);
9930 		CanvasConnector.apply(this, arguments);
9931 		this._paint = function(dimensions, style) {
9932 
9933 			self.ctx.beginPath();
9934 
9935 			if (style.dashstyle && style.dashstyle.split(" ").length == 2) {			
9936 				// only a very simple dashed style is supported - having two values, which define the stroke length 
9937 				// (as a multiple of the stroke width) and then the space length (also as a multiple of stroke width). 
9938 				var ds = style.dashstyle.split(" ");
9939 				if (ds.length != 2) ds = [2, 2];
9940 				var dss = [ ds[0] * style.lineWidth, ds[1] * style.lineWidth ],
9941 					m = (dimensions[6] - dimensions[4]) / (dimensions[7] - dimensions[5]),
9942 					s = jsPlumbUtil.segment([dimensions[4], dimensions[5]], [ dimensions[6], dimensions[7] ]),
9943 					sm = segmentMultipliers[s],
9944 					theta = Math.atan(m),
9945 					l = Math.sqrt(Math.pow(dimensions[6] - dimensions[4], 2) + Math.pow(dimensions[7] - dimensions[5], 2)),
9946 					repeats = Math.floor(l / (dss[0] + dss[1])),
9947 					curPos = [dimensions[4], dimensions[5]];
9948 
9949 				
9950 				// TODO: the question here is why could we not support this in all connector types? it's really
9951 				// just a case of going along and asking jsPlumb for the next point on the path a few times, until it
9952 				// reaches the end. every type of connector supports that method, after all.  but right now its only the
9953 				// bezier connector that gives you back the new location on the path along with the x,y coordinates, which
9954 				// we would need. we'd start out at loc=0 and ask for the point along the path that is dss[0] pixels away.
9955 				// we then ask for the point that is (dss[0] + dss[1]) pixels away; and from that one we need not just the
9956 				// x,y but the location, cos we're gonna plug that location back in in order to find where that dash ends.
9957 				//
9958 				// it also strikes me that it should be trivial to support arbitrary dash styles (having more or less than two
9959 				// entries). you'd just iterate that array using a step size of 2, and generify the (rss[0] + rss[1])
9960 				// computation to be sum(rss[0]..rss[n]).
9961 
9962 				for (var i = 0; i < repeats; i++) {
9963 					self.ctx.moveTo(curPos[0], curPos[1]);
9964 
9965 					var nextEndX = curPos[0] + (Math.abs(Math.sin(theta) * dss[0]) * sm[0]),
9966 						nextEndY = curPos[1] + (Math.abs(Math.cos(theta) * dss[0]) * sm[1]),
9967 						nextStartX = curPos[0] + (Math.abs(Math.sin(theta) * (dss[0] + dss[1]))  * sm[0]),
9968 						nextStartY = curPos[1] + (Math.abs(Math.cos(theta) * (dss[0] + dss[1])) * sm[1])
9969 
9970 					self.ctx.lineTo(nextEndX, nextEndY);
9971 					curPos = [nextStartX, nextStartY];					
9972 				}
9973 
9974 				// now draw the last bit
9975 				self.ctx.moveTo(curPos[0], curPos[1]);
9976 				self.ctx.lineTo(dimensions[6], dimensions[7]);		
9977 
9978 			}	        
9979 	        else {
9980 		        self.ctx.moveTo(dimensions[4], dimensions[5]);
9981 	        	self.ctx.lineTo(dimensions[6], dimensions[7]);
9982 	        }
9983 	        	      
9984 	        self.ctx.stroke();            
9985 	    };
9986 	    
9987 	    // TODO this does not handle the case that src and target are swapped.
9988 	    this.createGradient = function(dim, ctx) {
9989         	return ctx.createLinearGradient(dim[4], dim[5], dim[6], dim[7]);
9990         };
9991     };
9992     
9993     jsPlumb.Connectors.canvas.Flowchart = function() {
9994     	var self = this;
9995     	jsPlumb.Connectors.Flowchart.apply(this, arguments);
9996 		CanvasConnector.apply(this, arguments);
9997     	this._paint = function(dimensions, style) {
9998 	        self.ctx.beginPath();
9999 	        self.ctx.moveTo(dimensions[4], dimensions[5]);
10000 	        // loop through extra points
10001 	        for (var i = 0; i < dimensions[8]; i++) {
10002 	        	self.ctx.lineTo(dimensions[9 + (i*2)], dimensions[10 + (i*2)]);
10003 	        }
10004 	        // finally draw a line to the end
10005 	        self.ctx.lineTo(dimensions[6], dimensions[7]);
10006 	        self.ctx.stroke();
10007     	};
10008     	
10009     	this.createGradient = function(dim, ctx) {
10010         	return ctx.createLinearGradient(dim[4], dim[5], dim[6], dim[7]);
10011         };
10012     };
10013     
10014 // ********************************* END OF CANVAS RENDERERS *******************************************************************    
10015     
10016     jsPlumb.Overlays.canvas.Label = jsPlumb.Overlays.Label;
10017 	jsPlumb.Overlays.canvas.Custom = jsPlumb.Overlays.Custom;
10018     
10019     /**
10020      * a placeholder right now, really just exists to mirror the fact that there are SVG and VML versions of this. 
10021      */
10022     var CanvasOverlay = function() { 
10023     	jsPlumb.jsPlumbUIComponent.apply(this, arguments);
10024     };
10025     
10026     var AbstractCanvasArrowOverlay = function(superclass, originalArgs) {
10027     	superclass.apply(this, originalArgs);
10028     	CanvasOverlay.apply(this, originalArgs);
10029     	this.paint = function(connector, d, lineWidth, strokeStyle, fillStyle) {
10030     		var ctx = connector.ctx;
10031     		
10032 			ctx.lineWidth = lineWidth;
10033 			ctx.beginPath();
10034 			ctx.moveTo(d.hxy.x, d.hxy.y);
10035 			ctx.lineTo(d.tail[0].x, d.tail[0].y);
10036 			ctx.lineTo(d.cxy.x, d.cxy.y);
10037 			ctx.lineTo(d.tail[1].x, d.tail[1].y);
10038 			ctx.lineTo(d.hxy.x, d.hxy.y);
10039 			ctx.closePath();						
10040 						
10041 			if (strokeStyle) {
10042 				ctx.strokeStyle = strokeStyle;
10043 				ctx.stroke();
10044 			}
10045 			if (fillStyle) {
10046 				ctx.fillStyle = fillStyle;			
10047 				ctx.fill();
10048 			}
10049     	};
10050     }; 
10051     
10052     jsPlumb.Overlays.canvas.Arrow = function() {
10053     	AbstractCanvasArrowOverlay.apply(this, [jsPlumb.Overlays.Arrow, arguments]);    	
10054     };
10055     
10056     jsPlumb.Overlays.canvas.PlainArrow = function() {
10057     	AbstractCanvasArrowOverlay.apply(this, [jsPlumb.Overlays.PlainArrow, arguments]);    	
10058     };
10059     
10060     jsPlumb.Overlays.canvas.Diamond = function() {
10061     	AbstractCanvasArrowOverlay.apply(this, [jsPlumb.Overlays.Diamond, arguments]);    	
10062     };		
10063 })();/*
10064  * jsPlumb
10065  * 
10066  * Title:jsPlumb 1.3.15
10067  * 
10068  * Provides a way to visually connect elements on an HTML page, using either SVG, Canvas
10069  * elements, or VML.  
10070  * 
10071  * This file contains the YUI3 adapter.
10072  *
10073  * Copyright (c) 2010 - 2012 Simon Porritt (http://jsplumb.org)
10074  * 
10075  * http://jsplumb.org
10076  * http://github.com/sporritt/jsplumb
10077  * http://code.google.com/p/jsplumb
10078  * 
10079  * Dual licensed under the MIT and GPL2 licenses.
10080  */
10081 
10082 /**
10083  * addClass				adds a class to the given element
10084  * animate				calls the underlying library's animate functionality
10085  * appendElement		appends a child element to a parent element.
10086  * bind					binds some event to an element
10087  * dragEvents			a dictionary of event names
10088  * extend				extend some js object with another.  probably not overly necessary; jsPlumb could just do this internally.
10089  * getAttribute			gets some attribute from an element
10090  * getDragObject		gets the object that is being dragged, by extracting it from the arguments passed to a drag callback
10091  * getDragScope			gets the drag scope for a given element.
10092  * getElementObject		turns an id or dom element into an element object of the underlying library's type.
10093  * getOffset			gets an element's offset
10094  * getOriginalEvent     gets the original browser event from some wrapper event.
10095  * getScrollLeft		gets an element's scroll left.  TODO: is this actually used?  will it be?
10096  * getScrollTop			gets an element's scroll top.  TODO: is this actually used?  will it be?
10097  * getSize				gets an element's size.
10098  * getUIPosition		gets the position of some element that is currently being dragged, by extracting it from the arguments passed to a drag callback.
10099  * initDraggable		initializes an element to be draggable 
10100  * initDroppable		initializes an element to be droppable
10101  * isDragSupported		returns whether or not drag is supported for some element.
10102  * isDropSupported		returns whether or not drop is supported for some element.
10103  * removeClass			removes a class from a given element.
10104  * removeElement		removes some element completely from the DOM.
10105  * setAttribute			sets an attribute on some element.
10106  * setDraggable			sets whether or not some element should be draggable.
10107  * setDragScope			sets the drag scope for a given element.
10108  * setOffset			sets the offset of some element.
10109  */
10110 (function() {
10111 	
10112 	if (!Array.prototype.indexOf) {
10113 		Array.prototype.indexOf = function( v, b, s ) {
10114 			for( var i = +b || 0, l = this.length; i < l; i++ ) {
10115 	  			if( this[i]===v || s && this[i]==v ) { return i; }
10116 	 		}
10117 	 		return -1;
10118 		};
10119 	}
10120 	
10121 	var Y;
10122 	
10123 	YUI().use('node', 'dd', 'anim', 'node-event-simulate', function(_Y) {
10124 		Y = _Y;	
10125 		Y.on("domready", function() { jsPlumb.init(); });
10126 	});
10127 	
10128 	/**
10129 	 * adds the given value to the given list, with the given scope. creates the scoped list
10130 	 * if necessary.
10131 	 * used by initDraggable and initDroppable.
10132 	 */
10133 	var _add = function(list, scope, value) {
10134 		var l = list[scope];
10135 		if (!l) {
10136 			l = [];
10137 			list[scope] = l;
10138 		}
10139 		l.push(value);
10140 	},	
10141 	ddEvents = [ "drag:mouseDown", "drag:afterMouseDown", "drag:mouseup",
10142 	     "drag:align", "drag:removeHandle", "drag:addHandle", "drag:removeInvalid", "drag:addInvalid",
10143 	     "drag:start", "drag:end", "drag:drag", "drag:over", "drag:enter",
10144 	     "drag:exit", "drag:drophit", "drag:dropmiss", "drop:over", "drop:enter", "drop:exit", "drop:hit"	     	               
10145 	],	
10146 	animEvents = [ "tween" ],	
10147 	/**
10148 	 * helper function to curry callbacks for some element. 
10149 	 */
10150 	_wrapper = function(fn) {
10151 		return function() {
10152 			try {
10153 				return fn.apply(this, arguments);
10154 			}
10155 			catch (e) { }
10156 		};
10157 	},	
10158 	/**
10159 	 * extracts options from the given options object, leaving out event handlers.
10160 	 */
10161 	_getDDOptions = function(options) {
10162 		var o = {};
10163 		for (var i in options) if (ddEvents.indexOf(i) == -1) o[i] = options[i];
10164 		return o;
10165 	},	
10166 	/**
10167 	 * attaches all event handlers found in options to the given dragdrop object, and registering
10168 	 * the given el as the element of interest.
10169 	 */
10170 	_attachListeners = function(dd, options, eventList) {	
10171 	    for (var ev in options) {
10172 	    	if (eventList.indexOf(ev) != -1) {
10173 	    		var w = _wrapper(options[ev]);
10174 	    		dd.on(ev, w);
10175 	    	}
10176 	    }
10177 	},
10178 	_droppables = {},
10179 	_droppableOptions = {},
10180 	_draggablesByScope = {},
10181 	_draggablesById = {},
10182 	_droppableScopesById = {},
10183 	_checkHover = function(el, entering) {
10184 		if (el) {
10185 			var id = el.get("id");
10186 			if (id) {
10187 				var options = _droppableOptions[id];
10188 				if (options) {
10189 					if (options['hoverClass']) {
10190 						if (entering) el.addClass(options['hoverClass']);
10191 						else el.removeClass(options['hoverClass']);
10192 					}
10193 				}
10194 			}
10195 		}
10196 	},
10197 	_lastDragObject = null,
10198 	_extend = function(o1, o2) {
10199 		for (var i in o2)
10200 			o1[i] = o2[i];
10201 		return o1;
10202 	},
10203 	_getAttribute = function(el, attributeId) {
10204 		return el.getAttribute(attributeId);
10205 	},
10206 	_getElementObject = function(el) {
10207 		if (el == null) return null;
10208 		var eee = null;
10209         eee = typeof el == 'string' ? Y.one('#' + el) : el._node ? el : Y.one(el);        
10210         return eee;
10211 	};
10212 	
10213 	jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary = {
10214 			
10215 		addClass : function(el, clazz) {
10216 			jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.getElementObject(el).addClass(clazz);
10217 		},	
10218 		
10219 		/**
10220 		 * animates the given element.
10221 		 */
10222 		animate : function(el, properties, options) {
10223 			var o = _extend({node:el, to:properties}, options),			
10224 				id = _getAttribute(el, "id");
10225 			o["tween"] = jsPlumb.wrap(properties["tween"], function() {
10226 				// TODO should use a current instance.
10227 				jsPlumb.repaint(id);
10228 			});
10229 			var a = new Y.Anim(o);
10230 			_attachListeners(a, o, animEvents);
10231 			a.run();
10232 		},
10233 		
10234 		appendElement : function(child, parent) {
10235 			_getElementObject (parent).append(child);			
10236 		},
10237 		
10238 		/**
10239 		 * event binding wrapper.  
10240 		 */
10241 		bind : function(el, event, callback) {
10242 			_getElementObject(el).on(event, callback);
10243 		},
10244 			
10245 		dragEvents : {
10246 			"start":"drag:start", "stop":"drag:end", "drag":"drag:drag", "step":"step",
10247 			"over":"drop:enter", "out":"drop:exit", "drop":"drop:hit"
10248 		},								
10249 			
10250 		extend : _extend,
10251 		
10252 		getAttribute : _getAttribute,
10253 		
10254 		getClientXY : function(eventObject) {
10255 			return [eventObject.clientX, eventObject.clientY];
10256 		},
10257 		
10258 		/**
10259 		 * takes the args passed to an event function and returns you an object representing that which is being dragged.
10260 		 */
10261 		getDragObject : function(eventArgs) {
10262 			// this is a workaround for the unfortunate fact that in YUI3, the 'drop:exit' event does
10263 			// not contain a reference to the drag that just exited.  single-threaded js to the 
10264 			// rescue: we'll just keep it for ourselves.
10265 			if (eventArgs[0].drag) _lastDragObject = eventArgs[0].drag.el;
10266 			return _lastDragObject;
10267 		},
10268 		
10269 		getDragScope : function(el) {
10270 			var id = jsPlumb.getId(el),
10271 				dd = _draggablesById[id];
10272 			return dd.scope;
10273 		},
10274 
10275 		getDropEvent : function(args) {
10276 			return args[0];
10277 		},
10278 		
10279 		getDropScope : function(el) {
10280 			var id = jsPlumb.getId(el);
10281 			return _droppableScopesById[id];
10282 		},
10283 		
10284 		getDOMElement : function(el) { 			
10285 			if (typeof(el) == "String") 
10286 				return document.getElementById(el);
10287 			else if (el._node) 
10288 				return el._node;
10289 			else return el;
10290 		},
10291 		
10292 		getElementObject : _getElementObject,
10293 		
10294 		getOffset : function(el) {			
10295 			var o = Y.DOM.getXY(el._node);
10296 			return {left:o[0], top:o[1]};
10297 		},
10298 
10299 		getOriginalEvent : function(e) {
10300 			return e._event;
10301 		},
10302 		
10303 		getPageXY : function(eventObject) {
10304 			return [eventObject.pageX, eventObject.pageY];
10305 		},
10306 		
10307 		getParent : function(el) {
10308 			return jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.getElementObject(el).get("parentNode");
10309 		},
10310 		
10311 		getScrollLeft : function(el) {
10312 			return 0; 
10313 		},
10314 		
10315 		getScrollTop : function(el) {
10316 			return 0;
10317 		},
10318 		
10319 		getSelector : function(spec) {
10320 			var s = Y.all(spec);
10321 			return s && s ._nodes ? s._nodes : [];
10322 		},
10323 		
10324 		getSize : function(el) {
10325 			return [ el._node.offsetWidth, el._node.offsetHeight ];
10326 		},
10327 
10328         getTagName : function(el) {
10329             var e = jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.getElementObject(el);
10330             return e != null && e._node != null ? e._node.tagName : null;
10331         },
10332 		
10333 		getUIPosition : function(args, zoom) {
10334 			zoom = zoom || 1;
10335 			var n = args[0].currentTarget.el._node,
10336 			o = Y.DOM.getXY(n);
10337 			return {left:o[0] / zoom, top:o[1] / zoom};
10338 		},		
10339 		
10340 		hasClass : function(el, clazz) {
10341 			return el.hasClass(clazz);
10342 		},
10343 				
10344 		initDraggable : function(el, options, isPlumbedComponent) {
10345 			var _opts = _getDDOptions(options),
10346 				id = jsPlumb.getId(el);
10347 			_opts.node = "#" + id;		
10348 			var dd = new Y.DD.Drag(_opts);
10349 			dd.el = el;	
10350 			
10351 			if (isPlumbedComponent) {
10352 				var scope = options['scope'] || jsPlumb.Defaults.Scope;
10353 				dd.scope = scope;
10354 				_add(_draggablesByScope, scope, dd);
10355 			}
10356 			
10357 			_draggablesById[id] = dd;			
10358 			
10359 			_attachListeners(dd, options, ddEvents);
10360 		},
10361 		
10362 		initDroppable : function(el, options) {
10363 			var _opts = _getDDOptions(options),
10364 				id = jsPlumb.getId(el);
10365 			_opts.node = "#" + id;			
10366 			var dd = new Y.DD.Drop(_opts);
10367 			
10368 			_droppableOptions[id] = options;
10369 			
10370 			options = _extend({}, options);
10371 			var scope = options['scope'] || jsPlumb.Defaults.Scope;					
10372 			_droppableScopesById[id] = scope;
10373 			
10374 			options["drop:enter"] = jsPlumb.wrap(options["drop:enter"], function(e) {
10375 				if (e.drag.scope !== scope) return true;
10376 				_checkHover(el, true);
10377 			}, true);
10378 			options["drop:exit"] = jsPlumb.wrap(options["drop:exit"], function(e) {
10379 				_checkHover(el, false);
10380 			});
10381 			options["drop:hit"] = jsPlumb.wrap(options["drop:hit"], function(e) {
10382 				if (e.drag.scope !== scope) return true;
10383 				_checkHover(el, false);
10384 			}, true);
10385 			
10386 			_attachListeners(dd, options, ddEvents);
10387 		},
10388 		
10389 		isAlreadyDraggable : function(el) {
10390 			el = _getElementObject(el);
10391 			return el.hasClass("yui3-dd-draggable");
10392 		},
10393 		
10394 		isDragSupported : function(el) { return true; },		
10395 		isDropSupported : function(el) { return true; },										
10396 		removeClass : function(el, clazz) { 
10397 			jsPlumb.CurrentLibrary.getElementObject(el).removeClass(clazz); 
10398 		},		
10399 		removeElement : function(el) { _getElementObject(el).remove(); },
10400 		
10401 		setAttribute : function(el, attributeName, attributeValue) {
10402 			el.setAttribute(attributeName, attributeValue);
10403 		},
10404 		
10405 		/**
10406 		 * sets the draggable state for the given element
10407 		 */
10408 		setDraggable : function(el, draggable) {
10409 			var id = jsPlumb.getId(el),
10410 				dd = _draggablesById[id];
10411 			if (dd) dd.set("lock", !draggable);
10412 		},
10413 		
10414 		setDragScope : function(el, scope) {
10415 			var id = jsPlumb.getId(el),
10416 				dd = _draggablesById[id];
10417 			if (dd) dd.scope = scope;
10418 		},
10419 		
10420 		setOffset : function(el, o) {
10421 			el = _getElementObject(el);
10422 			el.set("top", o.top);
10423 			el.set("left", o.left);
10424 		},
10425 
10426         stopDrag : function() {
10427             Y.DD.DDM.stopDrag();
10428         },
10429 		
10430 		trigger : function(el, event, originalEvent) {
10431 			originalEvent.stopPropagation();
10432 			_getElementObject(el).simulate(event, {
10433 				pageX:originalEvent.pageX, 
10434 				pageY:originalEvent.pageY, 
10435 				clientX:originalEvent.clientX, 
10436 				clientY:originalEvent.clientY
10437 			});			
10438 		},
10439 		
10440 		/**
10441 		 * event unbinding wrapper.  
10442 		 */
10443 		unbind : function(el, event, callback) {
10444 			_getElementObject(el).detach(event, callback);
10445 		}
10446 	};				
10447 })();(function(){"undefined"==typeof Math.sgn&&(Math.sgn=function(a){return 0==a?0:0<a?1:-1});var m={subtract:function(a,b){return{x:a.x-b.x,y:a.y-b.y}},dotProduct:function(a,b){return a.x*b.x+a.y*b.y},square:function(a){return Math.sqrt(a.x*a.x+a.y*a.y)},scale:function(a,b){return{x:a.x*b,y:a.y*b}}},w=Math.pow(2,-65),u=function(a,b){for(var f=[],d=b.length-1,h=2*d-1,g=[],c=[],k=[],i=[],l=[[1,0.6,0.3,0.1],[0.4,0.6,0.6,0.4],[0.1,0.3,0.6,1]],e=0;e<=d;e++)g[e]=m.subtract(b[e],a);for(e=0;e<=d-1;e++){c[e]=
10448 m.subtract(b[e+1],b[e]);c[e]=m.scale(c[e],3)}for(e=0;e<=d-1;e++)for(var n=0;n<=d;n++){k[e]||(k[e]=[]);k[e][n]=m.dotProduct(c[e],g[n])}for(e=0;e<=h;e++){i[e]||(i[e]=[]);i[e].y=0;i[e].x=parseFloat(e)/h}h=d-1;for(g=0;g<=d+h;g++){e=Math.max(0,g-h);for(c=Math.min(g,d);e<=c;e++){j=g-e;i[e+j].y=i[e+j].y+k[j][e]*l[j][e]}}d=b.length-1;i=r(i,2*d-1,f,0);h=m.subtract(a,b[0]);k=m.square(h);for(e=l=0;e<i;e++){h=m.subtract(a,s(b,d,f[e],null,null));h=m.square(h);if(h<k){k=h;l=f[e]}}h=m.subtract(a,b[d]);h=m.square(h);
10449 if(h<k){k=h;l=1}return{location:l,distance:k}},r=function(a,b,f,d){var h=[],g=[],c=[],k=[],i=0,l,e;e=Math.sgn(a[0].y);for(var n=1;n<=b;n++){l=Math.sgn(a[n].y);l!=e&&i++;e=l}switch(i){case 0:return 0;case 1:if(d>=64){f[0]=(a[0].x+a[b].x)/2;return 1}var o,i=a[0].y-a[b].y;e=a[b].x-a[0].x;n=a[0].x*a[b].y-a[b].x*a[0].y;l=max_distance_below=0;for(o=1;o<b;o++){var m=i*a[o].x+e*a[o].y+n;m>l?l=m:m<max_distance_below&&(max_distance_below=m)}o=e;l=(1*(n-l)-o*0)*(1/(0*o-i*1));o=e;e=n-max_distance_below;i=(1*
10450 e-o*0)*(1/(0*o-i*1));e=Math.min(l,i);if(Math.max(l,i)-e<w){c=a[b].x-a[0].x;k=a[b].y-a[0].y;f[0]=0+1*(c*(a[0].y-0)-k*(a[0].x-0))*(1/(c*0-k*1));return 1}}s(a,b,0.5,h,g);a=r(h,b,c,d+1);b=r(g,b,k,d+1);for(d=0;d<a;d++)f[d]=c[d];for(d=0;d<b;d++)f[d+a]=k[d];return a+b},s=function(a,b,f,d,h){for(var g=[[]],c=0;c<=b;c++)g[0][c]=a[c];for(a=1;a<=b;a++)for(c=0;c<=b-a;c++){g[a]||(g[a]=[]);g[a][c]||(g[a][c]={});g[a][c].x=(1-f)*g[a-1][c].x+f*g[a-1][c+1].x;g[a][c].y=(1-f)*g[a-1][c].y+f*g[a-1][c+1].y}if(d!=null)for(c=
10451 0;c<=b;c++)d[c]=g[c][0];if(h!=null)for(c=0;c<=b;c++)h[c]=g[b-c][c];return g[b][0]},v={},x=function(a){var b=v[a];if(!b){var b=[],f=function(a){return function(){return a}},d=function(){return function(a){return a}},h=function(){return function(a){return 1-a}},g=function(a){return function(b){for(var c=1,d=0;d<a.length;d++)c=c*a[d](b);return c}};b.push(new function(){return function(b){return Math.pow(b,a)}});for(var c=1;c<a;c++){for(var k=[new f(a)],i=0;i<a-c;i++)k.push(new d);for(i=0;i<c;i++)k.push(new h);
10452 b.push(new g(k))}b.push(new function(){return function(b){return Math.pow(1-b,a)}});v[a]=b}return b},p=function(a,b){for(var f=x(a.length-1),d=0,h=0,g=0;g<a.length;g++){d=d+a[g].x*f[g](b);h=h+a[g].y*f[g](b)}return{x:d,y:h}},q=function(a,b,f){for(var d=p(a,b),h=0,g=f>0?1:-1,c=null;h<Math.abs(f);){b=b+0.005*g;c=p(a,b);h=h+Math.sqrt(Math.pow(c.x-d.x,2)+Math.pow(c.y-d.y,2));d=c}return{point:c,location:b}},t=function(a,b){var f=p(a,b),d=p(a.slice(0,a.length-1),b),h=d.y-f.y,f=d.x-f.x;return h==0?Infinity:
10453 Math.atan(h/f)};window.jsBezier={distanceFromCurve:u,gradientAtPoint:t,gradientAtPointAlongCurveFrom:function(a,b,f){b=q(a,b,f);if(b.location>1)b.location=1;if(b.location<0)b.location=0;return t(a,b.location)},nearestPointOnCurve:function(a,b){var f=u(a,b);return{point:s(b,b.length-1,f.location,null,null),location:f.location}},pointOnCurve:p,pointAlongCurveFrom:function(a,b,f){return q(a,b,f).point},perpendicularToCurveAt:function(a,b,f,d){b=q(a,b,d==null?0:d);a=t(a,b.location);d=Math.atan(-1/a);
10454 a=f/2*Math.sin(d);f=f/2*Math.cos(d);return[{x:b.point.x+f,y:b.point.y+a},{x:b.point.x-f,y:b.point.y-a}]},locationAlongCurveFrom:function(a,b,f){return q(a,b,f).location}}})();
